You really didn't pull any punches, man this game is HARD.COMMENT_END", "Okay, you can take your freakin lazers and just walk to round 3! This is such a rage inducing game but I can't stop playing it! Not sure if you are aware, on level 4 it was taking me so long to complete that the music stopped playing. You know like at a party when they turn the lights on saying hey get out of here already! hahaCOMMENT_END", "1. I'm loving the neon retro art (show me how you did it plzplz, especially how you got the colours around the edges. did you just paint the whole thing and import it as a single sprite?)COMMENT_END", 'Simple yet effectively fun platformer! Loved playing through it, and your level design was fantastic! That last level especially oh man, that one was toughCOMMENT_END', 'Really well made, great workCOMMENT_END', "A neat neon platformer! I had a little trouble getting the timing right on some of the jumps (I fear I make a bad coyote) but had a good time with the game overall! I can't wait to see how you develop this further!COMMENT_END", 'This was incredibly addicting. it had the right amount of progressive difficulty. \xa0 I really enjoyed itCOMMENT_END', 'This is peak! I could learn so much from this.. You made your mechanics so well and it was very easy to pick up and play. It was fun and tricky, but not to overwhealming. Looking forward to your progress! :DCOMMENT_END', 'COMMENT_END', 'I ragequitted on the 4 level i thinkBut i liked itCOMMENT_END', 'love it brainfart! dont really know what the secondary mechanic is, but i love the smooth movement and the lasers!COMMENT_END', 'The colors and particle effect was fun! The platforming too! Struggled with laser timings but that is a gamer skill issue lol.COMMENT_END', 'Oooh really tough but thrilling game! The mechanics work like a dream.Not a big point, but I love the colors of the walls.COMMENT_END', 'Cool platformer, lasers felt annoying in some levels but overall its good and engaging.COMMENT_END', 'Great platformer, love the mechanics and the art design. The game feels a little bit hard. The jump timing, the windows between laser beams, and the time you have after deactivating lasers all feel very tight. But overall, very good game.COMMENT_END', 'Great platformer! And epic music to accompany :)COMMENT_END', "Great level design and fun (and a little rage inducing) to play. Made it through til the end.  I liked how far you could jump if you held space, it made for some cool level design that wouldn't been possible otherwise, and since you have the variable jump it didn't feel floaty. Three things I wished improved was:1. Make the respawn a bit quicker2. A little flash or something to let you know that the laser is turning on again (like 0.5s before it starts killing you)3. Make it so if you are standing still on a button the laser doesn't reactivate (currently you have to exit and reenter it for it to not start again, which is completely understandable from a programming perspective, but it felt illogical in game)COMMENT_END", 'It was tough, but enjoyable. I felt like the character moved master horizontally than vertically, which was uniqueCOMMENT_END', "Good job on aesthetics, learning curve, and game in general. The final level was satisfyingly hard. One remark is, since up key isn't used you could have used it for jump.COMMENT_END", 'That was fun :)COMMENT_END', "Love the ambience of this game! I'm not great\xa0at platformers, but I kept playing for as long as I could to try beat it! Didn't get very far, but still enjoyed it! Really amazing entry!COMMENT_END", "Nice platformer! The minimalist art is quite stylish with the colors and the bloom. I managed to get to level 11 (out of 12?). On that note it might be nice to number the levels, if it's an arcade-style game. Also the menu font could be made more easily readable.COMMENT_END", 'Finally got around to your game. The mechanics are spot on and fit the prompt and knocked it out in the judging criteria. A good set of puzzle levels to work through. Could see this expanded with more level items. Awesome game!COMMENT_END', "I managed to complete all of the levels and it's great that you made so many and they are all really well designed. I\xa0like that it automatically saves the progress that you made too and that you can choose to revisit previous ones.\xa0 Also your\xa0moving lasers are awesome! Not sure if anyone has mentioned it or not\xa0but I did notice the music stopped loopingCOMMENT_END", 'Very fun, difficult, and amazing visuals! There were some times where the jumping felta littleoff, but other than that I\xa0have no complaints!COMMENT_END', 'Super super fun and stylistic game. Hyper-focused mechanics and levels designed with solely those mechanics in mind. Visuals and colors are both pleasing and efficient. Killer music and atmosphere. And most importantly to me, a fun and challenging game. Well done!!!COMMENT_END', "Easily one of the most polished games I've played so far and one of my favorites as well too.\xa0\xa0Great looking, great sounding, and challenging, but not impossible.\xa0\xa0This one's a winner.COMMENT_END", "Amazing game! Loved the tricky puzzles. It felt like I was fighting with the lasers a lot of the time, but that's the fun of the game. I would love to see this continued.COMMENT_END", "I'll be honest, I would have preferred a full jump instead of a variable jump. I felt like I\xa0was fighting it the whole time. Otherwise, this was a great game! Challenging platformer.COMMENT_END", 'Gameplay was really intense. I never seen such mechanics, but i really enjoyed playing it. Very unique style of level design and use of movement. Really good game. One of my favourites!COMMENT_END', 'This game made me break my monitorCOMMENT_END', "Wow. Just... wow. This game has changed my life. I laughed, I cried, I transcended. My cat even started playing, and now she's better than me. 11/10, would play again forever. Critics are calling it 'the Citizen Kane of rage inducing platformer\xa0games.' A true masterpiece that has set the bar for all future games. Bravo, me. Bravo. ð\x9f\x98¤â\x9c¨COMMENT_END", 'A simple and understandable game in a good sense, good workCOMMENT_END', 'Very cool game!Rage inducing difficulty of the levels kept me wanting to complete it.The retro art looks nice and the music has a good beat, with a\xa0sense of urgency; both compliment the style of game well.Overall the mechanics align with the Jam Task well.Great job!COMMENT_END', "The levels are mostly well paced and provide a good sense of progression. Jumping feels a little too floaty but that doesn't hurt the movement too much. The player seems to stick to walls and ceilings, that did get on my nerves a little bit.COMMENT_END", 'Neat little game, I will leave more feedback for you on Discord. Great job.COMMENT_END']

['its nice and engaging game. loved the mechanics.COMMENT_END', "I've been playing this for the last 20 minutes!! Really fun puzzle game! I agree with what other people have said about the switching the dice location quality of life changes. Apart from that, love it!\xa0Would love to see how this game progresses if you choose to develop it further!COMMENT_END", "Quite enjoy waking up doing a bit of math! it's puzzly although I find a lot fo the time using + and - is just easiest (or even ptuting in the number themselves works! (i feel like should have to do a formula)COMMENT_END", "Really fun math puzzley game! The fact that this is your first game is crazy, great job! I like the mechanics of it in general and the upgrading between waves is really nice and adds more depth to the game. I kinda wish the special attacks refreshed after each round instead of being single use, cuz I found the game pretty tough with the death counter always coming for me. I ended up dying on wave 4 due to the death counter. It'd be nice if you could drag the dice back to any slot instead of the one the originally came from, I was trying to experiment and see what I could do with my dice and then it's kinda hard to drag them back to their spot and I didn't want to press R to put them all back. Great job on this tho it's really cool.COMMENT_END", "Just Wow. The gameplay is really fun and with some polishing it could really be an incredible game. Didn't had any major issue or issues at all tbh. Some quality of life like the ability to exchange 2 dices location without having to put one in another blank space.COMMENT_END", 'This game had a bit of a learning curve but once I got the hang of it it was really fun! At times it was a little annoying to try and return specific dice to their starting spots, maybe consider letting the player right click a block to automatically return it to the set. Overall great game!COMMENT_END', 'This game made me feel really stupid.... and then really clever.... and then really stupid again ð\x9f\x98\x85. It was fun and engaging and I spent quite a bit of time on it. Unfortunatly my best run was cut short because i clicked the "PEDMAS" title, not realising it would send me back to the menu!COMMENT_END', 'Wow, what a fun math puzzle game. Very well done. I think you got the core and secondary mechanics working together real well and they worked together to help defeat the enemy. Well done!COMMENT_END', 'Somehow turns math into a really fun and\xa0difficult strategy game! Found myself playing it for way longer than I thought I would.\xa0 The special abilities were fun\xa0and really spiced things up.COMMENT_END', "I really suck at coming up with equations to generate a number which made the game quite tedious to play, but that was on the tin so can't dock points for that. The UI elements, which makes up most of the game, were rather generic and could use some sprucing up if it were to go into real development.COMMENT_END", 'i was scared there was gonna be integration in higher levels,it was really funCOMMENT_END', 'I had a lot of fun playing! It would be nice to see more complex math in higher levelsCOMMENT_END', 'Very addictive.  with some QoL updates, it could be a banger!COMMENT_END', 'This is a pretty damn good entry. Though my brain would always shut off when quizes had these mathematical combinatorics games, I gave it a real try and was surprised at managing to match all the numbers. Well, all until wave 4 where I gave up as it is not my type of game, but pretty good work. One tip, I would recommend to put credits on the game page\xa0so people are aware where the graphics are from, some jammers may get annoyed whet that is missing.COMMENT_END', 'Wow this was super duper fun! I ended up playing a lot longer than I intended to but I think you have a great couple mechanics working very well together here. The UI had a few bugs here and there but with some touch ups and polish (and added music) this would be absolutely perfect!COMMENT_END', 'Accidentally commented in the construct jam first lol. Anyway, missed games like these. Nice work!COMMENT_END', 'This was sooo cool. I\xa0have visions of a blockbuster AAA title in your future with ideas like this.COMMENT_END', "Cool game! At first I was a bit weary I'm not going to lie, but I had a lot of fun when I actually got into it! It really made me want to hold on to some of my numbers like my life depended on it lol.\xa0(2, my beloved) Anyways, good job!COMMENT_END", 'Nice math game! Makes me think of computer labs in school growing up and getting to play something like this.COMMENT_END', 'i like this.. seems like a fun way for school kids to learn basic math skills..COMMENT_END', 'Nice game. As a quality-of-life feature I would suggest that dragging a number back to the top to an invalid slot should automatically move it to a valid slot (say, the first empty valid slot, or the closest valid empty slot). Also, you could have a "clear" button to restart your current turn.COMMENT_END', 'Well done! I enjoyed it! :DCOMMENT_END']

["What a clever and original game.\xa0 I loved it. \xa0One thought, I would start with easier colors to make.\xa0 But still, this was awesome.\xa0\xa0One of my favorites. \xa0Can't wait to see what you do with it next.COMMENT_END", 'The idea for this game is great! Had a good time playing this!COMMENT_END', 'Absolutely loved this!! Super relaxing, and super fun!! I could have probably ended up playing this for hours, would love to see this developed further!COMMENT_END', 'Great game! Easy to understand, super hard to complete. Best kind of gameCOMMENT_END', 'Dat is a unique idea! NOT the easiest oneCOMMENT_END', 'Very nice and unique concept! Well done! :DCOMMENT_END', "Very fun game, I actually ended up spending a long time trying to get these damned colors to fit together. I saw that you intend on working on the difficulty curve, which would be great because, I'm no artist, and right now this game is HARD man.COMMENT_END", 'It was fun trying to mix the colors, my kid liked the guy in the picture. I\xa0had a lot of fun playing this game, well done.COMMENT_END', "Fun game but really hard, maybe i'm not good with color decomposition :DCOMMENT_END", "This was fun, I learned that I am good at getting close to making the right color but I am always like 1 off lol. Idk if it'd make it too easy, but I found myself wishing I could remove the color I just mixed in when I saw what the result was and I was clearly not going in the right direction. Great work on this!COMMENT_END", 'Finally! My random knowledge of color mixing is useful! Although, my knowledge seems to be lacking to a substantial degree. I really love games that choose to become some really out there niche type of gameplay. This game is a certified banger!COMMENT_END', 'At first, the controls seemed a bit too fast. However, after some playtime, they felt really fun. I enjoyed grabbing the colors and quickly dragging them around. A timer and score system would add a lot to this game. I hope you continue to develop it—great job!COMMENT_END', 'Very interesting game\xa0!\xa0 Sometimes it is super easy, sometimes very hard. I have no idea how you make mud ! )))COMMENT_END', 'I practically failed colour theory at age 16, so this was a bit of a struggle. Once I got a bit warmed up with the controls and mechanics it paced well but there was a real lack of progression. No clue why the colours had the names over them if there are only the main big colours that everyoneshouldknow.COMMENT_END', 'I actually really liked mixing colors together to make complicated combitations and wishing I get them right.\xa0I really want to see this game\xa0grow and get more meta gaming like story and more polished graphics. I can actually see this being a cozy full-priced\xa0indie game some day, inform me when that happens pls.COMMENT_END', 'I enjoyed playing it. Im not that good in color theory, but i got some good win streak. Mechanics are implemented very well. Nice game!COMMENT_END', "I really dug this game. it feels very clean and sophisticated, with the nice groovy bassline and primary colors floating around. It was also educational - I never knew what colors made up copper, now I do! Very cool. The tank controls were a bit jarring to use at first, but it's an interesting mix of styles. I would guess that building this game is a good\xa0learning experience as well.COMMENT_END", "I really dug this game. it feels very clean and sophisticated, with the nice groovy bassline and primary colors floating around. It was also educational - I never knew what colors made up copper, now I do! Very cool. The tank controls were a bit jarring to use at first, but it's an interesting mix of styles. I would guess that building this game is a good\xa0learning experience as well.COMMENT_END", 'Great concept! As an artist, love a game just about mixing colors. (As a partially colorblind person tho.. ð\x9f\x98\xad)COMMENT_END', "Game worked well, and didn't feel too easy or hard. I love the detail with giving the colours names. But I had a bug where if I picked up the colour at the deposit box, I had to leave and then enter again for it to drop of the colour.COMMENT_END", 'I like the idea, but I wish that there was something that said what colors you use to make some of the more complex colors, like burnt siennaCOMMENT_END', 'I noticed that I am not good with colors lol. It was fun and addictive tho, well done!COMMENT_END']

['I like playing, though I wish that there was more variety. This walruses !COMMENT_END', 'COMMENT_END', "The art style is really nice!\xa0Works well as an endless runner, I was\xa0a little too impatient tho and killed myself repeatedly with the dash\xa0:')COMMENT_END", "Endless runners are my weakness, they're so fun and easy. The mechanics were really well implemented. Very cool!COMMENT_END']

["This game was awesome. I really like the fast movement and once I got a hang of the controls it was really fun to use both dashes to navigate the levels. Great job on the art and effects too the game looks really nice. I like that it got pretty challenging towards the end too, would've been nice if there were some optional collectibles that really cranked up the difficulty. I beat the game in 450sec, great work on this!COMMENT_END", 'Nice entry, i had some difficulties with understanding for which things I should boost, and i got myself softlocked in the later level (it had bright surroundings, i think it was thime cathedral or something). Before the level started, where the countdown happened, i pressed left mouse button a couple of times so when the level started i was already in mid air falling to my death. Unfortunetly it saved when i was falling, so i couldnt recover myself.Other than that a great entry, good job!COMMENT_END', 'Very nice looking and nice mechanics.the secondary dash feels a bit unnecessarily tricky imho, but i get the idea :)COMMENT_END', 'Super fun to play on stream.\xa0 Overall game design?\xa0 Top notch.\xa0\xa0I love the visual design and the audio.COMMENT_END', 'This is a very challenging platformer. I really like the idea (as you can see from my game, I also implemented a dash mechanic) but I found the mouse control a little confusing and overall a little to difficult given the speed and tight expectations to make some jumps. I think its a difficult problem because I also tried allowing players to aim with the mouse and then decided to backtrack it so itâ\x80\x99s all keyboard based. I saw you played mine and you seemed to like the mechanics, Iâ\x80\x99d love to hear more of your thoughts on my control scheme. Iâ\x80\x99m still debating and may change it for next round if I make it.COMMENT_END', 'Such a good game, feels very polished. Well done :DCOMMENT_END', "It's gorgeous!\xa0Feels very unique to control.COMMENT_END", 'Well made game, I enjoyed itCOMMENT_END', 'This is an example of a submission of the first round man, this game is perfection!COMMENT_END', 'COMMENT_END', "Very juicy abilities, love the speed/distance trade off. Good length for a jam game too, didn't feel too long.COMMENT_END", 'One of the best games ever.COMMENT_END', 'First off, this game is hard, but very rewarding once you get the hang of it. Very well designed levels, gameplay-wise and art-wise.COMMENT_END', 'Best I could do after some attempts is 186COMMENT_END', "neat game visually speaking it's eye catching. the gameplay is superb tho Im not very good at the no movement mechanics of it. also sometimes if you got too close in a wall the projectile you spawned will get destroyed so leaving stuck in a wall. like step sis. (sorry, I had to say it.)my only suggestion is that the text could do a bit more fixing since it feels like its blending with the background its hard to see it sometimes. too many bright things.COMMENT_END", 'Yoo, for sure 5 out 5. Controls are very smooth (i needed some time to figured it out how they work, but then i was destroying those level :). Levels was really well made. they are so different and yet interseting. It was a challenging experience and i really enjoyed playing it. Well done!COMMENT_END', "My current favorite. It's already amazingly polished, the movement is satisfying, the gameplay is polished, and it felt great finally learning the controls. It definitely had a learning curve, but that's not a bad thing. You definitely outdid all of us :DCOMMENT_END", 'The controls feel familiar yet fresh, which is hard to come by for platformers. Although, It took almost until the end of the jungle level before I properly understood the controls. The gameplay was really fun!COMMENT_END', "don't understand this time patroller plot but the game is great with cool graphism .the mechanics are fun and makes the game fast and dynamicCOMMENT_END", 'neat game with cool a fun mechanic. its a bit hard to play on a laptop without a mouse, thoughCOMMENT_END', 'Maybe unusual to start my comments here, but I loved the sound of it - it really enhanced the game play.\xa0\xa0Movement also felt incredibly smooth and reactive. \xa0Interesting mechanics and tricky levels.\xa0 Maybe a bit too tricky for me at the beginning (I wish it was easier for longer). \xa0Still, this is a great game and I hope you get to continue with it.COMMENT_END', 'What a fun concept. I liked the mechanics and the puzzle levels. Had to get used to the movement a lot but it was a really fun game.COMMENT_END', 'I had a lot of fun playing the game! Once I got the hang of the controls, it was fun to zip aroundCOMMENT_END', "Very cool and unique combination of movement mechanics. Your usage of environmental objects like the light blue thingies and the cracks were really great for making the world rich, colorful, and allowing for extra jumps/ cool stunt opportunities.I felt that maybe the camera might be a *bit* too jittery? Maybe I'm wrong, I love how fast it feels, but sometimes it feels difficult to read the text on screen because its moving around too much. That being said, your color palette decisions are off the charts good. You have a great sense of style and platformer level building. Can't wait to see where this one goes!COMMENT_END"]

['This stole my attention and i think you own me a new mouse ð\x9f\x98\x85 I ended up playing this for quite a while and was on level 3000 by the end.COMMENT_END', 'This stole my attention and i think you own me a new mouse ð\x9f\x98\x85 I ended up playing this for quite a while and was on level 3000 by the end.COMMENT_END', 'Great game! \xa0I thought the mechanics were well-implanted and the flying was really smooth.\xa0 \xa0I liked collecting and it was challenging, but not too hard, to avoid the meteorites. \xa0Impressive amount of content for 2 weeks.\xa0 I hope you get to keep working on it.COMMENT_END', 'loved the game. it has nice elements like idle upgrades and then some exploring.\nenjoyed the game. Also it felt good dodging the asteroids and\xa0collecting the goodies, especially when there's\xa0a big bunch of diamonds together. Great work! Very addictive too!COMMENT_END', "Fun idea and a lot of good juice!\xa0I can see a lot potential for\xa0a further development as well. Maybe you could even\xa0take some inspiration from how papers please handles its level design?\xa0Also\xa0you could maybe add\xa0some breakable groceries as well since now I just threw everything to the bags as quickly as possible.\xa0But it's quite fun as it is too, so well done!COMMENT_END", "I played this game a lot during development and it's really addictive. The difficulty curve is perfect and the break system is just forgiving enough to give a moment of brief respite from the frantic clicking. Definitely one of my top picks for round 1COMMENT_END", 'Very nice! Would like to see this developed further!COMMENT_END', "yoooo this is a fantastic game. The music that gets faster and climbs in pitch toward the end, the art, the angry customers, it's all just so great. VERY nice work!COMMENT_END", 'Hmmmm.... i may have got a bit lost in playing this....COMMENT_END', 'Really impressed with how much you got into this game.\xa0\xa0Starting with an easy to follow tutorial - I wish more games had that (mine included). \xa0This was challenging, but fair and I really liked the upgrade system. \xa0Very well done.COMMENT_END', 'Well designed and cool game! Changing the tempo of music regarding the stress is clever move, good job!COMMENT_END']

['Cute prototype, it has potential. When harvesting the UI still said "plant seed". Also the mouse look sensitivity was too low for me.COMMENT_END', 'Living out my farming dreams!!COMMENT_END', "Wow! \xa0I can't believe you were able to create a 3d World with planting, growing, and economic system.\xa0\xa0 It was all so polished and professional. \xa0I wish there were more challenges to achieve, but this is an AMAZING start.\xa0\xa0Really well done!COMMENT_END", 'The aesthetic is pleasing and the game loop is cool, could definitely become addictive if developed further. Good job!COMMENT_END', 'Nice Game, the basics are there, need more polish.COMMENT_END', "This is a really cool start to a game, I love farming games so it's right up my alley. The graphics look really nice and it's fun to get rich selling stuff. It seems like there's no point to do anything besides grow peppers cuz they're cheapest and everything gave 15 coins when I sold it. Would love to see this expanded upon it's a great start!COMMENT_END", "The looks and feel of this game are really chill. I love the fast paced farming. I wanted to expand my greenhouse, hopefully that's in the works! Fun game. You did a great job of bringing the assets to life, making the first person control work really well for a farming game, etc. Nice work!COMMENT_END", 'This is a lovely relaxing game. I could see having the house full of books or photo albums to peruse while waiting for plants to grow.COMMENT_END', 'plantsw gameloved iti wish i can cook the veggiesi think im just hungry rnCOMMENT_END', 'Neat game. Like the aesthetics. One small problem, growing anything but peppers is a scam because everything sells for the same. Other than that, the gameplay has no issues. This game has some great potential.COMMENT_END', 'I loved the whole vibe of the game! Environment and art style are brilliant.COMMENT_END', 'Good foundation, I can see a lot of potential for a great farming sim here! As others have said the movement felt very crisp and good, though I think the farming loop could be elaborated on a little bit (maybe some additional steps in there, like having to water the crops, or fertilize, or both) but you may be planning that already. Either way, I look forward to seeing how this develops!COMMENT_END', 'I really liked the environment and the farming. Could see this becoming a fully fleshed out game.COMMENT_END', "A cozy experience. I don't think it was intended that the bean sells for the same amount as the peppers.COMMENT_END", "A really charming experience. Not much content yet, but I'm sure that'll be fixed with time.COMMENT_END", 'Wow you really catched a good vibe in this game! Loved it! Very chill to play after work. Be sure to notify me when this game is finished! :DCOMMENT_END', 'I sold all my furniture for 10 money to become a farmer and it payed off. It was enjoyable for a while, my only complaint is it seems some more expensive seeds grow into plants that give the same amount of money as corn (15), with bell peppers turning out to be most profitable, or am I missing something.COMMENT_END', "Was fun playing this on stream!\xa0 Had to call The Lady I Live With to help with beetroots.\xa0\xa0She's the green thumb, not me.\xa0 Anyways...COMMENT_END", 'Great work, the progression through the economy system is my favorite part. I can sit here and reinvest my crops all day. Its like stardew valley if it was\xa0first person. Looking forward to seeing updates to this!COMMENT_END', "Nice game! I love the environment, sound, and music. I think I've encountered a bug that prevents me from planting anything except bell peppers. I also spent a little time figuring out where I could plant seeds—itâ\x80\x99s a bit confusing to have tomato plants you canâ\x80\x99t harvest. But overall, very good job!COMMENT_END"]

["Great title. \xa0I'm impressed with how much you got into this game. \xa0I would love a tutorial to get me started (my game should have on too). \xa0But, overall this was fun and nicely polished for a prototype.COMMENT_END", 'This is great! Well doneCOMMENT_END', "Love your game so far. It's neat how your pumpkins ripen and are converted into a sort of a score at the end of the night. Game is a bit hard at the start, though. Would love to see this continue!COMMENT_END", "Fun game! Your gameplay loop is really nice and feed into itself very well, but I think it could afford to get more difficult as time progresses. I'd also like to see some sort of\xa0tooltip on the pumpkins to see what they do as it took me a little bit to figure out some of them. It's a really good base game though, kept me hooked for quite a while!COMMENT_END", 'This was a ton of fun. One bug I ran into, I think the health might have gone negative and I could not die. Other than that fantastic!COMMENT_END', 'Great theme and idea!COMMENT_END', "I really enjoyed this game. It's crazy to me that someone else thought of making a bullet hellish survivors type game mixed with a farming game and it's so different than mine still. I really liked planting my pumpkin seeds and having them help defend against the ghosts and shooty guys. Unfortunately I ran into a bug where my health bar was empty but I couldn't die so it just kept going forever, but I think my health bar became empty towards the end of night 3 with like 250 of the things harvesting pumpkins give you for my high score.COMMENT_END", "Great game! Loved the farming and mob wave mechanics. Very tough for me, I'll have to give it another few attempts.COMMENT_END", 'WOW AMAZING WORK! I love the cover art and the big pumpkins. Very fun and unique game! I would like to have some type of visual indication when I get hurt, also making the "monsters" disappear when daytime comes would be great!Good Job! :DCOMMENT_END', 'epicCOMMENT_END', "I really liked the concept of this game. I was terrified at first when I was just farming peacefully then i got ambushed by ghosts LOL. I kinda wish that the difficulty ramped up more slowly, but it's a prototype after all. Nice work!COMMENT_END", "Cool game! I like that it is basically a tower defense type of game but you kind of grow your tower (Pumpkin). The mechanics are very creative, and the art is very appealing. The suggestion I have is to make a separate UI counter for seed husk since it is not an item you can directly use. I also wish there was some text information explaining what your pumpkin does. You have many different kinds of pumpkins in the game, but in my mind they feel the same because I don't know their functions. Still a very great game - looking forward to this game being expanded in future rounds!COMMENT_END", 'Great submission! I was a little confused at first but the game was really goof for figuring new things out every time i played! Once i figured the loop out i was unstoppable! (untill i died). I played through a couple of times and got a little further each time. I think you said in a reply that you had lots of ideas and wanted to implement a shop system, I think this would be really good and build well on the core mechanics you have already implemented.I thoguht the pixel art was very nice. especially the vines wrapped around the health bar and the pumpkins. The effects of the seeds turning into pumpkins was very satisfying too, especially when you had a bunch of them and watched them all change in a row!The enemies that shot you had just the right level of frustrating behaviour. They always seemed to just dodge away, but it was really satisfying when i finally managed to group them all up and mow them down.The music was nice and fit the atmopshere well witout being distracting.COMMENT_END', 'niceCOMMENT_END', 'Trying this again after the immortal state is gone and it is quite tough trying to chase those eyes and dodge their attacks while also getting chased by ghosts lol. Fortunately though the attacks on holding LMB really helped this time and I could survive forever but had to stop at 393. The healing pumpkin really helps you survive, more so when getting a couple of them next to each others. I also agree with the suggestions below regarding knockbacks and peaceful morning. Very fun game! Good job!COMMENT_END', "rated it, reminds me of anime where he farm at day but go adventure at night. forgot the name tho, saw a bug, I cant die. I dont know how it happened maybe you forgot to put death state in some cases.all in all good mechanics. if you going to use other assets try to pick a color palette in Lospec and recolor the assets with it so it will be coherent with each other. or maybe thats you assets IDK, wish I can scroll up and down to pick the items inventory for quick access of it insteead of pressing key numbers. good take on the jam no doubt you're in top 50, would love to see this develop further, Good Luck! ð\x9f\x92\x96ð\x9f«¡ð\x9f\x92ªCOMMENT_END", "Lovely game - well done!! I think you nailed the two main mechanics. Only wished for the ghosts to disappear during the day, but that's me being a bad gamer HAHA Nice one!COMMENT_END", 'Wonderful game!COMMENT_END', 'Excellent work!COMMENT_END']

['Classic precision platformer. Good job buddy.COMMENT_END', '`The controls feel good. my only complaying is that the dash button wastes a dash doing nothing if you dont press a directional buttonCOMMENT_END', "Cute game. Is there only 1 level or I am so bad that can't reach that block?COMMENT_END", 'I accidentally left my comment on the actual game page lol my bad.\xa0But anyway:COMMENT_END', "Great platformer. The controls feel great and I can easily land on tiny platforms and go through tiny gaps. But I wish it had some checkpoints so I don't have to go back to the starting point every time I die. And I think the trail following the player flickers in the top left corner when you die? Not sure why. But still, very great job!COMMENT_END", 'Very cute little duck )COMMENT_END', 'This was a really fun platformer. I like the dash mechanic and the duck character is very cute. I like the challenge of the game, but some checkpoints would have been really nice for how punishing it is with all the single tile jumps you need to get the duck into. Overall really enjoyed this tho!COMMENT_END', 'Great platformer! Cool soundtrack, and the mechanics aligned with the Jam Task really well!DUCKCOMMENT_END', "That's the duck game :) The skill curve was a bit steep. I\xa0wish there was a closer checkpoint in level three near the one block gap. I fell there quite often and had to redo the level. Otherwise nice jump and run mechanics, and I think you\xa0also\xa0implemented coyote time.COMMENT_END", 'duck mentioned 10/10 (\xa0coyote jump/time is so nice)COMMENT_END', 'what the duckCOMMENT_END', 'Hey ducky! The jump and double jump feels great and the impact screen shake adds some pretty cool juice. I found the key binding for the dash to the down arrow a little confusing, but thatâ\x80\x99s easy to change; the issue I had is that I do not know why Iâ\x80\x99d use the dash given that itâ\x80\x99s not too long and I could probably reach most areas with the double jump instead of the dash; thatâ\x80\x99s something that may require some careful level design to create interesting puzzles. Great job overall.COMMENT_END', 'Great rage platformer. A lot of fun.COMMENT_END', 'This is Ducking Good! Well done! I love the weight of the duck :PCOMMENT_END', 'This game is just hardcore Celeste. No but seriously, I enjoyed platforming a lot!\xa0Good art, effects and music. Controls were also well done, even though my bad dashes frequently killed me I always felt like it was fair.COMMENT_END', 'This was fun. :) Good Job!COMMENT_END', 'loved the game. the controls are cool too.COMMENT_END', "Firstly, I love the duck. Also the controls feel really nice, and I especially love the effect when you land after a double jump, although it almost makes me wish the normal jump and dash also had a bit of juice. There were a few issues I had with the movement though.\xa0Firstly, fitting into one block gaps felt terrible there are a lot of them. Also, I think that the levels needed checkpoints. The music also looped over again with every death and together those made a rather grating experience. I also think the levels could have just been much shorter, as I would rather play 9 short levels than 3 long levels ten times out of ten. Since it's a game jam, not everybody will be willing to put the time and effort to be difficult or annoying games so I would highly recommend making them way easier than you may think they need to be. Also the jump pads don't allow you to double jump again and it feels like they should. I know I gave a lot of criticism but I did have a fun time, and if Rubber Ducky is coming back later I'd love to see some of this feedback taken into account. Great job & good luck!COMMENT_END", 'Rubber Ducky is my hero ngl(Love his little post-double jump ground pounds too)COMMENT_END', 'duckCOMMENT_END', 'Simple and cool! And you got duck too lol. Mechanics are smooth which is critic for platform games and liked the tail effect.COMMENT_END', 'Simple but very fun and challenging platformer!\xa0I really like the ground sprites!!!COMMENT_END', 'I like the feel of the dash.COMMENT_END', "The third level was already too hard for me and having to restart didn't help so I had to stop there, but this game is an achievement in atmosphere and cuteness, and I think animation+ctronols are smooth.COMMENT_END", 'An enjoyable platformer, love the character and\xa0the great music, and the effects when landing and when moving in the air are amazing.COMMENT_END']

["Very cool game concept and mechanics. It's a little tough, but maybe\xa0I'm just bad LOL. It would be cool to be able to rotate in either direction and to slow the initial game down a little. Great job though, really enjoyed it!COMMENT_END", "I unfortunately couldn't get past the first spikes as I have such a skill issue with precise games, so I probably missed entirely what the secondary mechanic was. The graphics were nice enough that I probably would've wanted to play more if I could've. Not going to say what the camera's problem was as everyone else has already said it.COMMENT_END", 'Very rage inducing but very very fun! the rotating effect is a lil much but Its cool!!COMMENT_END', 'Very dizzy now. Great game with good mechanics. Loved the winding up of the doors and the no spin zones mixed with the treadmills. Great game!COMMENT_END', "Great game! I couldn't play for too long because of the spinning, but had lots of fun!COMMENT_END", 'COMMENT_END', "This was so freakin' fun to play on stream.\xa0 I could see this being a fantastic game on mobile especially.COMMENT_END", 'Really clever and original idea. \xa0Definitely a dizzying. \xa0I started out okay, but it got too hard (for me) really fast. \xa0I think just spinning a little slower would help it (both for dizzy and skill). \xa0Still, it was very fun.COMMENT_END', 'Good job. I had fun.COMMENT_END', 'loved thistho the spinning made me dizzy a bit lolnice work man!i think our characater might wanna take some dizzy medicineCOMMENT_END', 'Are you crazy man? How did you come up with all these systems? I am sick of all the spinning, and each obstacle you threw my way kept me wanting to try even more! I was so close to giving up ALL THE TIME! But then you had a new way to interact with the game I was even more hooked!I had to stop on that winding path that I had to screw in 3-4\xa0 bulbs at the start to turn (Another genius interaction!!!) but then I reached the end, admittedly after taking my (spoon)sweet time, and the door was closed... that was my final moment :D Let me know if there is more or if someone actually streamed the next puzzles! Amazing game!COMMENT_END', 'Fun and interesting mechanic that was surprisingly challenging! Agreed with others that the camera spinning was a little offputting and made it difficult to look at and follow, but I really like the idea overallCOMMENT_END', 'I really enjoyed this one. It starts off so simple, but you really explored a lot of mechanics to ramp up the difficulty with the areas that lock your rotation and the timed gates and stuff. I really appreciated the generous checkpointing as well as I found the pretty tough. Great work on this I\xa0like it!COMMENT_END', "Was slightly nauseating but extremely fun! I didn't want to stop playing but I had to\xa0due to the spins getting to me. extremely fun and I could see this being fleshed out into a full game, good job!COMMENT_END", 'Great execution of the task! The camera spinning makes it a bit hard to look at thoughCOMMENT_END', 'This to me was a perfect submission for the criteria!\xa0 Really brilliant use of level design with simple and easy to grasp mechanics to make a game that I had a lot of fun with.\xa0 First all fives of the round for me!COMMENT_END', "I think I'm a little bit overspunð\x9f¤®COMMENT_END", 'Lets gooo 5 minutes before the bell rang!!!Its a great game a lot of spinning, looking forward to seeing how you expand this!!COMMENT_END', 'Great idea and great execution! I also agree that rotating the character would make the game more accessible, but this was a fun experience nonetheless.COMMENT_END', 'Banger game, but please just make the character rotate instead of the screen. I got nauseous playing for like 5 minutes. The core and secondary mechanic are super well implemented.\xa0Great job!!COMMENT_END']

game_title: A train where there are no problems
comments_raw: ["Clever use of mechanics.\xa0 I like how hitting A and D created a rhythm, like a train on tracks. \xa0I'm afraid I wasn't very good at this game, but I still enjoyed it.COMMENT_END", 'The game is true to form. Its a train. There are no problems. 10/10COMMENT_END', "I'm not good enough to win, but I'm good enough to rate. Well done!COMMENT_END", 'Victory! One question - who plants those trees on my tracks!?COMMENT_END', 'This was cool. It took me a bit to figure out you needed to alternate A and D rapidly to get going, but once I did it was smooth sailing. I like the art style, I\xa0think using the same base pixel size for the foreground and background would help it look a bit more cohesive. Nice work on this!COMMENT_END', "Cool mechanic! Reminds me of the Pokemon Stadium minigame -\xa0Run, Rattata, Run: Where you would have to mash a button then jump over the barriers. Similar concept, but implemented in an original way!I like the use of the mouse and keyboard, keeping both hands active.A bit of audio would tie it together nicely, but what you've submitted aligns with the task! Well done!COMMENT_END", 'COMMENT_END', 'Oh wow, I am not going to pretend that this was very fun but the creativity\xa0of mechanics was a joy.COMMENT_END', "Well, my fingers definitely got some exercise playing that ;P\xa0 It's a very minimalist game that succeeds in completing the first task, but I wonder how you'd expand on it?COMMENT_END", 'I struggled to start initially (took me 3 attempts to move at all). But otherwise the game is a nice clear piece of game design, with a distinct art style. Well done.COMMENT_END', 'Petition to replace the no internet dino game with thisCOMMENT_END', "Nice game! I love the 1 bit art style. I'm a sucker for minimalismCOMMENT_END", 'Interesting mechanic that worked well. I struggled to get the train moving but ended up in the flow of it. I got soooo close to the station, i could see the edge of it but ran out of fuel ð\x9f\x98\xadCOMMENT_END', 'Interesting mechanic that worked well. I struggled to get the train moving but ended up in the flow of it. I got soooo close to the station, i could see the edge of it but ran out of fuel ð\x9f\x98\xadCOMMENT_END', 'Really cool idea ! Artstyle is original and works well.COMMENT_END', "I like the art quite much, it's\xa0simple but has so much personality in it at the\xa0same time. I would like to see more games made with it!COMMENT_END", 'Cool and fun game. Spamming the keys with one hand and using the mouse to lift the trees and feed them to the train wore out my left hand.COMMENT_END', 'Very nice!\xa0 I like the simple Artstyle, reminds me of Minit :)COMMENT_END', 'Train!COMMENT_END', "Interesting art style. I like that you used the obstacles as fuel. The dragging feels smooth. I feel the two mechanics don't work so well together - I usually have to go really slowly to have time to remove the obstacles. Still, great job!COMMENT_END", "I wasn't very good at this game, but I\xa0enjoyed it! Occasionally I got random Game Overs when I don't think I\xa0did anything, possibly it was when I was dragging the trees to the train. Nice work!!COMMENT_END", 'I believe this game has potential, keep developing friend!COMMENT_END']

['Everithing from of this game is great!COMMENT_END', 'This is such a unique and interesting puzzle game. \xa0I was a little confused at first, but then as I got the hang of it, I really loved it. \xa0This is really great and I hope you get a chance to continue working on it.COMMENT_END', 'There is a bit of a learning curve but after that it is an incredibly fun game. The mechanics are all well done and the style is super charming. Congratulations on making a great game!COMMENT_END', 'At first I confused about how to play but it was fun to play and serving smooth gameplay. I also liked the animated part at start. Good job!COMMENT_END', 'Awesome game mechanics, that is really fun. Top marks for this. Also loved the art style.COMMENT_END', "I managed to softlock myself by running out of black holes to get stuff from, but that's mostly a me problem. Very cool game, and well polished. I just wished it was a bit easier.COMMENT_END", 'Very cool game. It took me a bit to figure out how everything worked, but I was able to win on my 3rd try I think it was. Once I realized you cold hold multiple things it was really fun to optimize getting the people their requests. Great job on this I really enjoyed playing thru it!COMMENT_END', 'fun concept and fun game, maybe make the mixing os a lil finicky but i love it!COMMENT_END', "This is a pretty unusual game. This is the first time I've seen such mechanics, and I really liked it. The art of the game is very cool)COMMENT_END", 'The art is very charming, the intro is very cool and sets a fun hook for the game. I agree with Loten about maybe breaking the tutorial a little but overall very interesting concept. I had some trouble where often I wanted to combine only two powder but 3 would combine instead. Maybe some cursor indicating what is going to combine may be an interesting helper to add.COMMENT_END', "Fun and addicting game! I'll have to come back to finish it after I'm done rating games. Your tutorial is quite intimidating. Consider teaching a little as the player plays, instead of giving all the info upfront. It made much more sense while playing, and I learned quickly. Fantastic job overall!COMMENT_END", 'Not smart enough for your game )COMMENT_END', 'The concept is something like an old flash game but with much better graphics. The intro and tutorial texts felt a bit too long, but the game was interesting non the less.COMMENT_END', "I like the idea of combining and selling stuff and art is\xa0cute! I especially like the animations. I encountered\xa0some technical issues tho. For example, the second time I relaunched the game I couldn't move at all. Also, I accidentally gave all my stuff away and was left with empty area. Luckily now I know what I did wrong (should've kept my black hole lol).COMMENT_END", 'This is such a cool game. At first I was completely confused, but once I got the hang of it it was amazing. The sound design is soooo cool as well. Love everything about this submission! So much potential in this game.COMMENT_END', 'The concept and visuals are very abstract!Really fun!COMMENT_END', "(Copy from game page)This was super fun!  The controls page was initially very intimidating, but it didn't take  too long to beat. Even in this short game you had a great sense of  progression and I could feel the pressure building as a played more, The  game became a manic scramble to keep producing black holes to keep up  my resources while fulfilling my orders. Had a great time! I'm not sure  how you'll expand this but this is a great little game!COMMENT_END", 'This is some very interesting concept.\xa0 I enjoyed going thru the portals and searching for the right objects. :)COMMENT_END']

['Wow, the effect when you rewind is super cool!This game makes me want to make a golf game myself, its so fun and simple to understand, I\xa0wish there was more!COMMENT_END', 'Really enjoyed this one :) I love the secondary mechanic of rewinding time and getting to play the shot over - if only it worked like that on the course... Nice job!COMMENT_END', "A simple golf-ish game, but for whatever reason my firefox really didn't like this game and lagged like hell after the second hole and it didn't get any better. NIce simple art style and audio, but in some spots it likes to loop infinitely if positioned perfectly at the hole.COMMENT_END", 'This was such a cool game idea. It was very fun to play. Good job!COMMENT_END', 'damn i love the concept.and i never realized i was so bad at golfCOMMENT_END', 'Great twist on the mini golf game. I thought I was cooked at the one shot hole until I rewinded at the right time. Very well done!COMMENT_END', 'I liked playing! fun mechanic.COMMENT_END', "I love mini-golf games..\xa0\xa0Also, really cool secondary mechanic. \xa0This was fun (especially dropping down to new levels). \xa0I'm not sure what to do on that third level though - I can't solve it.\xa0 I'm not sure if I'm doing something dumb or the game just hasn't been developed that far.\xa0 In any case, I would love to play more of it.COMMENT_END", 'Fun golf game! I like that my ball falls down to the next level once I get it in the hole. Makes for a good interpretation of the theme of progression!COMMENT_END', 'I think that both mechanics are very well combined here. I was interested in playing this gameCOMMENT_END', 'no way a golf game i really like golf games id say the game is pretty well executed the sense of progression really stands out and the mix between rewind and shooting ball does fit with each otherCOMMENT_END', 'This game gave me the "OH! I get it now!" feeling. Great job! The only bug I\xa0had was that it\'s pretty easy to clip out of bounds when rewinding near a corner. Great job!COMMENT_END']

['I love this concept! Found the controls quite difficult at first, and I think that it would be good to start the game off with a slower speed, to ease the player into the gameplay. Would love to see this developed further if you choose to keep working on it!! :)COMMENT_END', "I wasn't very good at it but it was fun and a great concept!\xa0 Good job!COMMENT_END", 'The "aiming" or just movement felt a bit weird, maybe floatly even. Idea was quite clear but as a person who hasn\'t interacted with sushi much I had some trouble understanding what went where, but it cleared after a few total failures. To me at least the game was a bit too fast, but that also cleared the further I went.COMMENT_END', 'I liked it a lot even tho I was having such a hard time lol. The art looks great and once you get the hang of it the game feels satisfying but early on ots pretty hard.COMMENT_END', "Took me a lot of tries to get used to the game. Maybe start off a little slower and have the belt slowly speed up to let the player get a chance to see what's going on and experiment a little. Other than that, I think the game has a lot of potential for future development.COMMENT_END", 'Cool concept, and a good start which can be expanded on!COMMENT_END', "Very cool concept took me a second to get used to the fact the mouse wasn't lined up with the chopsticks but the sensitivity helped a lot.COMMENT_END", "It's hard!\xa0Like real chopsticks! ) Very fun idea )COMMENT_END", 'Well done submitting!I struggled a bit to understand exactly what\xa0I had to do in the beginning, but picked it up after a few plays. The movement of the items seems fixed in\xa0acceleration, which made it difficult to hone in on the sushi. And the learning curve is much too fast to begin with. Slowing the train down drastically in the beginning would give the player a chance to grasp the mechanic, before then speeding it up over time.Definitely has potential, I hope to see more projects in the future!COMMENT_END', 'I liked the mechanics, it was challenging but fun.\xa0 Though I did have trouble with aiming, and it could use some sounds,\xa0it was a pretty good game!COMMENT_END', 'Hello! Was a bit of a challenge for me. But when I understood the task it was quite a fun. Aiming felt a bit weird, because at first I wanted to grab objects with chopsticks. Some sounds and background music would add a lot for this game. I liked it!COMMENT_END', "Cool concept, it took me a while to understand that I was losing (didn't notice the plate straight up) but it was very fun after I fully understood itCOMMENT_END", 'Great entry, thanks for submitting it.COMMENT_END', 'Hey I figured the primary mechanic is drag and drop and the progression is to meet the quota, but what is the secondary mechanic\xa0ð\x9f«COMMENT_END']

['A very good game! It is very easy to understand and the "in-game tutorial" is great. It was really easy to follow and things made sense.COMMENT_END', 'Skilled at developing and presenting mechanismsCOMMENT_END', 'I loved this game.\xa0\xa0Really fun, original, and clever. \xa0Awesome tutorial and great skill ramping - it started easy and then got more challenging. \xa0Hope you get to work on this more after the jam.COMMENT_END', 'This game was really fun, I love how well the progression felt being eased into everything before the chaos. Im not sure if i just didnt read something but im not sure what pressing the button does. despite that this game is amazing for the time given to make it, and its always good to see a fellow godot game developer. Keep up the good workCOMMENT_END', 'pretty enjoyable game!COMMENT_END', "5 stars across the board. This game is too addicting. It's like an insane nightmare factory Bop-It from Hell. The music loop is phenomenal as well. I couldn't stop bobbing my head.On a more serious note, the pace with which you introduced the various mechanics was masterful. I felt eased into the madness, and before I knew it, everything had crescendoed into a chaotic, fun mess. Amazing!COMMENT_END", 'Nice humor and progression. good job!COMMENT_END', "You have a gift for storytelling through gameplay, otherwise I wouldn't have patience to play until the end. Pretty much the most successful take on the theme that I've seen\xa0so far, I don't even know why it just feels that way. One issue is, I'm pretty sure I was able to use all the colors before learning them, which I shouldn't be able to if I understood the game's planned constraints. Still, that didn't hinder the awe of it.COMMENT_END", 'A strong sense of progression. Looking forward to become a boss one day!COMMENT_END', "Fun game! Though there could've been a bit more challenge near the end, as you can just hold shift and spam WASD and the arrow keys and it works out. Maybe having each day have a set goal could remedy that. Otherwise it was a fun fast-paced game!COMMENT_END", 'the game was fun.i like how it turns into a throwing simulator from a packaging simulatorCOMMENT_END', 'Itâ\x80\x99s fun concept. I enjoyed the gameCOMMENT_END', "I thought it was pretty fun, the music is scratching my brain in a way I didn't know I liked.\xa0 Only thing is I think maybe adding a penalty for pressing the wrong key would be nice cause I ended up just button mashing and got a high score of 89. So some way to punish that could be fun. All around though I think it's a solid game.COMMENT_END", 'COMMENT_END', 'This was fun, I love pushing arrow keys in sequence so this was right up my alley. I really enjoyed it once I had all the upgrades and could hold shift to go through the patterns really quick, I was so bad at the teal one every time. Great job on this, I got 140 boxes with a high score of 27.COMMENT_END', 'i smashed all my WASD keys and got 8 boxes done im proud of myselfloved it nice story telling with the background charactersnice work man!COMMENT_END', 'Really cool game ! Addictive and fun.\xa0 Well done!COMMENT_END']

['Cool mechanic you made! :DCOMMENT_END', 'I absolutely loved this game! \xa0Dice rolling is my jam (see my game). \xa0This was so much fun.\xa0\xa0I just want more. \xa0Perfect score!COMMENT_END', 'I completed this but the bandoleer came in clutch cause i made some _poor_ choiced before.COMMENT_END', 'Really great potential. Could probably be expanded upon very easily as a hobby project.COMMENT_END']

['Nice graphics and fulfills the task. Kinda addictive game, great job!COMMENT_END', "Love the retro style and the feeling you get when playing it! ["Great game! Wouldn't have minded some checkpoints thoCOMMENT_END", "Soo cool! It's a good idea and a great rage game :)COMMENT_END", 'Great rage game :) To keep my sanity I had to find another way to beat it. I ended up pushing into the left wall, waiting to be pushed out and then jumping and pushing left again to get on top of the next block in the wall, and climbing up all the way like that.COMMENT_END', "Very fun, but very tricky! I do think it's a little slippery, but thatdoesadd to the challenge of it. More levels in the future could be very fun to see.COMMENT_END", 'Very cool idea :)COMMENT_END', "I liked the mechanics a lot. I feel like they could use a bit more visual feedback (the bars are helpful but aren't particularly fun to look at, versus more elaborate player animation). However, your level building was great and progressed in difficulty the perfect amount. I enjoyed the tough deceleration and heavy feel of the droid. Very solid entry!COMMENT_END", 'COMMENT_END', 'Tough but fun to play - nice one. You definitely succeeded with your aim of inducing rage, but also satisfaction ;)COMMENT_END', 'Wish I could slow down a bit better :D I did notice a small bug that can be exploited, you can climb the big wall on the left to go all the way up, as the character clips on the "floor" of each wall block, allowing you to jump out of the block to the one above, if you wiggle at the right momentCOMMENT_END', 'Tough game because of how much the bot slid. The jump and hover mechanics were great and it was fun getting to the door at the top.COMMENT_END', 'This is another game that was really fun, but I was terrible at it.\xa0\xa0I really liked the mechanics and how the jump and hover could work together. \xa0Also, not a big thing, but I love the robot logo on your start screen.\xa0 Really well done game!COMMENT_END', 'I liked it, however, I fell down on the last jumpCOMMENT_END', "Got pretty far with my first try but had to rage quit after falling all the way down :') The hovering is just right amoung ot annoying, good level design also. Well done.COMMENT_END", "I really enjoyed playing thru this game. It does a good job of being a rage game without being crazy frustrating thanks to the hover mechanic. I think the controls are a bit slippery in terms of turning around or slowing yourself down when coming down from a hover, but maybe that's by design for the rage game. Great job on this it's a lot of fun!COMMENT_END", 'Really fun, also not much of a rage game since the boosters give you a sense of control yet it keeps it hard. Solid execution!COMMENT_END', 'Great mechanic, I see the potential to induce rage among those who progress far and have to restart (me included), but the sense of accomplishment is satisfying.COMMENT_END', "Cool mechanic. Allows for traversal and there are lots of opportunities to allow for even more progression via upgrades and stuff. It's tough! I got to the 3rd elevator platform a few times but just kept falling off :DWell done!COMMENT_END", "Great game overall! Didn't get very far, but it didn't take that much to see the potential. Gameplay feels good for the most part,\xa0but you need to spare a bit of patience. Not much else to say, keep up the good work!COMMENT_END", 'Hover was really tricky, but the resultant rage upon messing up made for a great sense of progression :)COMMENT_END']

["cool game , a little hard at first , (i wasn't expecting the geist to no clip through the walls\xa0to get me\xa0 in the 2nd level)COMMENT_END", "Very fun game like always, challenging as the spirits always\xa0 got me and won't say my death count... haha.COMMENT_END", "I'm so glad that you didn't have to restart the level every time you died, pretty sure I would've given up then. Love the atmosphere. The detection of the book feels a little bit off, and I need to try multiple times to attack. I am looking forward to seeing how you can expand this game.COMMENT_END', "First of all, I like the general atmosphere and art is well done. Don't mind the 14 deaths, I was testing to see if I can juke them, but yeah ended up using the psychic power to push them away. Good stuff. Well done!COMMENT_END", 'fun lil game! love the pixel art, it was a lil hard to understand but other than that great job!COMMENT_END', 'Great graphics! I had some issues trying to trigger the psychic power in the right place, and at one time when I was playing with WASD and Ctrl I ended up closing a bunch of browser tabs (Ctrl+W), so I switched  to using the arrow keys after that.COMMENT_END', 'As always, art, sound, and polish are incredible.\xa0 It took me a second to figure out how to play even with the instructions, but that might have just been a skill issue on my end haha.\xa0 Great job!COMMENT_END', 'Cool SFX!COMMENT_END', 'Yikes a jumpscare! ð\x9f\x98±COMMENT_END', 'This is super fun :) I think that if this were a movie the twist at the end would be that we were dead the whole time... at least after the first 10 seconds... Great work on this it's really cool!COMMENT_END", 'This is an incredible prototype. The only problem I\xa0can even think of is that some of the areas are wonky. Otherwise, great job! 10/10COMMENT_END', "This was really fun! I like how the level doesn't fully reset when you lose. The art and music were great and really fit the theme of the game!COMMENT_END", 'impressive that you made this in 2 weeks! good job!COMMENT_END', 'Glad to see some of your art back in this competition, looks really great. But I'm happy that the progress through a level doesn't reset after a death :D it does remove some of the fear of dying, but otherwise I don't think I would've finished the game.COMMENT_END", 'you scared me haha.My only complaint is that it is a bit hard to hit the stuff even if you think you are closeCOMMENT_END', "man the art is amazing! I want to live there if it wasn't for the ghosts (great design on their faces as well!)COMMENT_END", 'the art is really goodand i also liked repelling the ghost as it screamsCOMMENT_END', 'Very cool game concept, I like the mechanics you have in place a lot! With that fixed though (or maybe explained more, I could have been missing something) then I could see this being fantastic overall!COMMENT_END', "With 55 deaths I\xa0guess I've put some effort. It sure was clever decision to not reset level on death.COMMENT_END", 'As always, your art looks great. I might have to get my daughter to play this one and see if we can get some jump scares out of her. Fantastic job!COMMENT_END', 'interesting game! I already liked your games from last year, and this one catches that same vibe. I really ejoyed the experience.COMMENT_END']

Fun game!COMMENT_END', 'So cool to see you here on GDKO! This could save our children.COMMENT_END", 'This game was so awesome, so addictive, and super well-polished! The math was really cool, I love the loop of doing two kind of inverse mental calculations, it creates a nice ebb and flow that makes the game really rewarding and allows the player to develop that specific skill as they play, which is probably my favorite type of progression in a game. This game would probably be really successful in school systems. It makes math fun and who knows, maybe it\xa0improves mental calculation ability.COMMENT_END', 'This was much intense than i was expecting ð\x9f\x98\x85I kinda expected to play around with it for a couple of mins but ended up getting a bit too into it and genuinly feeling the pressure when i only had one heart left!COMMENT_END', 'imma give this to my future kid to learn mafsCOMMENT_END', 'What a good game!COMMENT_END', 'it is very cool. I will prompt too to do it like hungman, either to a more funny way or to more senssual way. eg. Add / subtract cloths. Neat twist on the calculator game. You not only have to calculate a number with limited options, you also have to solve an equation yourself by keying in the number with no help from said calculator. Unfortunately I am terrible at maths :(COMMENT_END', "I managed to get to the fifth opponent on the beginner\xa0mode. Your game is extremely well presented and doing math like this is fun. Having the attack and defence is a great mechanic especially as they were so different. It's also pretty cool having different opponents and the sounds are great!COMMENT_END", 'The game feels really polished and is fun. Would be cool to see the answer to equation we dont get right. Great game!COMMENT_END', 'Very well done! Now I have exam anxiety.COMMENT_END', 'Cool concepts and brilliant execution. Hope you develop it further!COMMENT_END', 'Even though it was difficult as hell to me(im dumb), I would love to recommend this to my freindCOMMENT_END', "This game was a lot of fun and it's really nice and polished. I think it would had been great to have something else to complement it instead of using it in two different ways, but I agree that you are actually asking the player to exercise two mechanics in their head :)COMMENT_END', 'This is a great game! Very highly polished, and fun! Made me realise that I am terrible at mental math lol.COMMENT_END', "Well done! You've definitely taken advantage of my ADHD and made me hyperfocus on math equations for far longer than any of my\xa0maths teachers ever could!Let me tell you, this game drew me in straight away and I played for 30 minutes before I realised there is no end\xa0:')COMMENT_END"]

['Simple and but fun mechanics. Iâ\x80\x99m looking forward to seeing where this goes. This has so much potential for future rounds.COMMENT_END', 'This is such a great idea! A lot of potential to explore with the 10 seconds, good Job. I definetly want to see you continue this game, because this can become a really nice puzzle game.As some others already stated, the blocks jitter a bit when moving with time, but thats not a big problem.COMMENT_END', '"Timmy the timer got taped to a time bomb" is hilarious opening but also\xa0sounded very promissing and\xa0I\xa0was sad that this angle wasn\'t exploited much (for example, when time runs out Timmy just get\'s knocked down but doesn\'t explode as promised). The gameplay is nice, I\'d get annoyed at games that reset every death but repeating the learned maneuvers was fun here so I managed to beat it after ~10 tries. Player\'s walk animation is adorable.COMMENT_END', 'It was extremely short but the mechanic were all there. Now just add more levels, maybe some enemies and you got yourself an interesting indie game. The art was simple enough to probably be able to produce them fast for a multitude of levels.COMMENT_END', 'I need tos ee this game in round 2 with more polish and stuff, great stuff hazmatt your games are always good!!COMMENT_END', "This is awesome. I really like the pause and rewind mechanics. Would love to play more of this and see what other ideas you could cook up for challenges or puzzles with the mechanics. I think a bit of a tutorial would've been good, took me a second to figure out what to do, but wasn't too bad once I read thru the instructions on the page lol. Great work!COMMENT_END", "That was awesome! I love the time control mechanic, there is so much potential with only have 10 seconds where all the level's objects are doing specific things on the timeline. Very very cool.I would say some really brief demonstration of the mechanic at the beginning (like a tutorial but just like... a 2 second animation or something demonstrating rather than a description tutorial) that would be cool. Also, if you can get the objects to move more smoothly through time, that would be nice. there's a little choppyness to their movement i noticed.As for the core and secondary mechanics, they're brilliant ideas. Keep going with it!COMMENT_END", 'I really like the platforming mechanics with the wall jump mix with the time manipulation mechanics. I think you nailed the prompt and all the judging criteria and want to see more of this game. Well done!COMMENT_END', 'awesome concept!would love to see this developed furthertook a while for me to get the hang of\xa0the mechanics but its pretty easy to understand reallyloved it! nice work man!yo can you make this work in real lifei need to reverse time so i can prevent myself eating that one chili the other dayCOMMENT_END', "I can't wait till the rest of the story, I need to know\xa0what happened to Timmy the Timer!COMMENT_END", "I'm not great at platformers and I was especially terrible at this one.\xa0\xa0I wish it started easier.\xa0\xa0I like the idea of it, but I could hardly progress with my skill level.COMMENT_END", 'This is a great idea, honestly love the time manipulation stuff like this! The time being on the character made it easy to see how close I was to losing. If I could rewind 10 seconds, I would write this review again!COMMENT_END', 'Love this game! It took me a second to understand the time warping but once I\xa0got it under control, it was fun!COMMENT_END', 'Super cool conceptCOMMENT_END', 'Very interesting time mechanic! And cute character design!COMMENT_END', 'I really like how the time mechanic!\xa0I see a lot of potential for future levels, and honestly I really hope you continue this projectCOMMENT_END']

['Such a nice duality between the two worlds! I probably spend so much time playing this (checking my last comment was 30 mins ago...\xa0) the music, the pacing, the SFX. Instead of making 2 mechanics you made two games!Stayed till the end to beat the boss. Congratulations on such a cool experience!COMMENT_END', 'This game was so fun and addictive! I would love to see you expand on the game.COMMENT_END', 'Amazing! Excelent gameplay loop!My only complaint is that the bullets feel "attached" to the player, as the bullets follows the player movement.are the bullets spawned as children of the ship?COMMENT_END', "Really felt like there could've been a range and a magnet ability for gems. Overall the farming felt a bit weaker compared to the main game where all of the progression was felt. The graphic styles were nice but a bit different from each other which looked a bit weird to my eye.COMMENT_END", 'Task: mechanics that complement each othernickbdawg: "what if I\xa0made two full games that complement each other?"COMMENT_END', 'Very interesting genre mash-up! Never seen anything like this!COMMENT_END', 'The mixed game modes worked really well. I had fun in both and can see a lot of potential in both areas. Really fun game.COMMENT_END', 'Fun game! I love the creative mechanics combinations. They work pretty well together. I feel that adding an attack range upgrade would be great for this game. Great job!"COMMENT_END', "a really well\xa0executed game for theme wise, tho there are lot of things to improve ,one of which are the controls.never mind the graphics and the audio it's not important, I think this is a well put together submission and would love to see this on 2nd round. job well done ð\x9f\x98\x8eð\x9f\x92ªCOMMENT_END", "Wow that was surprisingly addicting, my economy started\xa0to ramp up really fast once I got that third flower into my farm and it was fun to see how fast I started killing enemies once I\xa0got that going! One small thing I noticed (and I'm not sure if this was intentional or not) but the bullets I fired seemed to move with my character as I moved around instead of keeping their own trajectory in space.COMMENT_END", 'I felt so weak at the beginning and now little space enemies fear me (thanks to\xa0my amazing flower farm)!! Its a lot like stardew valley but space/bullet hell.COMMENT_END', 'that was really good,\xa0 the two game genres complement each others\xa0and \xa0the sensation of power in the end is great .COMMENT_END', "It's quite a nice game loop.\xa0 It was a game I wanted to keep playing.\xa0\xa0The frenetic space combat works well when juxtaposed with relaxing farming.\xa0 I could easily see this as a popular experience, if polished and developed enough.\xa0 Definitely a great start.\xa0 Good luck!COMMENT_END", 'Awesome game!!COMMENT_END', "It's a very exciting game. I liked the moments of fighting with aliens and the moments of peaceful gardeningCOMMENT_END", 'This game and its upgrading systems are actually fun, if this was a (reasonably priced) Steam game I would 100%\xa0buy it.\xa0I was having almost too much fun and spent a great amount of time playing the game. If you were ever up to updating it, I would maybe reconsider adding pick range and range updates at some point. But those were literally the only things I was missing, oh and I need\xa0more levels of course.COMMENT_END', 'Awesome!COMMENT_END', 'Real fun game and also one that kept me playing, only thing Id would change is the boss timer or make it an upgrade. I get that its for the end of the game but in a gamejam a lot of people will try and move on and it would be sad people miss out on that.Great job and curious to what youll do with it :)COMMENT_END', 'this one sticks out to me :) i had a pleasant experience. was confused when i got thrown into battle, but was able to figure it out.\xa0i love how far outside of the box you strayed to come up with a primary mechanic of cozy gardening and a secondary mechanic of deadly space battle and somehow they complement each other so well. that right there is a beautiful blend of creativity and capability. i hope you had fun making it :)COMMENT_END', 'I love everything about this. Good job!COMMENT_END', "I loved the crazy idea of combining a farming sim with bullet hell â\x80\x93 the unexpected pairing worked surprisingly well.\xa0 The initial feeling of powerlessness transitioning to unstoppable space farmer was incredibly satisfying.\xa0 However, I did notice the bullets felt a bit 'sticky' to the ship.Still, the overall concept is brilliant and genuinely innovative.. Fantastic work!COMMENT_END", "You have so\xa0much packed into this game. \xa0I was having fun shooting things and then suddenly it's like there is a whole other game going on back on the planet.\xa0 I'm not usually a huge fan of\xa0farming type games, but this was impressive.COMMENT_END", 'Fun feedback loop! The two activities complemented each other very well. I would have liked to see the total number of gems collected while still in the spaceship (number go up, feels good). Like others have mentioned the bullets being parented to the player is a bit strange/overpowered, and the WASD + Arrow keys controls are a bit awkward.COMMENT_END', "The 2 genres work quite well together. The only thing i have to note is, that in the bullet hell mode, the bullets seem to be moving with the player / enemies. This was quite weird at first.The farming was suprisingly strategic, that's a nice touch.COMMENT_END", 'I have to admit that bullet hell + farming simulator was not a combo I expected haha.\xa0 It was a lot of fun though!\xa0 Really solid job on this and impressive that your mechanics were so different.COMMENT_END', "I managed to defeat the boss, he was actually easier than I\xa0thought he would be but still pretty cool. Having the farming and the space battles is a great idea and there's definitely a lot of choices in the game which lead to progression. The space battle section is my favourite side of things and I liked that the ship had a magnetic field for drawing in the crystalsCOMMENT_END", 'Very fun game! I killed the boss :DCOMMENT_END', 'i liked it, it was a bullet hell, then turned to a FARMING GAME!\xa0hilarious, great game!COMMENT_END', 'I love the concept of this game. The space portion was like a more fast-paced, action-packed version of the mines in Stardew Valley. If asteroids, space stations, other ships were added to the space portions, this game could be a truly great "farm sim with spaceships".\xa0While your two dueling mechanics seem at odds, I think they pair together quite well. This is aided by the fact that you made farming more fast-paced and generous than in other farming sims (which is also great for a jam game).A very ambitious and exciting entry!COMMENT_END', 'COMMENT_END']

["You can't go wrong with an adorable character haha.\xa0 Good little game!\xa0 I thought your mechanics were clever and I'd like to see more!COMMENT_END", "Sir pebble sure went on an adventure. ['Felt a bit glitchy, maybe there is a some way to make the attacking smoother? Otherwise easy to understand the mechanics and I can see that if you would change some graphics this could be a pretty good game.COMMENT_END', 'Really fun game, I had a blast. Only thing is the first level was really long but after it started to be fun as hell. The map could maybe be a bit bigger or like an infinitly generating so that we can still move around as a big reaper but there is so many way this game could continue. Great job!COMMENT_END', 'great work. movement and attack animation are lit! concept is cool too. enjoyed the game.COMMENT_END', 'I liked this a lot!\xa0 Seems like a solid start to some kind of bullet-hell/Vampire Survivors style thing with a rogue-like progression thing going on.\xa0 One thing I\'d recommend in the future with this competition is to make the connection to the prompt as clear as possible.\xa0 I liked all the mechanics, but since there were several it was hard to know for sure what the primary and secondary were.\xa0 Even something in the description saying something like "I designed this with the idea of ___ as the primary mechanic and ____ as the secondary mechanic and added a few other things" could earn you some extra points.\xa0 Because of the way the rating works how clearly the prompt is followed can be worth more points than how good the game is.\xa0 Just a thought for next time!\xa0 I still really enjoyed it!COMMENT_END', 'Wow good job! :DCOMMENT_END', 'liked alot!nice work mandont grab my soul pls i need to sruvive till next gdko roundCOMMENT_END', 'I really like how easy it is to completely break this game. You can fire a wall of projectiles that nearly crashed my pc,\xa0cover every square inch with the giant player model, or even become faster than light. I love games where you can slowly build a powerful character, but I love games that skip the "slowly" part even more!COMMENT_END', 'My bias is that this game is freaking awesome because I get to play a reaper reaping souls. Loved this game so much. Only thing I\xa0can think of is that the first bit is really slow to get to the first upgrade.COMMENT_END', 'good idea, and a lot of room for development of the idea, continue!COMMENT_END', 'I enjoyed the game, but I found it to be slow in the beginning. Once I got a 2x soul upgrade, it went much faster.COMMENT_END', 'Fun game, but the player moves super slowly towards the beginning. Otherwise, i love it, very fun.COMMENT_END']
