['Size changing is a fantastic mechanic!\xa0 I could really see this being a larger puzzle game.\xa0 Great job!COMMENT_END', "Really like the idea you're going with here!COMMENT_END", 'Now I\xa0wanna be an electric shape changing cube when I grow up. ['5 stars for difficulty (lol).COMMENT_END', "Loved the puzzle! I\xa0was very confused but when\xa0I looked at the hints I kind of understood? ['I really enjoyed this once I got the hang of it :) Well done !COMMENT_END', 'kinda entertaining i guess. just maybe i didnt play it enough to understand the concept but it seemed to based off luckCOMMENT_END', "A really challenging, but really rewarding game. Haven't managed to win yet, but will keep trying!COMMENT_END", 'I really like the idea but I found the game a little too difficult. It may need a little more aid to help identify where things are. If you play minesweeper you donâ\x80\x99t get a single number, every time you uncover a spot you may get up to 8 adjacent numbers. Then you can use overlaps and the numbers to figure out safe spots. I started playing and I was lucky that I placed a box and I got a 0, then I was safely placing boxes on the 4 corners of each box, as if it was traditional minesweeper and that was a good strategy, I could not devise any other strategy otherwise. I may also recommend/ask if there was a way to start a level with at least one shape placed in a safe spot to have something to start with.COMMENT_END', 'Oooh, like minesweeper but tougher. Great game, very challenging.COMMENT_END', "This is a really cool idea. It's really challenging, need to go back and try again to see if I can win a round. Great job on this, I love minesweeper and it's cool to see such a unique spin on it.COMMENT_END", 'COMMENT_END', "Woah... I really loved this game, it's super hard but there are plenty of tools in the arsenal to figure it out. My personal favorite is the duck shaped detector.COMMENT_END", 'Great spin on Minesweeper. Although I had problems beating it :DCOMMENT_END', 'This is a really clever and unique take on MineSweeper. \xa0Much harder, but also much more rewarding.\xa0 Definitely one of my favorite games so far. \xa0Excellent!COMMENT_END', "Omg this is insanely good! What a great idea / execution, I had so much fun. Didn't win yet tho, I will definitely return to complete this\xa0after I've tried out all the other games.COMMENT_END", 'Very cool idea with a lot of potential! I found it a little too\xa0easy just to spam the extending rectangular shape to win. I would love to see this developed further with some balancing tweaks. Well done!COMMENT_END']

["i like the game , the game screen could be a little bigger , sometimes my mouse quit the game window which prevent me from\xa0\xa0moving properly . ['Fun experience that I was trying to beat over and over!COMMENT_END', "Deceptively challenging and surprisingly addictive! ['cool game. had fun playing it.COMMENT_END', 'Interesting spin on the move around and progress on the maps, just wish it had been a bit faster paced. ['very cute stealth concept. I hope to see moreCOMMENT_END', 'Cool game! pretty hard and didnt really know what Iwas looking for but once I saw the other frog I found it. We certainly have some similarities between our submissions :DCOMMENT_END", 'Add some comments to game description. Thank you for your feedback!COMMENT_END', "Cute game! I'm\xa0not\xa0sure\xa0if\xa0this\xa0is true,\xa0but\xa0it\xa0feels\xa0like\xa0the frog\xa0friend\xa0and\xa0the\xa0herons\xa0don't\xa0actually\xa0spawn until\xa0you croak. The\xa0two\xa0mechanics\xa0are required\xa0individually, but\xa0they\xa0don't\xa0feel like they're working together. That\xa0being\xa0said,\xa0your\xa0game\xa0is\xa0still\xa0great,\xa0and\xa0I\xa0apologize\xa0if\xa0I\xa0get\xa0anything\xa0wrong. I\xa0apologize\xa0for\xa0being\xa0a\xa0bit\xa0blunt\xa0with\xa0my\xa0criticism,\xa0by\xa0the\xa0way\xa0^^;COMMENT_END", 'COMMENT_END', "It was very difficult!\xa0 As soon as you've found the right direction, multiple herons quickly attack\xa0from different directions.\xa0 There's quite a delay between when you're able to jump, so you have no chance.\xa0 This is fortunately easy to fix.\xa0 Also, the game idea isn't bad at all, so it's worth improving on.COMMENT_END", 'The tough but fun. The Herons were very tough to avoid, especially since by the time I knew where they were, it was almost always too late to do anything about it. Got to my friend by luck though. Fun and cute game.COMMENT_END', '*Agent Her007n has arrived*COMMENT_END', 'didnt expect that joining this jam would get\xa0my pfp eaten by evil heronsVery well implemented i like the way you automatically put the player on the neares lilypad if we didnt land anyboth mechanics really fits the game themewell done!COMMENT_END', 'THE ART IS SO CUTE. The game is also quite intense, I quickly moved from sneaking around to just jumping around panicking. Could be a mini game in the next mario party.COMMENT_END', 'Art style is pretty cool reminiscent of old flash games. The one thing I would say is the camera control makes the game feel a little difficult to control. You need to use the mouse to jump but it also moves the camera around. Just feels a little bit awkward.COMMENT_END', "The game definitely has character, especially the art style. While it is challenging to get your jumps right at the beginning, as the game goes on you eventually get the hang of it, and that is satisfying. I liked how getting the jump right resulted in less of a cooldown before the next jump, making the escape from the airons (that's the name of the birds right?) especially rewarding.COMMENT_END", 'It took me a while but I finally found my frog friend!COMMENT_END', 'fun game, I love the art style!COMMENT_END', 'I love the art style. I have to agree with other comments that the game is a little bit hard. I sometimes get blocked by 3 herons, and maybe a visual indicator for how far herons can hear would be great. Still, I think the two mechanics work well. Great job!COMMENT_END', 'Suuuuper adorable gameLove ploppin around on lilypads.COMMENT_END', "i fed so many frogs to these Herons! I did feel an improvement after the 20th time but still I agree, it does feel a bit too hard. Don't get me wrong, I love the fact Herons attack when you make a noise, its great! But perhaps lowering their hearing area and/or attack area.COMMENT_END", 'Interesting gameplay, but it seemed a bit difficult to me. Change the style of the game a little and it will be possible to make a horror. Do not abandon the development of this project after Jam\xa0;)COMMENT_END', 'I really like the vibe and look of this game. The game is also well-designed, though difficult! When the herons were onto me it felt exactly like running from the cops\xa0in GTA. VERY nice work!COMMENT_END', 'This is great game. It took me while to figure out how to start game. It would be great multiplier game for two like tricking storks or if someone messed up the other one will be croak to save situation which will put him in danger.COMMENT_END', "I am terrible at this game, but that didn't stop me from enjoying it. \xa0Love the animations and sounds.\xa0\xa0I wish it was a little easier at the beginning - those herons got me every time.\xa0 Still, this was fun, while I lasted.COMMENT_END", "At first, I\xa0didn't fully get the concept and the alignment to the task... ['Loved the movement using the mouse! And it was really fun running away from the ghosts!! A great game!!COMMENT_END', 'The movement was a bit weird to figure out as further the mouse was from middle the faster you moved, but also, at least to me, it felt like horizontally moving was faster than vertical movement. Also also pressingANYbutton on your keyboard teleports you back, no clue why only space is mentioned as even numpad works.COMMENT_END', 'I\xa0absolutely loved the movement controller! this is so awesome!!!COMMENT_END', 'Well done! ['This is Path of Exile the Jam experience with its skill tree, I want to see what else you can do with this concept. I also like the auto-shooting, makes this feel like a rhythm game kinda.COMMENT_END', 'Why are there so many buttons if none of them do anything? There aren\'t even options available when the music isBLASTEDat maximum volume the moment you start the game. The upgrading system from the 15 minutes that I played didn\'t feel like progression at all. I didn\'t even know what any of them did or what I was supposed to upgrade besides health, but that is the default option tbh. In the arena itself there isn\'t really much to do besides spam infinite dodge and hope you do enough dmg before your "HP" runs out without actually taking any damage.The style was interesting but there wasn\'t much substance.COMMENT_END', 'This game is so awesome. It reminds me a lot of node buster which I also loved. Would 100% play more of this if you kept working on it or buy a full version if you ever made one. Love these kind of incremental games. Great work!COMMENT_END', 'Absolute Cinema ð\x9f¤\x9að\x9f\x98®â\x9c\x8bCOMMENT_END', 'AMAZINGCOMMENT_END', 'Wow fun game! Gameplay felt smooth, and the progression felt good - damage bumps were very noticeable as I\xa0got upgrades. It was a little confusing at first that hitting enemies was taking away from my health bar, but I was able to get the hang of it before long. The only issue I really ran into was the game slowing down as I\xa0got more upgrades - it seemed to freeze for a second or two when I was hitting enemies after I had a handful of upgrades.COMMENT_END', 'Looking forward to playing this once its finished! Wow amazing art and idea! :DCOMMENT_END', 'This is neat! I really liked that every time you do an attack it is a different attack from the last. It was a good twist on the autoshooter arena battler genre. I had a small problem where enemies would get stuck on the little rocks lol, but other than that little hiccup the game worked very well for me and was a good bit of fun!COMMENT_END', 'This is impressive given the timeline and fun to play. Gave me Nodebuster meets Vampire Survivor vibes.COMMENT_END', 'Wow! \xa0Your skill tree is insane - so cool. \xa0Personally, I was terrible at the combat, but I was still blown away by how much you got into your game in two weeks.\xa0 \xa0As another Construct 3 developer I am very impressed.COMMENT_END', "That was fun :) I think the only criticism I\xa0could give would be the purple rocks purple floor combo :P I got stuck on a rock more than a few times because I\xa0didn't see it.COMMENT_END", "There was a lot in this with the upgrade system and the battles.\xa0 The art and style all looked great! There was a good feeling of progression by buying the upgrades and going back into the battles a little stronger. Great game, I'd like to see this taken a lot farther.COMMENT_END", "Absolutely insane to have been done solo in 2 weeks! Amazing! The skill tree is a lot to look at, I'd love for it to get visually clearer, and the level selection feels odd, especially before you unlock a second level. I'd also love to be able to choose what to cast and when, to really make the most of the 'core' provided and perhaps be able to get further sooner by risking bunching up more enemies before I shoot.\xa0 All in all, very fun, I love the elements and the visual polish, great game.COMMENT_END"]

["Ah, a fellow Construct 3 enjoyer! This is one of the better games that I've played this round. The mechanics were simple but unique enough to stand out. The intro cutscene was also charming. I'd like to see more!COMMENT_END", "This was a really fun platformer. I like the turn to stone mechanic I don't think I've seen it used in a platformer before and it lead to some interesting platforming. The art looks really nice, I think a parallax background would've helped give it a more complete look. The controls took me a bit to get used to, I'm so used to space being dash so I kinda killed myself a lot by accidentally turning into stone. Great work on this!COMMENT_END", 'This was a really enjoyable little platformer!\xa0 The core mechanic of gliding and turning to stone is cleverly implemented and creates some satisfying puzzles.\xa0 I especially liked\xa0 the sound effects at most.\xa0 My only minor critique would be that orbes looks like a coin and i always want to collect them :|\xa0.\xa0 Overall, though, a great entry!\xa0 Well done!COMMENT_END', 'Great game! I really liked the opening cutscene. It gave me an old-school game vibe. The mechanics are well implemented. The pixel art looks great too. Great job!COMMENT_END', 'Fun game. The gliding and turning to stone made some fun platforming puzzles. Good game!COMMENT_END', 'One of the best game submitted. The sound design and music are perfect and the mechanic complement each other well.COMMENT_END', 'This was a extremly good game! Tho it was a bit to hard at the start, with tricky tight corners. I would rather prefer a smoother difficulty scaling. Otherwise, fantastic job! The cutscene was amazing! :DCOMMENT_END', "This is definitely one of my favorites in this jam!\xa0I love this platformer idea and would love to see it be developed further, everything about it is great (small story, graphics, and polish like chef's kiss). It challenged me and I was able to get 54 seconds on the leaderboard. Maybe it was just the leaderboard and I'm just competitive lol.COMMENT_END", 'This is a really fun platformer game. Great job!COMMENT_END', "Fun platformer game. Was a bit lost at first as other than being given controls, I did not know what the bubbles and dragon fly did so I was stuck a bit when the dragonfly was introduced. Turns out I had to land on top so there was a bit of precision needed there that didn't leave room for error. Great use of mechanics for the puzzles!COMMENT_END"]

['I really enjoyed playing this! The concept is excellent, and the core gameplay is engaging.\xa0 However, I initially struggled to understand how the cards worked. Good Job!COMMENT_END', 'loved it im boutta buy this game for 10billion dollarsCOMMENT_END']

It's nice that you managed to add this many features here as well.COMMENT_END", 'This is a great start!\xa0 well done on the prototype!COMMENT_END', 'Fun game with a lot of potential in the next rounds.COMMENT_END', 'Very cute and well execute game - nice one! :)COMMENT_END']

["Love the look of this little guy.\xa0 I wish I was better at wall-jumping - I'm terrible - so it made it hard to progress. \xa0Still, I think this game has some promise and I hope you get to continue it.COMMENT_END", 'Fun game! I would love to see this with more polishCOMMENT_END', 'Cool game! It has everything for the task and more potential. Just want to say pogo jump keys are a little bit hard to push as a feedback. Good luck!COMMENT_END', 'I like it so far. I always liked game where you keep discovering new ability and use themto explore freely around the world. Only "negative" I had was with the movement of the wall jump, but after some time playing it become more naturalCOMMENT_END', 'Fun game. I\xa0think you got the mechanics down pretty good and think this game has a lot of potential.COMMENT_END', "Love this game so far. I saw someone complaining about the movement, but I don't remember where, but I like it. Snappy isn't a bad thing in my opinion. Love the art for the character, too. It was neat discovering and unlocking new abilities to progress. I can't wait to see where you take this!COMMENT_END", "This is an incredible prototype. Smart level design, smart powerups, it's great! The only notes I\xa0have are for the camera, and the controls. The camera would really benefit from some drag. It's a little choppy right now. It's also kinda tough to press S, J, and space while trying to navigate with AD. Otherwise, I\xa0loved this!COMMENT_END", "Very simple and short exploration game. I just couldn't get over the weird keycombos, what is so wrong with placing common keys right next to the movement keys?COMMENT_END", 'A fellow metroidvania fan, eh? \xa0Nice!COMMENT_END', "That was fun. I'm looking forward to where you take it ( if you decide to :) )COMMENT_END", 'this game has very fluid animation and a good jump, i dont really enjoy the feeling of the walljump, but as someone who has tried to program a walljump on godot, its quite hard so good luck!COMMENT_END']

['damn this game was so good.i really like the idea.COMMENT_END', 'This was\xa0 a cleaver idea! Its fun, but the string that hold them together kinda felt awkward.COMMENT_END', 'I thought this was awesome!\xa0 One of my favorites from the round so far.\xa0 It was a really creative idea and I felt like it was a good balance of chaotic but controllable enough.COMMENT_END', 'This was so cool. Clever idea, clever level design, terrible controls. The perfect rage game prototype.COMMENT_END', 'The initial controls were the biggest troll I\'ve ran into this jam, the "alt" controls were so much better. The idea is quite good but I personally dislike these movement gimmick games where the map design really has to do all the heavy lifting. The sounds were quite loud as I had to lower my windows sound from 25 to 10 to not get an ear bleeding. +1 for an interesting main menu.COMMENT_END', 'quite fun! the music is funny!\xa0very hard though!COMMENT_END', 'Damt that blow blow-up sound is scary.\xa0 The game idea is unique and interesting.COMMENT_END', 'This was very clever. \xa0Also, agree with those who said it was hard - it was.\xa0 Really original game!COMMENT_END', "I'm not sure if I understood how to manage it correctly, but I really liked it)COMMENT_END", 'Such an awkward game that was completely fun. Tough game for me, but it was great.COMMENT_END', 'How on earth do people come up with these mechanics? (THIS IS A COMPLIMENT BECAUSE I AM AT AWE). This is so cool I\xa0hope more people play this and this passes to round 2.COMMENT_END', 'Very interesting take! I love the both game mechanics and it was indeed hard!! But very challenging and fun also!COMMENT_END']

['Really good game!! Love the music, get that lo-fi vibe! You hit the main task of round 1 which is make a game with two mechanics. Really interested in seeing what you do next with this game!COMMENT_END', "The music was extremely intense for how little there was going on. Graphics were nice but the gameplay really couldn't be thinner than this. Maybe a turret, obstacles or stationary enemies with a dodge mechanic, but nope, only running for a few short levels.COMMENT_END", 'Music and sounds are goated! I like the start of your game! :DCOMMENT_END', 'I had a good time getting all the intel! I like the art style and the vibe of the game. Would be cool to see some more mechanics and stuff added if you keep working on it. Great job!COMMENT_END', 'Fun game, liked the art style, music, and sound.COMMENT_END', 'Intel successfully gotted!COMMENT_END', 'Really nice vibe to this.COMMENT_END']

['The mechanics worked well together, this was a fun game! Would love to play more levels of this if you choose to keep developing it!COMMENT_END', 'For something so simple at least the "movement" was fluid. Quite short but the mechanics would\'ve probably gotten quite old after a few levels regardless. Simple and clean art style and no ear blasting music.COMMENT_END', 'I really like the two mechanics here.\xa0 I was terrible at it (I kept getting stuck behind the dirt wall), but I still enjoyed trying it. \xa0I wish it was a little easier at the start.\xa0\xa0I hope you get a chance to work on it some more - I would love to play it again.COMMENT_END', 'I really like the core mechanics and how I have to manage both of my mouse buttons!COMMENT_END', 'such a simple concept but well executedi love this so muchlooking forward to seeing this being developed further ð\x9f\x99\x8cCOMMENT_END', 'This was so fun! I liked it a lot! :DCOMMENT_END', 'Some of those puzzles were tough and some I cheesed past. A lot of fun, good game.COMMENT_END', 'overall impression:\xa0"this dev understood the assignment". personally, this isn\'t my kind of gameplay, yet every criteria got a good score because you clearly stuck to what was important. core mechanics are fleshed out and complement each other well. i think a fun easter egg would be to include an achievement for knocking over the pixel baseball dude lol. you made enough levels to create a reliable sense of progression yet didn\'t overextend yourself. great job, i hope you had fun making it, as i must admit, i had fun playing it\xa0:)COMMENT_END', "This is cool!\xa0I\xa0think it's hard to call left click to go one way, and right click to go another way two differentmechanics, but it was a fun and cool game!COMMENT_END", 'Cool gameCOMMENT_END']

['Seriously, brilliant idea for a typing game.\xa0\xa0It just needs to start so much easier, as my typing sucks. \xa0Still, I had a lot of fun trying this and I hope you get to continue it (and add an easy mode).COMMENT_END', "In my top 3 entries here (and I've played about 150 so far), the idea just feels so special and has a lot of potential in my opinion. I felt that kind of childish joy when encountering something really new and creative for the first time. I wished it was a slightly faster tho\xa0and obviously that it would have more content in the future. The game actually kind of reminds me of scribblenauts! What a wonderful experience.COMMENT_END", 'Typing out the spell and modifiers made casting spells pretty fun. I like the mechanics and can see a lot of fun places you can go from what you have here. Well done!COMMENT_END', 'Fireball Fireball Fireball... my DnD instincts kicked in hard. Very fun ;)COMMENT_END', 'One of the few typing games I like.COMMENT_END', "Interesting game, not one that I would normally play - but I really enjoyed this one!! Can't wait to see where you take it from here :)COMMENT_END", 'WOW! IT was very cool once you figured it out!COMMENT_END', 'Interesting variation of typing games.\xa0 I\'d suggest using simple words to begin with like "heal" and "strike".\xa0 Those could be used for initial waves.\xa0 Then let the player add words for stronger attacks, in successive waves,\xa0like "medicine", "rejuvenate", etc.\xa0 That would give a good sense of progression.COMMENT_END', 'After i type out a spell, it is taking a long time for it to come to effect?\xa0The timer can be reduced, otherwise a game with great concept. But I am too impatient lol.COMMENT_END', 'After reading your instructions, the game was really fun to play. I very much enjoyed the typing out attacks with adjectives. I feel like this game could potentially be really helpful for teaching typing. I was even imagining further in the game adding numbers to increase attack powers or do multiple attacks, like "sword slash x3" to do a triple attack or something, and even\xa0unlocking "runes" that are symbols\xa0like[ %, _, @, ;, . (, )] to help train typing of\xa0those more difficult symbols. Lots of potential, but yes nice work and very creative.COMMENT_END', 'i really like the idea but i dont see how to progress in this game so far because at some point you will just die so\xa0there would need to be some upgrades or so aswell or more words that you can unlock besides that i think it is really cool that you can use the effects on any spellCOMMENT_END', "Hello I want to play to this game, but I can't figure out how it works. Could you briefly explain what\xa0I'm supposed to do? I like typing games so I really want to know.COMMENT_END"]

['good relaxing game. i would like to see what max weight of fish i build in tab menu.COMMENT_END', "Had maybe a bit too much fun with the boat movement as it could build up a lot more speed than probably intended. The fishing unfortunately bugged out and I couldn't enter that mode after just clicking to reel in the fish, which was apparently supposed to be hold reel in. Cute pixel graphics and fitting audio.COMMENT_END", 'This is a nice little cozy game. Just chilling on the water catching some fish. I\xa0do have to mention, that the boat movement is reversed to the rowing animation, it should be the other way around. Other that that good job.COMMENT_END', "Rowing was fun, I couldn't get any fish. Seemed like I could never click fast enough after the bite. Good set of mechanics though. Good game!COMMENT_END", "It was a cool game, but I don't know why I couldnt bring out my fishing rod sometimes ... :/COMMENT_END", 'fishCOMMENT_END', 'Super fun! I love fishing in video games. This one took me a minute to figure out, but after a couple of tries I was fishing like a pro! Rowing around was fun too, especially once I realized that with the right inputs I could send my little rowboat careening through the water with reckless abandonCOMMENT_END', 'This is a relaxing game lol. I liked it! Also the boating mechanic was fun!COMMENT_END', 'This was great. A genuine great prototype. I\xa0would love some islands to navigate around.COMMENT_END', 'I did not catch a single fish and had a great time :)COMMENT_END', 'A cool fishing game! When the music came in for some reason I just started smiling. Each oar being A and D made it fun to just drive my little boat around. Good job!COMMENT_END', 'I loved this game. The vibe is so chill, and I love the 3d/2d blended style you have going on. I wish the fish would head towards the lure easier, it was a bit of a pain to get the lure to their path (skill issue I know lol). But yeah, great great fishing game and use of 3d models.COMMENT_END']

["Fun mechanic! I can't help but feel like the jump is less useful when you have the ability to teleport to the knife\xa0ð\x9f\x98\x85 and I'm not sure the advantage of throwing it quickly? Maybe you'll add some tighter timing on later puzzles. This was cool, good job\xa0ð\x9f\x91\x8fCOMMENT_END", 'Very good game with a lot of potential, the only problem is some collision do not match with the sprite shapeCOMMENT_END', "Well it was short like it said in the title. I couldn't for some reason get the slow? knife to work at all as it just kept moving at the normal speed. Some collisions were either a bit too big or apparently none existent (specifically on the last levels top row's bottom). Could easily be expanded with more levels and maybe some more mechanics.COMMENT_END", 'Lovely idea! Good work! :DCOMMENT_END', "Love the idea for this game, it's very fun to throw it fast and then teleport at the right time!COMMENT_END", 'I think that the two mechanics work well together. I like the choice in power to throw the knife and can see a lot of potential puzzles/action using that in the future. Great idea and good work implementing it.COMMENT_END', 'I liked the game and the mechanic. I wish the knife could move faster. Great mechanic otherwise!COMMENT_END', 'A very clever, if short game :) How good was the throwing / teleport mechanic....? I forgot I could jump and was stuck for like 2 minutes until I remembered that I could just hop to the next block. ( I might just be tired) Good job, keep it up!COMMENT_END', "This game has a really strong potential to become something awesome!\xa0Throwing knives at Mach 3 and timing teleports is genuinely so fun It's hard to explain. I really like the Stanley-Parable\xa0esc narrator you added! This game somehow managed to throw some of my favorite game mechanics\xa0in blender. Needless to say I enjoyed it!COMMENT_END", 'I thought that was\xa0fun!COMMENT_END', 'I liked this a lot!\xa0 Your mechanics felt really well defined, and bouncing the knife around and teleporting to it was a lot of fun.\xa0 Great job!COMMENT_END']

['I see the appeal. The launching mechanic feels great, too! Fun combination of mechanics :)COMMENT_END', 'It was really fun until the bug where the blocks went negative and stopped breaking. However very good game. 5/5COMMENT_END', 'That was good time!COMMENT_END', 'Cool idea!COMMENT_END', 'This was kinda addicting. A little bit slow at first, and the movement was a bit finicky but otherwise a nice submissionCOMMENT_END', 'Loved the child between golf and the classic break out game! May be adding some type of sound or effect to bricks that need more than 1 hit would make it more engaging. Otherwise a good game!COMMENT_END', 'Interesting idea. Once I started unlocking more golf balls and powered them up it was getting more fun, it just took a while to get there.COMMENT_END', 'I liked the mix of game elements from shooting the golf ball and adding in extra ones to bounce around. It was a bit slow at first but I think that was all I had an issue with. Great game!COMMENT_END']

["I'm not sure I got this one working correctly, but from reading the concept it does seem cool.COMMENT_END", "There is an idea for a game, but like it says on the tin, this isn't that.COMMENT_END", 'Fun concept, and the pixel art is indeed cute.\xa0 Looking forward to seeing this developed further.COMMENT_END', 'I think you have the mechanics for the prompt done very well.\xa0 Good work.COMMENT_END', "necromancy mechanics was an interesting concept that made for fun onboarding. i think some creative audio would've been its cherry on top. was excited to crash your game with npc spawning but it held up surprisingly well once i left fullscreen. that being said, it was pretty small at that resolution and fullscreen was definitely lagging. spawn cap might be a consideration, depending on where you want to take the playstyle. ty for the experience, i hope you had fun making it :)COMMENT_END", 'I like how the mechanics encourage the player to design\xa0their own strategy! Nice job!COMMENT_END', 'Looks cool! :DCOMMENT_END', 'Interesting idea! Should I get exp or rise a minion? Very fun! And cute pixel-art)COMMENT_END']

["I\xa0think the mechanic are quite interesting, but I\xa0didnt really feel the progression, I get a new monkey every so often but at the end of the day I'm just clicking the same bananas and waiting for the stock price to go up so I can sell, even though the numbers go up, my experience is the same.Overall an interesting little gameCOMMENT_END", 'MonkeCOMMENT_END', 'I enjoyed the game a lot! However, I felt like the moneys kept overshooting their destination when they went to get bananas.COMMENT_END', 'Funny monkey economy simulation. I agree with some of the others that it would have been nice if the simulation was a bit faster.COMMENT_END', 'It is creative in that it is not just a simple stock trading game but also takes charge of production and conveys the situation intuitively.COMMENT_END', 'Fun setup, progression was a bit slow. Curious to see more of that !COMMENT_END', "Interesting concept. I'd like to see this developed further. The progression could have been a bit quicker.COMMENT_END", "I bought bananas today and randomly started eating them while playing this game, not even seeing the synchronicity until the third bite. As for the game, it's ok, don't understand much. I clicked one banana and monkey started going to it. I\xa0sent it a few times and then noticed two more bananas. I\xa0was wondering how a monkey could fetch all those bananas, but when I saw that I have 3 monkeys there was no end to my joy.COMMENT_END", "This was intriguing. \xa0I loved the look of it and was impressed with how much you got into it during a jam.\xa0 I'm not sure I fully understand all the strategies of it, but I had fun poking around in it.\xa0 I hope you get a chance to expand it.COMMENT_END", "Definitely has potential, but it's quite janky in the current state. I enjoyed it anyway, though :D good stuff!COMMENT_END", 'monkeyCOMMENT_END', 'humans earns money, monkey earns bananas XD\nnice game.COMMENT_END', 'Banana see monkey eat.COMMENT_END', 'Oh the banana markets! This is a fun take on resource gathering, I think the market value adds some strategy that could really take this game to some interesting places. Fun game!COMMENT_END', 'So far I found it pretty fun, a good 30 minutes\xa0 went by where i was just zoned out making bread.COMMENT_END', 'Potential next cookie clicker tycoon game.COMMENT_END']

['Solid mechanics!\xa0 Art was simple but for this round it fits greatCOMMENT_END', 'Interesting idea :) It could use a little polish but I\xa0could see this growing into something pretty cool.COMMENT_END', 'First impressions were quite bad as the game was laggy as all hell (first one for this jam) and the block placing and collecting mechanic was unclear and a bit buggy (not placing and the sorts). The lag persisted through out the game but then there were also hard freezes for some time which made the platforming extremely annoying from losing progress from something beyond my control.COMMENT_END', "Wow I didn't realize that this was your game from the cover art :PCOMMENT_END", 'Great work! I could see a nice puzzle platformer sprouting from this idea.COMMENT_END', 'Very interesting idea!COMMENT_END', 'I really liked the concept and the execution, I think there is a lot you can do to expand on it and hope I\xa0get to see you work on it some more.COMMENT_END', 'This is a really cool idea and you did a good job implementing it. I had a lot of fun playing!On level 2, my browser crashed. It looks like something in your code is probably causing a memory leak, the framerate steadily dropped until it froze then crashed. ( for example,\xa0maybe something is creating objects over and over, etc. )Overall a really fun and expandable idea.\xa0Being able to grab a platform and take it with me was fun.COMMENT_END', 'The platforming felt good and smooth. There was a good sense of progression too. The secondary mechanics complemented the primary well too! I loved this game. Hoping for this game to expand!COMMENT_END', 'the platforming mechanics feels good, the placing mechanics works well too.I will try to play more later, as my computer is crashing a lot right now :PCOMMENT_END']

["The sword and upgrading stuff are all fine, if there were more enemies. I tried twice to get more than 9 enemies to spawn but both times they just stopped. There probably could've been a great game otherwise.COMMENT_END", "This game is incredible. The movment are smooth, the hits are satisfying, music is great ect. Only thing is I couldn't play for long because of a bug where enemies stop spawning. Also maybe i the futur you could chose between diffent weapons that would play slightly differently. Really hope to see this game continuing.COMMENT_END", "This actually has a very creative control scheme! Amazingly fluid as well! It's unfortunate that there is a bug where enemies stop spawning, but the little bit I played was enough to showcase the potential of this game. Keep it up!COMMENT_END", 'This an unusual take on Vampire Survivors-like games, I wish the monsters would continue spawning so I could level up moreCOMMENT_END', 'i love this this pretty well madenice work man!this the second game in this jam that has to do with killing frogs (my pfp)(idk if those were frogs or slimes)COMMENT_END', 'I really liked this game a lot. \xa0Beautiful graphics especially when the sword was moving fast.\xa0\xa0Fun upgrades. \xa0I hope you continue this, I would love to see more of it!COMMENT_END', "I enjoyed this. Sad that I am just that good. No enemies want to come face me. I agree with what others said. Currently I dont see a use for the dash.I would like to see more difficulty. Currently it's rather easy. Just that the player has to put in more thought when to pick up the sword. When to kill enemies and more. Currently I pick it up. Slash a bit. Place it down further from the enemies.Maybe in combination with bullet hell mechanics? Or some other mechanics that change the area. This way the player has to plan their swings more careful.Great game!COMMENT_END", 'Very fun game!COMMENT_END', 'A fun game that has potential.COMMENT_END', 'I love this game! almost everything is perfect and visually it is so appealing its simple and that makes it perfect.COMMENT_END', 'Fun game, I liked the mechanics of swinging the sword and landing somewhere safe enough to rest for a bit. I could see this expanded on and hope you keep working on it.COMMENT_END']

["Very cool idea for a game! I love factorio and seeing the conveyor belts instantly made me happy. I like the shooting section it feels good and it's fun to kill the dudes. I think I needed more tutorials on how to craft stuff, I got my smelter to make iron bars, but I was trying to turn that into 3 iron rods that the belts need and I wasn't able to figure out how to get it to work. Really impressive work for 2 weeks tho, making a factory game and a wave based shooter in that time is crazy. Great work!COMMENT_END", "this is a really cool idea. i had a difficult time onboarding and still feel like there are features i'm being ignorant of. the work you put into this is clear right off the bat, well done. i hope you had fun making it :)COMMENT_END", "Really like this game! Can't wait to see what you do next with it! As others suggested I'd focus on reworking the UI layout, maybe add a few more tutorials to help the player understand what to do. It took me a second to understand the gameplay but when I did it was very fun and built my resources :D . Also maybe have the enemies paused while you are building and when you come back have them\xa0\xa0start a few seconds later. Every time I came back to that world they just swarmed me.COMMENT_END", 'It seems like a very cool idea, and once this gets some polishing I would love to try it!COMMENT_END', 'This was fun to play! I was a bit confused of what to do at first, but then eventually got the hang of it! Nice work!COMMENT_END', 'I was a bit confused, but I still enjoyed the game a lot!COMMENT_END', 'I really like the concept of having like a resource gathering and management game with an action shooter. I think you covered the task well and think you could take this game forward in many different great ways.COMMENT_END', "Ah!\xa0\xa0VS style game.\xa0\xa0Nice!\xa0 Movement controller and shooting both felt nice.\xa0 Had no issues with either.\xa0 During the second phase, I couldn't quite figure out what I was supposed to be doing for a while.\xa0 Maybe some UI panels to explain some of the different buildings?\xa0 I think you're onto something with that two-phase style gameplay.\xa0 Keep going with that.\xa0 Cheers!COMMENT_END"]

["Nice game! Its good a simple. I like it a lot and it's well polished!COMMENT_END", 'Fun take on Rock, Paper, Scissors with some added strategy. Very well executed and well done.COMMENT_END', 'Cleverly thought out haha, good workCOMMENT_END', "Very cool! I wish the score didn't reset when getting dqualified as they do it a lot accidentally.COMMENT_END", 'Interesting spin on such simple game! Incredible!COMMENT_END', "Yo! Squid Game reference! It's fun to try this game out myself.COMMENT_END", 'This would make for a fun coop game.\xa0 A very clever variant of such a simple game.\xa0 Was really fun to play.COMMENT_END', 'Clever variation on "Rock Paper Scissors".\xa0 This actually had me thinking about my choices. \xa0Especially good use of the secondary mechanic. \xa0There isn\'t much to it, but what\'s there is, is\xa0\xa0fun.\xa0\xa0Well done.COMMENT_END']

["This is a really cool idea. I love automation games so it was fun to get some automata working for me. It'd be nice if you could see what materials you needed for stuff in the shop menu too, cuz I found myself going back and forth a lot to figure out what to craft for profit. I ended up just making a ton of heads over time to make money. It'd be cool if you could make automata sell and buy stuff too, I would've liked to setup a full automation of making and selling heads so I could just watch my workers make money for me lol. Great job on this I had fun playing it!COMMENT_END", 'The mechanics work well together and offer a sense of progression. It would be cool to see where you take the game.COMMENT_END', "I love the vibe and concept of this game. I\xa0think if the main mechanic of cutting out the shapes wasn't so precise and could be done quicker (it takes me about 10min for 1 sheet of cogs) this would be much more enjoyable. Everything else is simple, and easy to understand.COMMENT_END", "Hi there!First of all, congratulations on submitting for GDKO 2025!Your game doesn't seem to have any direction towards progression.\xa0I felt like I was clicking buttons and hearing noises without ever seeing anything to show for it.The minigame was brilliant, albeit a little bit janky to move around, but still a great premise!The sound clips were very high in reverb, which would work well with a backing track of music, but by themselves it definitely made the game feel even more empty.The art style is great, and\xa0would work even better\xa0if the 3D models were implemented.Thanks!COMMENT_END"]

["This game had a very interesting mechanic but it takes a while to get the hand of. A couple of easier 'tutorial' levels would have helped this. Overall I had a good time <3COMMENT_END", "No clue what the secondary mechanic here was, but I couldn't even get past the first level, so maybe it was hidden somewhere there. Interesting idea but it felt a bit rushed.COMMENT_END", 'is a fun concept with a really well-implemented mechanic â\x80\x93 the planetary gravity is engaging and unique.I would definitely like to see this game developed further.COMMENT_END', 'This is a great prototype! I\xa0kept randomly getting reset, which made it harder to complete, but the puzzles were still worth the challenge!COMMENT_END', 'Awesome game! I love time dilation...COMMENT_END', 'the art was charming and the core mechanic was both conceptually fresh and well implemented. i had a difficult time making use of the secondary mechanic but it easily could have been user error. i also had a difficult time getting out of the automatic fullscreen lol.\xa0i appreciated the hot reload r key quite a bit, nice touch. good job,\xa0i hope you had fun making it :)COMMENT_END', 'I\xa0really enjoyed the gravity mechanics! Found this game quite a good challenge, but possibly wish that you could slow the time down for a longer period.\xa0Well done, a very unique concept!COMMENT_END', 'I got past the first level with GOLD! It was fun. second level was too hard tho..COMMENT_END', "The gravity mechanics were fun. I couldn't get past the first level and have to move to other games but it was fun trying.COMMENT_END"]

["I\xa0really like the perspective of being inside the factory to make the towers. I think they're good mechanics that fit theme of the round. I'd like to see you develop this further.COMMENT_END", "This is a cool concept!\xa0I didn't find out how to progress, but I\xa0can see what you were going for. I would love to see what happens next!COMMENT_END"]

["Interesting take on the side scroller jumper genre but the the lack of checkpoints really killed all interest for me. I don't know how far I got but falling and resetting to the start was annoying because the game is quite slow. The graphic were simple and didn't really seem to be the selling point of this game anyways.COMMENT_END", "Tough platforming puzzles with these mechanics, this is a really fun game. Well done, I'd like to see you develop this further.COMMENT_END", 'I really liked how well your mechanics went together!\xa0 They were two very distinct mechanics that meshed super well.COMMENT_END', 'The swap mechanic reminded me of Crash Bandicoot 4. Switching back and forth between modes mid-jump was kind of difficult\xa0ð\x9f\x98COMMENT_END', 'Love the mechanics and "mechanical twists", I think it has a lot of potential once the physics are refined!COMMENT_END', 'Cool mechanicsCOMMENT_END', 'Very cool concept once I figured it out! :DYou did a\xa0good job!COMMENT_END', "I like the idea behind this a lot. \xa0Being able to double jump only when in light mode was fun. \xa0But, I also found this really hard (even at the start), \xa0I wish the jumps were easy to begin with, then as the levels progressed and we got more skilled, they could get harder. \xa0Of course, it could just be that I'm terrible at platform games.COMMENT_END", 'hi nice game feels comlised but the only thing i didnt liked was that the jump was realy slow like in slow-motionCOMMENT_END', "I wasn't sure how it worked at the beginning, once I understood that your light mode could double jump and you had to unlock the dark mode in the level I got the hang of it. Very cool mechanic, once I understood it!COMMENT_END", "Solid mechanic, I\xa0like how the game uses the mechanic\xa0to switch between light and dark for the challenging jumps. If you made the contrast between the dark tiles and the background a bit better it would be easier to plan out jumps and a lot harder to get caught off guard when you're in light modeCOMMENT_END"]

['smol spikes everywhere.COMMENT_END', 'Idea of the game is cool and you implemented it pretty good. As a suggestion I would like to lose life when went off the screen borders, I stuck many times on platforms also I am not sure about the secondary mechanic.\xa0Keep developing and you will get better for sure!COMMENT_END', "Well this one was quite buggy on all fronts. Just by not playing you instantly run into a platform's side and get stuck, if you manage to get out of that you fall right through the ground. Some of the surfaces remove HP while others don't seem to do anything. Graphical style was the high-point, but that's most that can be said.COMMENT_END", 'I liked the look of this game and I like runner games. \xa0But, this game started out to hard for me.\xa0 I wish it was easier at the beginning and then the difficulty ramped up over time. \xa0I hope you get a chance to continue working on it.COMMENT_END', 'Nice game but too easily you get stuck on clouds or you can go out of boundaries.COMMENT_END', 'Its cool! The only thing is that you get stuck easily. That one fix would make this a fantastic game!COMMENT_END', "Fun concept! Unfortunately\xa0 I think there's a bug when hittinh the side of the platforms, the game seems to get stuck and it forces you to restart ? But I'd love to see more!COMMENT_END", 'I like these gravity switching games. It was fun but I had to quit after getting to level one because I kept hitting the side of a platform and I got bored waiting. Anyway, the game was fun to play I think you could add a bunch of stuff, it has a lot of potential.COMMENT_END', "It's a good implementation, but we need to balance the speed of the game a little more.COMMENT_END", 'Fun idea!COMMENT_END', "You have the vibe down, and it's a fun mechanic. I did get stuck on some platforms and had to restart. But its a fun game!COMMENT_END"]

['Neat entry. You did a good job addressing the prompt :)COMMENT_END', 'Nice concept! The 2D side would have benefited from some coyote time for the jump. Like Dev Pirates said it would be cool if the 3D side could be used to progress on the 2D side as well.COMMENT_END', 'This could\'ve been something like "We were here" but it was a extremely thin slice of a very cookie cutter platformer. The graphics were simple and served their purpose well. Not that many features or elements to comment on.COMMENT_END', 'Making the way through\xa0the 3D level and the 2D level is a really great idea. I liked the buttons in the 2D part that helped the progression of the 3D. I think you hit the theme of the challenge really well and it was a lot of fun. Well done!COMMENT_END', 'This is soo cool! I liked this so much!COMMENT_END', 'This was really interesting and very original.\xa0\xa0I was great jumping in 3d, but my 2d game was terrible (not your fault - mine). \xa0I enjoyed this and hope you get a chance to continue it.COMMENT_END', 'Interesting concept. I look forward to seeing how how you further integrate the 2d & 3d spaces.COMMENT_END']

["I wish it was fleshed out a little more, but I feel like it's a good start and has a lot of potential!\xa0 I'd love to see it with a little more to explore, different types of enemies, new weapons to find, all that stuff!COMMENT_END", 'Love dungeon crawlers!! Such a good idea! Looking forward to seeing what you do next with this game idea!COMMENT_END', 'cool prototype. its give the vibe like Doom. movements seems nice and clean. game has potential.COMMENT_END', 'I really like the concept and think you reached the theme for the round. The Dungeon crawling part looked well done and smooth. The attacking needed a bit more work to see what was going on. But I really liked this. I think this concept as a lot of potential. Well done!COMMENT_END', "Nice prototype! At first I was trying to attack without locking on, which didn't do any damage. If locking on is required then I wouldn't play the attack animation when you're not locked on, and maybe indicate visually that you have to lock on first, or even lock on automatically. Also, being able to walk through enemies feels a bit like cheating.COMMENT_END", 'Cool start! I liked the movement, felt\xa0claustrophobic :PCOMMENT_END', 'very cool concept! love how you implemented to movement mechanic and for the attacking mechanic idk if my attacks work on the enemies, would be helpful if you can add a healthbar so i can check how much damage ive dealtbut overall its great! would love to see this to be fully developed ð\x9f\x91\x8cCOMMENT_END', "Was NOT expecting to see a first person dungeon crawler.\xa0 That's a great idea!COMMENT_END"]

["Great job making a simple set of mechanics a lot of fun!\xa0 I'd like to see where it goes next!COMMENT_END", 'Satisfying! Maybe there could more levels and some progression with upgrading the ball weight, power etc..COMMENT_END', "This was a lot of fun. It's a pretty simple mechanic, but it's executed well and the addition of the score and leaderboard really adds a lot to the game. I ended up playing it a few times to go for a high score and got 819 and 2nd place on the leaderboard. Great job!COMMENT_END", "The mechanic is so simple But hell it's fun to play, It got me hooked for a while. I think you can still expand this a lot more, For example, regarding the big blue ball I thought at first that if you hit it with the normal ball it would break the walls in a bigger way (since it is bigger) I think that would be fun that you can hit other objects (balls or something else) and those objects react and break more wall creating more destruction and giving the player more score. I think you have something that has some room\xa0 to grow and develop some entertaining and creative gameplay. Great jobCOMMENT_END", 'Very silly and enjoyable game :)COMMENT_END', "FIRST PERSON BASKETBALL this game is so much fun. Throwing the basketball and dribbling it/bouncing it off of stuff was an absolute blast.\xa0\xa0I wish there was a bit more content but hey, it's round 1! The bricks feel a tiny bit too stiff in my opinion, but everything about the basketball feels perfect.COMMENT_END", "Whoever has the 900 score must've figured out some ancient magic because I can't even get to mid 800s before the bricks are practically gone already. May not really fit the theme well, but it is a fun timewaster game on its own.COMMENT_END", "This was super fun to play on stream.\xa0 Managed 2nd on the leaderboard, but I don't think it saved.\xa0\xa0But I have it on video, so it counts!COMMENT_END", "Good game but I felt like it needed more, I don't know what!COMMENT_END", 'This is the kind of thing that can really get me addicted to a game. Gotta get all the bricks! Great game.COMMENT_END', 'There was something extremely satisfying about smashing those bricks up. Felt like I was in a rage room. You should add some bombs into the mix. Cool prototype :)COMMENT_END']

["As far as the prompt for the round, I think you hit it. I'd like to see this game developed more. Good work! As an aside, I\xa0think the aesthetics, story,\xa0and music were awesome.COMMENT_END", "Interesting visual style and story-telling. It was just unfortunate something seemed to go bonkers for me as the first time I launched the game my controls didn't work at all and after restarting the exact same thing happened when I got to the first? letter where I got completely stuck. Would've wanted to see the rest but two crashes is too much.COMMENT_END", 'Fun game!\xa0Well done on the spooky atmosphere. gave me chills...COMMENT_END', 'This is unplayable. Downloads open file explorer for some reason?COMMENT_END']

['Good Game. Love the idea.\xa0 But kind of Hard. you could give up little bigger reward after enemy dies like at least at the start or give up like reserve resource maybe like xp.COMMENT_END', 'Very impressive idea on having to switch your resources between health, movement, ammo. I really liked that idea! What are you planning on doing next???COMMENT_END', 'Interesting idea with the swapping around of stats. I can just hear the protagonist shouting \'I am out of bullets... I\'ll kill you with MY LIIFFFFEEE!!!!!"COMMENT_END', "Very cool game design! It wasn't immediately clear to me that I could refill resources by entering the circle that is left by defeated enemies. On the other hand, after trying once without refills you'll probably realize that there has to be a way to refill, and you'll naturally try to enter the circle.COMMENT_END", 'This is freaking cool! I love the concept where the movement, slowly drains the colors, and that you can also sacrifice your hearts for more ammo or movement etc.COMMENT_END', "This is the best of all the games that doesn't have a cover image, actually fun game requiring strategy and evolving with more enemies. Would be a great basis for a bigger and more ambitious game.COMMENT_END", "This is such a clever gameplay mechanic. I can't wait to see how this looks after round 2!COMMENT_END", 'The resource management was a fun concept that worked well with collecting the resources from the dead mobs. Very fun idea well executed.COMMENT_END', 'I really like the idea of rotating and managing your resources/abilities.\xa0 Cool concept.\xa0\xa0Keep pushing that mechanic!COMMENT_END', 'Not the flashiest game I\'ve played so far in terms of polish, but was pretty fun and liked the concept of managing your "abilities" by choosing which order to kill enemies. Great concept!COMMENT_END']

["Fun quick game. I'd like to see you develop this more.COMMENT_END", "Nice work on getting the infrastructure together for a multiplayer card game! That's really cool. The game is very simple, but that's okay, simple card games can be very fun! I'm sure you have plenty more you want to put into your UI / card visuals. 4 days is not a lot of time. Good entry and hope to see more!COMMENT_END", 'Such a good start, love to see how you expand it from here.COMMENT_END', 'hey :) Appreciate the card game :)COMMENT_END']

['It is good for start, hope you continue developing!COMMENT_END', 'It looks like you submitted to a bunch of jams, which is fine, but it does give the disadvantage of making it hard to target it clearly at the task for the jam!COMMENT_END', "A decent start, but I couldn't tell what the secondary mechanic was. I assume that platforming was the core mechanic.COMMENT_END", 'Good startCOMMENT_END', "Extremely barebones and really doesn't seem to have much to do with this jam as it is part of like 5 other jams at the time of this writing.COMMENT_END", 'Cute game and good start. did you end up having time to for the second mechanic?COMMENT_END', 'It looks great, but we need to work on the gameplayCOMMENT_END']

["Great game, and I\xa0think you got the theme of the round down with your mechanics. Great work and a very interesting idea that I'd like to see you develop more.COMMENT_END", 'Well done! This is an awesome idea. I love the fact that the box could be jumped over or shot, and that the security guard at the end could be solved with all 3 genres. Such a unique Idea.COMMENT_END', 'This is very unique but also clever, great that you managed to add platformer genre as well (I was sure there would only be two). Again, should be a full-blown release with many different genres to change your point of view, this is amazing.COMMENT_END', 'This idea is amazing !!!!!!COMMENT_END', 'absolute cinema ð\x9f¤\x9að\x9f\x98®ð\x9f\x96\x90ï¸\x8fCOMMENT_END', 'THIS WAS SOO COOL! Well done dude! So unique and fun idea! Love to see you progress with this! <3COMMENT_END', 'Quite short but the idea was there if there is interest to be developed further. Got some weird graphics shaking when moving, but that was only on certain sprites(?).COMMENT_END', 'This game is really cool. I\xa0can imagine this going a million different ways -- definitely want to see it expanded :)COMMENT_END', 'Great game concept. I found a bug when I jump in Platformer mode and switched to FPS mode, I can go on top of the wall.COMMENT_END', "This is incredible. I'm amazed that you have made, in essence, 3 completely unique games. Well done! I can't wait for more!COMMENT_END"]

['Love the art style and the intro cutscene!!COMMENT_END', "I like your sense of humor and you have a good sense of how big things should be on the screen. I think the gameplay could use a bit more spice, like some kind of second or third thing that happens which might distract you from the farming of moonshine etc. , to maybe expand the management a little, or crank up the challenge a little. But it's a fun idea and I hope you keep going with it.the V.O. was funny, you should lean into that, consider doing more characters but doing them all yourself (like a hand puppet conversation vibe).nice work overall!COMMENT_END", 'I\'m not from your country so\xa0I couldn\'t really understand the references, like what do these items have to do with the story, and so, now and then, I would have a "Wait, is this racist?" moment. I hope it\'s not, because I\'m good at this game, probably the best on the planet and if it\'s made by aliens to find the chosen one I am to be contacted any minute now.COMMENT_END', 'So I think the mechanics are purchasing then feeding propaganda to the politician, in that I think you did great and I liked how creepy it was. Would have liked to see more in the way of results, when I played it went to the politician in shadow then back to the title screen. Otherwise, well done, I could see some potential in this, I want to see you take it further. Good work!COMMENT_END', 'The atmosphere and the sound, text background is really good. It felt very polished!COMMENT_END', 'loved it!i spammed the moonlich thingi spammed it.. yea sorry..COMMENT_END', 'Cool atmosphere!COMMENT_END', "Loved the vibe of the game. The artwork and sound design was awesome. Couldn't really figure out the best strategy for filling up the propaganda meter though. All the same an interesting prototype. Well done!COMMENT_END", "As I've mentioned before, your sense of atmosphere for the game is TOP NOTCHKeep it up in round 2!COMMENT_END", 'Great use of audio and animation. The introduction cutscene was greatCOMMENT_END']

['This looks awesome\xa0and controls really well. I think it will be a really fun game when it is finished. Best of luck!COMMENT_END', "This is a great prototype. I wish the screen was larger, and I'm excited to see what this looks like in round 2!COMMENT_END", 'I eat all blocks! I win? )COMMENT_END', "The game looks interesting, it's just a shame that you can't enlarge the window, and also the jump button choice is strangeCOMMENT_END", "Very cool start to a game! Would've absolutely kept playing this if there was more to it. I really like that you can eat a bunch of stuff above you it's fun to spam the eat button. Great job on this!COMMENT_END", 'I think this is a great start for a game. \xa0I love the look of it (good color choices).\xa0 I wish there was a little tutorial mode that kicked it all off (my game needs that too).\xa0\xa0Still, this was simple but fun.\xa0 Well done.COMMENT_END', 'Very nice game! Only recommendation is to stretch to viewport, and make your camera bigger.COMMENT_END', "I think what you have so far is really awesome! I'm really curious to see where you take this. Very clean animations too. Nice!COMMENT_END", 'Very interesting mechanics and a cool concept toomy experience when i played it is how the sense of progression doesnt really stand out to me and i didnt really get the idea on\xa0how the puzzle works and the way to solve it. When i was\xa0playing what comes to my mind\xa0was i eat blocks and become the same color and stand between blocks that are the same color as my character but it doesnt seem to be the way to solve it. (this also probably bcs im bad at understanding lol)but the game is cool i really like the conceptð\x9f\x91\x8cCOMMENT_END', "This is a fun game. Was hoping for a little variety with the different blocks, but I guess I'll have to wait until you develop it. Good luck, this was fun.COMMENT_END", 'Hey, I liked the movement controller very much, it feels great to control. A comment though is that I used the â\x80\x9cmessâ\x80\x9d option and I think there was something weird when eating, it would not eat all blocks and sometimes it would eat blocks behind, not sure if I hit a bug or there is a mechanic around that. If itâ\x80\x99s the later maybe you can explain it in the game page. Also, the game looks a little too small. I believe you can still edit the itch.io page after submission, maybe you can add the fullscreen button?COMMENT_END']

['Really nicely done :)COMMENT_END', 'Good job!\xa0 I thought the dodge and shoot back mechanic was a really good idea!\xa0 It would have been nice to have an indicator of when my spin was ready, and I think the shoot back mechanic could have been leaned into a little harder since it felt a little optional, but was really fun, but I liked what you did and thought it was a really good idea!COMMENT_END', "The turrets were rather easy as the vertically moving ones could be dodged by moving close enough to the boss, and the horizontally moving ones had too many gaps for them to be any difficult. I only managed to get one upgrade because I was prioritizing health, but I couldn't really get any progression from it, but not going to dock points for that because skill issue.COMMENT_END", 'Cool mechanics! Well done! ;DCOMMENT_END', 'Fun but there are some spot where you can go where robot will not hit you and you can safely hit robot.COMMENT_END', 'Fun! top-down shooter formula with roguelike upgrades is a neat comboCOMMENT_END', 'Perfect title and sound effects. \xa0Movement felt responsive. \xa0This feels like the start of a really fun game.\xa0\xa0Well done.COMMENT_END', 'This is a good prototype and I firmly believe you can make this a bigger game if wanted. Great job.COMMENT_END', 'The game is fun, I think different bosses would have helped the feeling of progression. But otherwise I think the top down shooter with upgrades works well and is a fun concept.COMMENT_END', 'I played a few times and accidentally figured out that you must shoot the powerups to buy them. It worked for me once I did that. That being said, with some additional bosses that have different attack patterns this could have potential.COMMENT_END', "The idea is fairly simple, but I imagine it makes up for that with the upgrades! Unfortunately\xa0 I wasn't able to get them to work no matter how hard I tried. Top-Down movement is always fun! Would love to see more attack patterns and variations through rounds in the future!COMMENT_END"]

["Fun little game for the first time, but doesn't really have anything after that. For me the game kept on lagging after not killing anything for a moment and killing one, and it was very easily replicated. The enemies were a bit too simplistic to get any difficulty out of them as they could be circled very easily.COMMENT_END", 'WEll done! Fun game!COMMENT_END', 'that was very fun.i like the simple concept and i kept playing this for soo longgCOMMENT_END', 'The design is simple and effective: while maintaining minimal art, I\xa0enjoyed the presence of key animations (enemy death, grabbing items), since they make the game modern despite keeping a retro feel.COMMENT_END', 'Cool game!Once I realised I was running out of ammo, I was more conservative with my shooting.The dash mechanic was cool to burst through a horde of enemies!The screen shake got a bit nauseating after a little while, though.Nice job!COMMENT_END', "I really liked this game! It got repetitive after a while and if you do have ammo I feel it should be displayed somewhere, but that didn't stop me from having a great time. The dash feels really impactful, like you really are unleashing a powerful attack! I ended up getting a score of roughly 300 before I stopped. If you could find a way to make more variation throughout gameplay this could be a really cool game!COMMENT_END", "Fun game ! Not sure to fully understand why i can't shoot sometimes ? Looks like an ammo limitation.COMMENT_END", 'Great work!COMMENT_END', 'Feel good to play! The audio is simple but adds a lot. I had some horrible lag spikes on web on like every third kill, but on the downloadable version it was fine. I noticed there is some kind of ammo system, cause sometimes I can\'t shoot, I just wished this ammo was clearly communicated to the player so I knew how to "save" it more effectively.COMMENT_END', 'Fun game with tight controls. Well done!COMMENT_END', 'This is fun! It feels really nice to play!COMMENT_END']

["The mirror switching was great mixed with the platforming. Tough with the mirroring, but got used to it after a while. I assume I made it to the end because I didn't see anywhere else to go. Good work, and great start for an awesome game.COMMENT_END", 'There is great potential for expansion.COMMENT_END', "Amazing concept! I don't think I've seen it before! The only shame I think is that sometimes the metrics don't align, as in a platform in one world won't be the exact same in the other one, so it does throw the player off a bit,\xa0but other than that super fun!COMMENT_END", "Very cool idea! I've seen the 2 world thing a lot of times but I don't think I've ever seen it mirror the world like that when you switch, makes for some fun challenging platforming. I think I beat the game I made it to a point where I didn't see any platforms to keep going. Great work on this!COMMENT_END", 'very cool concept and well executedwell done man!COMMENT_END']

["It's nice to have your own solid art style.COMMENT_END", 'As a fellow RPG lover, I like the style of the game.COMMENT_END', 'Very trippy. I like the game so far! :DCOMMENT_END', 'Veeeeery cool visuals and atmosphere! Love it\xa0!COMMENT_END', 'Great little RPG. It also reminded me of Earthbound. This was so much fun. I\xa0think this has a lot of room to expand on.COMMENT_END', "I love this game. The art style is absolute bananas and I am in love with it. I had to play it as soon as I saw the insane looking cover image. I was streaming myself playing it and the people in chat couldn't stop saying how cool this game was and how awesome the music was. I haven't finished it quite yet, need to go back tomorrow and beat it. But I made it a bit past the door boss. One frustrating thing that happened was I was using the mouse to move and I think the game continues moving after a fight based on your last mouse movement maybe? But as soon as I beat the door boss my character walked into the door and right back down so I had to fight it again. I don't think I clicked anywhere after fighting the boss, but maybe I did idk. Really awesome work on this game it is so so cool, one of my favs from the jam so far.COMMENT_END", 'Loved this game, super weird and high vibe-psychodelic,\xa0 a bit confusing at time how to control the battle and confrontation situations, the controls stuff was not super clear, but would love to see more of this!COMMENT_END']

['The platforming and story elements worked well together. The "you win\' at the end is a little jarring after the end of the story... good work.COMMENT_END', 'The story was a great but the collision seems a bit sharp. There was a bug in the level 2 where you could jump down and would just be stuck infinitly so maybe add a reser button or something and aslo adding controls for wasd.COMMENT_END', "Well it was a platformer, just like it says in the description. The collisions on the obstacles were quite sharp and of course they instantly kill. For some weird reason the third level maxed out my graphics card and the FPS went to sub 20 which made the level unplayable. Simple graphics and style, but there wasn't much in the\xa0game\xa0itself.COMMENT_END", 'Well done. :)COMMENT_END', "This is actually well done for the first game, the platforming is well done and I like the hovering feature. Also, I'm really happy\xa0 you bothered to add a story there, it really made the game more interesting!\xa0I hope to see more of your stories in the future.COMMENT_END", 'You win for the game that made me cry the most. That change in music was too brutal.\xa0Platforming was fun too i guess lol.COMMENT_END', 'good story, and decent platformer. I was invested from level 1!COMMENT_END']

['The mechanics are really good. The story and art make me want to see more of this game. Well done.COMMENT_END', 'This game is so adorable I love the art style. It was fun planting my coins and I had a serious carrot gambling problem cuz I never knew when to leave when I was ahead lol. Great work on this it was fun!COMMENT_END', "I'm fully upvoting you in the hopes of you feeding my gambling addiction in round 2. Please give us a roulette table!COMMENT_END", "I love the switcheroo you've done where you plant coins and gamble for carrots haha - really cute and fun game, well done!COMMENT_END", "I don't have a gambling issue, I don't have a gambling issue!!! I really enjoyed planting the coins and going to the slots!!COMMENT_END", 'This game is criminally underrated! great job! I\xa0want to see more of your workCOMMENT_END', "I like the concept, but the game itself wasn't very engaging. I think that could be fixed by giving the player stuff to do while they wait for the crops to grow. Also, the music felt too high pitched and ear piercing to me, but that could be my headphones.COMMENT_END", "I really wanted to play this game, but it crashed every time a flower was on screen. I'm also not sure if every texture was meant to flicker black, but it added a nice feel to the game. Like it was haunted. I'll try to play again later!COMMENT_END", "Hey, good to see you made it! And it was awesome to finally get to play the finished version of what I watched being developed, a whole new dimension. I\xa0think you did great with setting, graphics, and controls,it felt like a real place and a unique\xa0world of its own. The economy is a bit off (to the player's advantage) and gameplay maybe not super fun (as expected when rushing a farming game) but it's bug-free and works as intended so yay I think you should be proud.COMMENT_END"]

['This was an extremely fun concept!\xa0 Very good use of gun jumping.COMMENT_END', 'What happened to scoreboard?COMMENT_END', 'COMMENT_END', 'Really Good game. Took while when i figure it out.COMMENT_END', 'I like it a lot!COMMENT_END', "I don't get it. why I cant hit anybodyCOMMENT_END", '143 points!\xa0Very fun game!COMMENT_END', "Tough for me to get used to at first, but it's a skill based game so I'm not going to do that great. Fun game with a great concept.COMMENT_END", "I think this game really has some potential and was pretty addictive. It's more complex than you realise at first and enjoyed it alot. Well done!COMMENT_END", 'we are waiting for the continuation)COMMENT_END', 'This is so fun. This is so addicting. Took me a while to figure out what to do but that is skill issue. Would love to see this game develop in a multiplayer mode too if possible lol.COMMENT_END']

['From the title and thumbnail I expected the digging mechanic to be like "the" main thing and everything revolving around that, but in reality it was a walking sim with a shovel as melee to dig. The lack of checkpoints was a bit of a shocker as now only two games haven\'t had that and in my opinion this could\'ve used that. The graphics were nice, but this isn\'t an art contest currently.COMMENT_END', 'Excellent job. Top Marks :)COMMENT_END', 'It is a classic and stable work.COMMENT_END', "I think you nailed the theme of the round. I loved this game, maybe because it was very Zelda-like. But well done, I'd love to see you take this game further.COMMENT_END", 'I really like the art style and digging coin is super satisfyingCOMMENT_END', 'Very nice job! I liked the design, the art and the idea! I also liked the puzzles! Very interesting.Also good choice of music, I think I have heard it somewhere... :PCOMMENT_END', "First, the game didn't work on y Apple laptop with safari (WASD wouldn't let you move).\xa0\xa0So,\xa0I switched to Chrome and it worked great.\xa0 Glad I did, because it was a fun throwback game. \xa0Loved the character animation and sounds. \xa0Well done.COMMENT_END", 'The Zelda art style is so nostalgic, cool game!COMMENT_END', 'COMMENT_END', 'Diggy Zelda, I like it!The character is super cute too!COMMENT_END']

["Using a gun to jump isn't a mechanic you see a lot in games but it's one I\xa0love every time I try it out haha.\xa0 I actually very seriously considered a similar mechanic so I'm glad someone did it!\xa0 Great job!COMMENT_END", 'Moving around with the cannon\xa0is really fun and having a machine gun as well is pretty cool although I think holding the button down to fire would feel a bit better and it could look cool if it was minigun with more bullets. The levels are great and I like that you expanded the challenges with achievements. Great game!COMMENT_END', "The rocket gameplay was great, but honestly the secondary fire felt a bit odd as the first bullet always hits the mouse's spot, so why have some random spread shotgun shot? Sometimes the mouse felt a bit buggy as the force circle refused to update and sometimes it felt like it was inverse.COMMENT_END", 'UNDERRATED GAME!COMMENT_END', 'Fun mechanics that fit the task well. Took me a long time to make it through because I was terrible at it. Great work!COMMENT_END', "Man,\xa0I LOVED playing this on stream.\xa0 One of the most unique games I have seen from the jam this year.\xa0 I really think you're onto something special with this.COMMENT_END", 'DESTRUCTION! Well made mechanics and polished nicely too!COMMENT_END', "Easily one of the best titles in the jam. \xa0I love the two different mechanics. \xa0But just like in Team Fortress, I am terrible at rocket jumping.\xa0\xa0It's a clever way to get around, but Jumping off the walls is so hard for me.\xa0\xa0I wish there was an easy mode.\xa0\xa0Still, I thought this was original and fun. \xa0Well done.COMMENT_END", 'Really like the "shooting for traversal mechanic". It was kinda hard to get to grips with but once you get it down it\'s fun. Good work!COMMENT_END', 'Cool concept, using the shooting for traversal as well! Once i got the hang of how to control my movement it was fun! Nice job!COMMENT_END', 'Novel game concept!Feels like the type of platforming that could become an easy cult classic!COMMENT_END']

["A fun weird game, and I love it. It's got some decent mechanics. Good game.COMMENT_END", "Very cool art style, not quite as insane as your other game from the jam (also how on earth did you make 2 games for this jam), but it's awesome nonetheless. I like the crazy fast movement, tho it does get a bit hard to control at times. I think I made it thru the whole game, I killed everything on the level with the cover art guys all over the place and didn't see anywhere to go after that. Great work on this!COMMENT_END", 'The visuals are one of my favorites, they are charming and create this mysterious atmosphere with surprisingly good animations and effects. Gameplay wise alright too, maybe requires some more unique mechanics to actually stand out from other platformers - even though art already manages to do that.COMMENT_END', 'I\xa0really like this. The visuals are like something from a fever dream. I\xa0love the song, too. Great atmosphere. The wall jumping felt good (though the acceleration was a little intense)\xa0and the attacks were impactful. I hope you get to continue on because I feel like this could go somewhere interesting :)COMMENT_END', 'The art style is probably giving a bad first taste for players as this one has some good gameplay mechanics. I got "stuck" at the spawn of the first level as I honestly had no idea why I couldn\'t move, but the respawning spot just happens to be right in-between two blocks which makes moving left or right impossible. The controls weren\'t exactly what I would\'ve expected but got over it quite fast. Well done all-in-all.COMMENT_END', 'Cool game!\xa0Love the chaos of everythinCOMMENT_END']

['Not sure about the when it was created, but the game is pretty fun. It had two mechanics that worked well together.COMMENT_END', 'This game has been created before the jam has started.COMMENT_END', "Edit: The game was made before the jam started,boo.The art style was really nice and the gameplay was extremely tight, but some of the extra mechanics even after playing twice were quite unclear. Sometimes the double jump worked and sometimes it didn't, some levels could completed when they probably shouldn't have / the stars weren't really a thing as you skip them etc. And then there was that sign that auto activates after restarts, please no :/COMMENT_END", "This is some crispy platforming controls. Well done!\xa0best feeling controls I've had so far!COMMENT_END", 'platformer mechanics are smooth, great job!COMMENT_END', 'Esta bastan buen hechoCOMMENT_END', 'Good game ð\x9f\x91\x8dCOMMENT_END']

['I can agree with others, that the in tro was a bit too long. Skip button could help. It took me a while to realize that it is possible to go underground too. Somehow I wasn\'t able to pick up Gold with -\xa0"E", maybe I was doing something wrong.COMMENT_END', "This is a really cool concept!\xa0I\xa0love the idea of the snake's movement and how it's used to solve puzzles. Great job!COMMENT_END", 'Nice, a snake game. Well done.COMMENT_END', 'The game looks great but a button to make te text/story go faster would be really apreciatedCOMMENT_END', 'Good job! Tho a bit to much story before I even knew what the game was about.COMMENT_END', "It takes some time to get to the game itself so I recommend adding some screenshots / information on your game page about the game mechanics you chose (a skip button would also be really neat). Also, I might've accidentally chosen Day 3 first and am not sure what to do in the snaking part, and am too sleep-deprivated to watch the cutscenes again lol. But the snake game\xa0looks good and the visual novel parts seem\xa0to be well written.COMMENT_END"]

["I like the drink mixing, it's done very well. Would like to see this developed more in the future. Good job!COMMENT_END", 'This was fun to play, and very cute design. Would love to see you expand the game. Make sound and particles :DCOMMENT_END', 'Such a cute game! Really enjoyed this, and would love to see it developed further! Love the art style!COMMENT_END', 'Poor clients! I am probably the worst Barista ever. :DCOMMENT_END', 'What do i do after making the iced tea?COMMENT_END', 'This is a good idea, but it seems to me that the interface needs to be completed. Would like to see continuations or updates to this game)COMMENT_END', "Cute and fun game that really puts the crunch on you when you're nearing the end time. One constructive comment I'd say is to maybe make the option menus visible when the icon is hovered instead of having to click it, (although that could just be me as I am playing on a laptop and using a mousepad).COMMENT_END", 'Very cute game :)COMMENT_END']
