['Damn! I won! On 2nd try, which was unexpected, it seemed pretty hard but I gave it my all. Anyway, pretty nice bad-at-sports-so-has-to-cheat simulator, I had fun.COMMENT_END', 'I found this game very tricky, even on "easy" mode.\xa0 The controls were very challenging.\xa0 You could have fixed the the camera like so many racing games do.COMMENT_END', 'It took me awhile, but I\xa0beat it. Held W with my left pinky to reach controls better. This was fun! great gameCOMMENT_END', 'It was pretty hard to multitask so I ended up just focusing on the main mechanic. Well done :DCOMMENT_END', "I don't know that I can describe how bad I was at this game. \xa0I could not keep up with anyone, let alone, hit someone with trash.\xa0\xa0I needed a much easier mode.\xa0\xa0Wish you the best with it.COMMENT_END", 'Tough game for me, so many different things to keep an eye on and have to perform. A fun challenging game.COMMENT_END', "Fun game !\xa0I feel like i don't have enough hands !COMMENT_END"]

['The mechanics were fun and match the theme of the round. I would like to see where you go with the development of this game.COMMENT_END', 'pretty interesting combat, if you develop it further, let the player know better the anticipation of attacks (both of the player and the enemy). nice workCOMMENT_END', 'Getting some dark souls 1 vibes from the heavy combat. Actually had to think how to attack instead of just spamming. But in the end it is what it says on the tin and is only a prototype. No clue what lizards have to do with this game, but was an interesting one-off.COMMENT_END', 'This was so fun to play. I\xa0wish there was something more than a tutorial level.COMMENT_END']

["Awesome job and so creative! I can't rate it because I don't have my own submission. Youve still got my vote!COMMENT_END", 'Fun arcade top down shooter, I like these games. Good first game, I think it has a lot of potential.COMMENT_END', "Good job for the first game, I hope you'll continue exploring with game making!\xa0I suggest updating your Itch.io page to match the game's style (at least adding a picture) so people will find it better.COMMENT_END", "pretty well made both mechs fits well with the theme you're goingit does align well with the taskloved it!i thought those green dots that coming from the right are bullets and thought id be dead after 3 seconds being in the game ð\x9f\x92\x80COMMENT_END", 'This was great!\xa0My highscore was 5000 before it lagged to much for input to process.COMMENT_END']

['I really like the Idea, huge fan of mechanics with high reward/risk so the freeze for heal was fun. Would absolutly love see this getting continued into a full gameCOMMENT_END', "The mechanics, shooting and healing worked pretty well together. Deciding when to freeze and for how long in order to heal is a novel idea. I\xa0think the game has a lot of potential. I think it could use a bit of polish as well to make things run smoother to better demonstrate the mechanics you implemented. But it's a good start.COMMENT_END", "After retrying the game it decided to work, no clue what has changed since the latest update is from before trying to play it, oh well. It was rather bare bones and the enemies kept getting stuck as their pathfinding is probably just move towards the player. Also the player could go into negative integers and it wasn't some one off as it happened every time. The trees also were so large they blocked the enemies and the player's movement.COMMENT_END", 'I like the secondary mechanic. The inability to move is a huge risk but it can pay off if you get enough healing. Could be fun to expand :)COMMENT_END', 'pretty cool concept attack as the core and heals you but freezes you as the "payment" to get your self healednice work man!COMMENT_END', "This is a great prototype. I can't seem to get the healing/freezing (assuming this is the 2nd mechanic) otherwise, fun to play!COMMENT_END", "The game is borked, may or may not be your fault as it tries to access some raytracing.cpp function that doesn't exist.COMMENT_END"]

['The jet pack mechanic mixed with the laser worked well to create the puzzles. Well done, this is a fun game. I\xa0hope to see you keep working on it.COMMENT_END', 'I really like the mechanics and find a lot of potential in how you have to use mirrors to shoot enemies\xa0while keeping your balance. A difficult but rewarding game. Well done.COMMENT_END', "The mechanic were all there but the two levels there were are so short I don't really know if this could be called a game, maybe a prototype at most. Not the worst this jam has had to offer, but still a bit disappointed.COMMENT_END", 'This was so much fun. I\xa0wish the tilting was a little more precise, but this was so fun.COMMENT_END']

['Well done mechanics, I hope you make it so I can see you continue to develop this, with a bit more work it can be really addicting.COMMENT_END', "I wouldn't count yourself out yet!\xa0 Even with the bug in the web build, you hit the criteria well and you'll hopefully have chances later to add art and polish.COMMENT_END", 'Cool concept! If you continue to work on it, you might want to add some detail to the floor or the background to give visual feedback that the player is moving around in the level (since the level is bigger than one screen, and the camera follows the player). On the (Linux) desktop version I sometimes had to click the weapon to discard multiple times before it worked (not game breaking but would be nice to fix).COMMENT_END', 'I love the idea of constantly switching weapon and I hope you make it to other round. Could use some polishing like art and sound but great mechanics.COMMENT_END', 'This is a great prototype! well doneCOMMENT_END', 'It felt nice, do some polishing and this will be awesome! :DCOMMENT_END', 'I liked itCOMMENT_END', "Hm. For some reason I cant discard weapon. It's a shame, I was very interested in chainsaw\xa0)COMMENT_END"]

["As far as the judging criteria, you have collecting and using items working, It would be better to have a little more that would demonstrate your mechanics, but that's not necessary to meet the challenge.\xa0Wish there was a bigger sense of progression, but this is a good start and this can be developed into a pretty fun game. Good work!COMMENT_END", 'Your 3D-layout and environmental design are atm the best parts of the game, so if you just manage to add the rest of the components, this could actually be a fine survival game.COMMENT_END', 'Fun sandbox game. Would love crafting!COMMENT_END', 'Deforestation is such a cool thing I decided to cut down every tree on the island. And all I got for it was a lousy 698 wood and a headache from the characters constipation moans. Not worth it.COMMENT_END']

['Thank you everyone for the inspiring words and the suggestions. I will definitely continue to develop and update the game! ;)COMMENT_END', "A nice gravity switching platformer. Found it a bit frustrating when the level extended past the screen but the camera didn't until the character moved there. But this is a fun game.COMMENT_END", "I found this really fun to play. There's def some difficulty to it, but it gave me a similar feeling to Geometry Dash, where I really wanted to master the course and see what lies ahead. I hope you continue working on this!COMMENT_END", 'This might be my own lack of skill, but this ended up being a rage game to me lol. As someone who needs to "git\xa0gud", an option for checkpoints for round 2 would be great lol. Good job! this is a fun game!COMMENT_END', 'Unintentionally the most fun game thus far, decided for no reason to do a 0 orb speedrun which took in total 20 minutes of spamming Q so hard I had to take breaks. First level was for sure the hardest while the two others were a breeze after that. Maybe not the most unique in mechanics but entertaining regardless!COMMENT_END']

['Somehow I really liked the main characters design\xa0:) Well implemented mechanics, good one!COMMENT_END', "It was a shame there weren't more gimmicks to the movement system. After a few levels it had really ran its course and could've used an upgrade or a sidegrade to spruce up the gameplay. The levels were a bit too boxy and repetitive to keep my interest as I kept getting lost in the exact same looking squares with the only difference being where the enemies were put.COMMENT_END", 'Heh.COMMENT_END', 'Yooooooooo I love this game!!! So much fun.For me, it was the story of a sword, tired of its master being a drunken fool, becomes sentient one night and takes his unconscious, drunken master out to finally be a warrior!COMMENT_END', 'Another fellow Samurai + reflect game. Love it!COMMENT_END', 'A fun and wild chaotic ride! I would like to see where you take this.COMMENT_END', 'This was so fun. The chaotic ragdoll physics combined with the slashing it was fun! I would really like to see this game develop further!COMMENT_END', "I'd be interested to see more of this :)COMMENT_END"]

["Very simple project that probably could've used a bit more time in the oven. No audio besides background music that sounded a bit too loud for my ears, the potions were very difficult to see against the backgrounds of almost same colour + too small, some of the areas were extremely difficult to differentiate so I got stuck without knowing there was a wall.COMMENT_END", "The platforming feels tight! I\xa0agree with the feedback of some of the others though, it was sometimes hard to see my character with the background elements and I'd get stuck on things I didn't expect. It took me a few attempts to notice the potions were dropping and the game felt better to play once I saw them.COMMENT_END", 'A good game, easy to grab but hard to master (as it should be.)COMMENT_END', "Control feels really fluid. The visibility could be better, sometimes it's hard to distinguish decor from gameplay elements. Very solid entry !COMMENT_END", 'Great game! The character feels great to control and wall jumping is well implemented. The pixel art looks good, I just wish the pixel size were consistent. Still a very solid game. Well done.COMMENT_END', "This is a sick game and a great idea. I don't know why I've never seen an arena style platforming survival game before but it works so well! I did have some trouble seeing potions like someone already mentioned but other than that the game is sick!COMMENT_END", 'Sprites, Pixel art, mechanics and music! Superb!COMMENT_END', "I love the wall jump and music! and my highest score I got was 40-50 seconds left? It's hard to tell where the potions are in the heat of the moment. Maybe I would add a visual red arrow to the nearest potion from the player to help. Other than that, great job!COMMENT_END", 'Great controls with all the cool platforming actions. Tough to keep dodging everything. Well done! One thing I would improve is the visibility of the potions.COMMENT_END', 'Really fun game and played it multiple times, the character looks and moves really well and I love dodging everything, feels good. I think the best I got to was about 20 seconds left but not sure exactly as the timer disappeared. Everything is really good and only things I can think of that could make it better would be slightly more potions and a slightly slower wind speed at least to begin withCOMMENT_END', "That was really tough. Really enjoyed this one, though. Would like to see where you'd take this if you progress and decide you want to continue with this idea.COMMENT_END"]

["Overall good experience! I love the games with this pixel vibe, good job with post processing. Also atmosphere was a bit scary and I loved that image with boy. Wind sounds are not on the loop, so they end after a while. I got a bit confused in the maze and couldn't finish the game.COMMENT_END", "The light and camera items were a cool idea. I\xa0liked the maze and the art style. I'd like to see where you take this game.COMMENT_END", "This game has a great environment! the gameplay is a little confusing. I\xa0explored the maze for 10 min and couldn't find anything... there's also no way to exit the in-game game without completing the task that I\xa0couldn't seem to complete. Great job on graphics!COMMENT_END"]

['I like finding and getting the foxes to follow back, I think the game could be expanded on. Great work! Also, I liked the art style in this, it fits the game.COMMENT_END', "I had a good time playing but I would suggest making a web build or looking a bit in the optimizition part because a lot will just ignore it due to file size and you'll be missing votes even tho the game is greatCOMMENT_END", 'A very fun little game. In some ways it reminds me of trying to get my dog back when she is off leash at the dog park. :)COMMENT_END', 'loved it!very well align with the task both core and secondary really fits wellnice work man!you know that blue ice platform yeah i kinda left the fox there and it diedmy bad..COMMENT_END', 'The atmosphere was great, and the foxes look funny :) Good Job, I just dont understand how the game can have 400mbCOMMENT_END', 'Cool concept! I wish things were just a bit quicker, but fun.COMMENT_END', 'I think the game does a great job in setting the mood, from the initial cutscene, to the igloo, to all the effects (water, snow and so on). I think it has a lot of potential for future expansion (loved the hexagonal tiles!)COMMENT_END', "3D art is the game's strongest point, especially those funky looking foxes. Not sure what the \xa0mechanics are tho since they are not stated on the jam page. Collect foxes /\xa0hit the blocks maybe?COMMENT_END"]

["I have no clue what the bamboos were supposed to be as practically ever single enemy could be skipped to reach the end. The collisions were extremely wonky and some of the bamboo sticks could even push you into the traps. Throughout the game I had no idea what any of the abilities did, so I never used them. The combat didn't have much going on and it resulted in just spamming attacks until something died.COMMENT_END", 'The upgrades allowing you to destroy the different types of bamboo fit the challenge pretty well. Along the lines of\xa0Metroid. I think the core mechanic could have been a little more polished to help show the mechanics better, but this was fun and well done.COMMENT_END', 'Very cool idea! Some polishing on the enemies and the movement and this game will be fire!COMMENT_END', 'The art style is cuteCOMMENT_END', 'The art style is cuteCOMMENT_END', 'I was wondering where this game was! I remember seeing a "box punching" game early on and wanted to see its progress! Love the concept!COMMENT_END', 'Funny concept, and I like the art style, very vibrant.COMMENT_END']

['A rather poorly made version of cookie cutter that has apparently been spammed to every single possible jam that exists.COMMENT_END', 'fun little clicking gameloved it! nice work manno i didnt use an auto clicker to get 1m cashwish life is this easy...COMMENT_END', 'A fun, addicting, little game. I liked the upgrade mechanics.COMMENT_END', 'Nice idle game, and I would love to see this gold rush theme expanded. Like rare Wild West themed coins that appear randomly, etc.COMMENT_END', "I love idle games so I was a fan of this one immediately. I would've liked some more mechanics rather than just spam clicking the gold coin and buying auto clicker guys, but I think it's a good base to build off of and explore new mechanics. Great job!COMMENT_END"]

['I really liked the mechanics and ho they worked together, and can see this being expanded on. Aside from the slow walking, good work!COMMENT_END', 'This game looks really good and could be a really cool game with strong narrative, however the walk speed as it is now is really slow and just walking from my mom to the door felt like 5 minutes passed. So maybe you could speed that up in the future versions, even a little bit.COMMENT_END', 'Mistery! I loved that first time when the pillar dropped. Loop concept is a good niche. Reminded me of the game Death Loop or movie Groundhog day. I hope you will keep adding more to this game.COMMENT_END', 'Interesting concept! I would love to see what future loops look like!COMMENT_END', 'Honestly expcted another pillar to appear out of the darkness, but oh well. It was short, like shortest thus far. No idea if I accidentally skipped something and got the required items too fast.COMMENT_END']

["This is a cool game idea. I like simulated desktops in games for some reason idk why. I wasn't able to figure out the morse code part, there was one letter I couldn't figure out what it was. It'd be nice if you could scrub thru the audio file to listen to specific parts of it instead of having to listen to the full thing each time. This was cool tho great work!COMMENT_END", 'Nailed the two mechanics theme of the round. The usage of editing the text files and changing their types was great. Loved this entry. Good work!COMMENT_END', 'Very interesting game idea, it was really fun so good work. One thing though is that the game was locked into windowed mode so i had the computer right up to my face trying to read the textCOMMENT_END', 'Really unique game! Amazing work!COMMENT_END', "It took me three tries to even get into the game on windows. After spamming the login screen with all the possible letters and mouse I only got a crash to desktop. If that isn't taken into account, it was a nice short indie experience.COMMENT_END", "This is great! The morse code part is really tough to do. I\xa0think if you added a .5 sec break between letters, it would be more manageable. It's also easy to find a morse translator, but since you have the hex translator, the morse translator should be added in the future.Aside from those nit-picks, this is great! It gave me the feeling I\xa0had when I\xa0was learning ctf stuff with pico8 and such. Very well done!COMMENT_END"]

['"PC LOAD LETTER? What the hell does that mean?"COMMENT_END', "I like the mechanics you have here, there's a lot of potential for a pretty sweet beat 'em up type destruction game. I definitely would love to see where you take this game. Good work!COMMENT_END", 'I like the vibe a lot! The camera angle and the 3d + 2d combined is really cool!COMMENT_END', 'Cool concept but gets repetitive really quick. Some sound effects\xa0would make it a lot  better.COMMENT_END', 'Getting some cool "Office Space" vibes here. \xa0It\'s a fun early concept, would love to see some more progression and diversity in what we smash (also some smash graphics and sound would be fun too).COMMENT_END', 'Very well executed i loved itCOMMENT_END']

["I LOVED the art and music for the game, its so cute! It took me longer than I would like to admit to figure out I had to enter the house before the game began. Some of the mechanics could be a little finicky and the movement wasn't always smooth but overall I had a great time.COMMENT_END", 'Shooting and rebuilding are good mechanics that compliment each other in this game. Side note, I liked the art a lot.COMMENT_END', 'Not sure what the secondary mechanic was for this one,COMMENT_END', 'Very cool art and animations! Fun game, well done!COMMENT_END', 'Very spooky aliens )))COMMENT_END', 'Got the alien and fixed the fence!! Pretty fun game!COMMENT_END', "This game concept really interested me; I didn't fully understand the mechanics, but I managed to kill one of the aliens! I didn't see any other ones spawn though.COMMENT_END", 'The game seems interesting, but I was confused what the mechanics were and what the goal was.COMMENT_END']

['This had the mechanics down pretty good. I think they are fun working together. Fun game.COMMENT_END', 'Now that the game is working and playable, I liked it, but not probably the way that was intended. The level design was a bit inconsistent in terms of design and where kill boxes were placed,BUTthat actually allowed for so many different ways to complete the level.
