Flipping gravity will always be an awesome game mechanic!COMMENT_END', 'Not going to give any rating until the game is running, currently the program tries to access some path that doesn\'t exist. Also no clue what the different files are supposed to be.From the webs:"Hi, you are forgetting the file ending in pck.COMMENT_END']

["Its a shame the moment to moment gameplay is really just holding down the movement keys and spamming different numbers. The random items could've used some variety in what they accomplish as some felt like being downgrades or upgrades of others, and some didn't feel to have much impact. Not sure if there were more items because it really did look like there were a lot of items in the menu.COMMENT_END", 'The core and secondary mechanics worked very well together and the game was very fun. Well done!COMMENT_END', 'well made, well executed, well thoughtloved thisonline multiplayer would be aweseome i wanna troll my friends while playing thisCOMMENT_END', "Woah, this is an awesome game! Reminds me a different game, but I can't quite put my finger on it. I adore the visuals of this game! It all feels so warm, not to mention all the different sections of the map having completely different art. An excellent game!COMMENT_END", 'This is so fun! I wish the player camera was closer to the left side of the screen, or at least more zoomed out to allow for actual ability for avoiding the obstacles. Otherwise, this is an amazing submissionCOMMENT_END', 'This game goes SUPER hard!COMMENT_END']

["Absolutely incredible game. 10/10. Super polished for a prototype too! Can't wait to see what you do next!COMMENT_END", "Great puzzle game with some fun levels. Accomplished the theme of the round. I\xa0had fun, good game, I'd like to see it developed further.COMMENT_END", "Honestly don't know why this has so few ratings. The game was extremely free flowing and you were allowed to completely screw yourself over if so wanted. In some levels I just built for the sake of doing it and not chasing the time. Simple graphics and audio were a nice addition to this mechanic heavy game.COMMENT_END", 'I was shocked to see that those blocks can be placed on map. Pretty cool! Also art style is cute!COMMENT_END', 'Great idea, and great implementation!COMMENT_END']

['I get the mechanics you were going for, and I\xa0think you have a good start to a game. Felt like the implementation was a bit confusing. Good start.COMMENT_END', 'Cool idea!\xa0\xa0but my pc fans went like crazy xDCOMMENT_END', 'The vibe of this game was cool! I\xa0think with some player feedback, this would be a lot of fun to play!COMMENT_END', "I honestly have no clue what the game is. There's a crown that takes damage every frame when standing next to it and enemies? that also instantly die on contact. The background music gets louder the longer it goes on and even at half volume my ears were bleeding from the volume peeking.This is some prime first jam made by Unreal Engine 5.COMMENT_END"]

['This was epic! Felt like a little movie :DCOMMENT_END', "Cool concept. My first game was a bit weird since i chose turret that didn't match the type of my wagon, so my train was not doing anything but still survived. Second game i chose carefully but i think my train blow itself after 2 seconds. Third run i think i managed to kill everyone. I think it's a bit messy for now but really curious to see more of this concept.COMMENT_END", "This was a really cool auto battler, I don't think I've ever seen one in 3d like this. I liked the cinematic camera angles tho sometimes they clipped into the enemies and I couldn't see what was going on. I like all the different enemies and upgrading between waves, it's fun to build a big death train. I would've liked to be able to see mine and the enemies health bar during the fights, I couldn't really tell how things were going until the fight was over. Great work on this!COMMENT_END", 'The overall feel was great but there is so much that could be improved. The most annoying was the AI just running around and past the edge of the world becoming unkillable, the cannons felt awful as they constantly kept missing compared to every other form of damage (rockets op), the camera swaps should probably be upto the player instead of on a timer, and obviously the graphics could be better. Still the first 5 minutes were amazing, but wither rather fast.COMMENT_END', 'The game was fun, but I found that the camera was a bit too close, and made it hard to tell what was going on.COMMENT_END', 'Very cinematic experience! Fun and exciting!)COMMENT_END', 'Great concept! I thought I wouldn\'t be a big fan of autobattlers but something about the rooting for your train to outspeed or "outgun" the enemies was awesome. Large Railgun OPCOMMENT_END', 'Something about this hit all the right spots for me. The train battles were great. This has a lot of potential.COMMENT_END', 'I really loved this. It felt badass seeing the cameras switch between the enemies and that train. Great take on a tower defence game. Hope you make it through to the next round, I feel like this game really has some potential. Good job!COMMENT_END', 'Train games are approvedCOMMENT_END', 'I love the idea of a train roguelike!In round 2, I would love to see a little more work put on the presentation, because I think the mechanics are good, but the UI and battle scene could be improved a bit to matchCOMMENT_END']

['This has impressive polish. It feels very complete for a jam game, props on your level of effort :)\xa0 I was initially kind of confused how the ammo/mining worked but once I figured it out the game meshed wellCOMMENT_END', 'Its cool and unqiue, I like it! :DCOMMENT_END', "The art is satisfying and the concept is unique and fun, but I dont know if it's my pc but quite often when explosions happened the game start running on low fpCOMMENT_END", 'The traversal is really fun, especially with the dash. Definitely has a strong sense of progression; upgrades, levels, and having to bomb to refill your ammo. The particles flying everywhere look great, I started spamming a lot and got a bit of lag but the effect of all that destruction was really cool.COMMENT_END', 'Fun action game with upgrades. Got a bit grindy but I think that just means it has a lot of potential to grow.COMMENT_END']

['This was very clever. \xa0I love how you did so much with so little (in the best way possible). \xa0Also, all the upgrades were very cool. \xa0I really\xa0hope you get a chance to enhance and grow this.COMMENT_END', "It's pretty cool, but I think the movement needs a little polishing. Well done! :DCOMMENT_END", 'love the idea of adding new perks each jump .\xa0the theorycraft you do in your head when you chose the new perk is cool , when you have that flash of insight when you reach a new room and you\'re like "oh\xa0 so that\'s why/when i need the sticky perk" for exemple or "if i want to make it in the most effective way i choose that first hten ... " .COMMENT_END', 'Very difficult for me but fun. Took me a long time to get used to jump happening on release instead of on key down. The puzzles were great and interesting.COMMENT_END', 'Neat concept!COMMENT_END', 'Interesting idea!COMMENT_END', 'Not sure what the controls are, sometimes W - D is working, sometimes not? And also when do we unlock a new ability? I will rate once i get clarity lol.COMMENT_END']

['I really love gravity changes.\xa0 I actually almost used it, too!\xa0 My only note would be that some of the levels had you run into spikes so fast that you almost had to know what the room would be like to progress.COMMENT_END', 'Love it, has a good rage/ addiction as you want to make it to the next screen! lol When you get to the blue level are you supposed to beat the doors before they close?COMMENT_END', "I like gravity switching games and I like some tough games. It was a fun, but dying because the guy hit something off screen is not the best way to make a game difficult. I think the concept can be taken much further and hope to see you make it better (I'll still play the games if I don't make it).COMMENT_END", 'Very cool!COMMENT_END', 'Like the primary mechanic, did not get the secondary mechanic. But fun game. I wish it had checkpoints because my slow brain struggled a lot. But fun game nevertheless!COMMENT_END', 'I thought this was really clever and fun. \xa0I just had trouble playing it because the character slides so fast and my reaction times are so slow. \xa0I wish there was an option (settings or a button) that made him slide slower.\xa0 Still, this was a very good puzzle game with strong mechanics.COMMENT_END', 'I thought this was an interesting game - the gravity switching was a cool mechanic, although the secondary mechanic of the mechanic helper was a little passive. It would have been nice to be able to directly activate the helper so you have more control on removing barriers. I think this would be a cool game to develop further!COMMENT_END']

['This was a fun platformer! The mechanic of changing your shape and each one having different traits was really nice. I had fun playing thru it and would be interested to see what you cook up if you kept working on the game. Great job!COMMENT_END', "The shape changing was great with the different shapes having different speed, jump height, and weight. I think respawning at each screen instead of always at the start would have been more fun, but that's a personal preference. Good mechanics, well done!COMMENT_END", "I've played some of these fast paced die/restart games during this jam and this one is theonlyon that hasn't had a checkpoint system at room swap. The idea here is good and could be iterated upon, but that respawning is rough.COMMENT_END", "I\xa0got stuck in the first room. I actually had to watch your video to figure out how to flip the switch -- it wasn't intuitive to me that I'd have to switch shapes to flip it\xa0ð\x9f\x98\x85 I tried to jump into the flashing shape but that didn't do anything either.COMMENT_END", 'This is a great concept. I can only think of other puzzles and additions that would make it better. As a prototype, perfect!COMMENT_END', "I enjoyed playing your game, even though I'm not good at platformers. The idea of transforming into different forms with different qualities seemed fun and interesting to me. Though I didn't immediately understand how to transform - I think adding some control information at the beginning of the game would be good. The music fits the game's pace, and you could add a timer for speedrunners - I think they would enjoy the game first and foremost.COMMENT_END", "It's a good platformer, but it needs some work. Don't give up and keep developing. I'll wait for the update)COMMENT_END", 'Fun game.COMMENT_END']

["Well it seems like you've had a lot of comments about having a delay, but overall besides a little polish this is a solid game!\xa0 Great job!COMMENT_END", 'That was fun :)COMMENT_END', 'The games is super fluid and feels great, the only problem I encontered is when I go in\xa0 anew room there is a chance that all enemies are going to insta killthe player so maybe add a little delay or something but I cant wait to see this gaem developped furtherCOMMENT_END', 'Smooth gameplay, the only thing I would like to improve is to add a delay when entering a room. Otherwise I would die before I got the chance to see what happened. You might also want to add some ui when dashing, to show how far you will go.COMMENT_END', 'Smooth gameplay and satisfying movement. Well done!COMMENT_END', 'Had fun going through the levels. One thing that bugged me was that sometime I could get hurt when entering a new room before I could see what was going on. Other than that I think the game has potential.COMMENT_END', "I really like how the combat works! Having to dash to deal damage has always been a gameplay type I've wanted to play. It is dampened a little by being insta-killed upon entering a room... those ranged enemies will haunt my dreams.COMMENT_END"]

['Holy crap what a game!!! I love the concept and the whole point is to bring awareness to texting and driving. Good job and wonder what you would do next in this game?COMMENT_END', 'The mechanics are there, staying on the road and texting. Those two together were challenging. I think the game has more potential, good work!COMMENT_END', 'While the idea is there the actual implementation seems like a bit a hit-or-miss. The bar seems to float around either very wildly or get stuck at the edge. By the first gas station on the third try I was already quite bored as I had only gotten one message and at the second I crashed instantly as I looked down. It was a relief there was a timer on the bar instead of just instantly doing it, but the gameplay was rather stale regardless.COMMENT_END', 'Very creative. Personally, I would have made the messages appear faster and require fewer keys to be pressed because I was reaching the goal before sending a single message.COMMENT_END', 'I crashed my car and killed an entire family of people. Then I tried this game and it was pretty fun!COMMENT_END', "The idea is great, gotta try it irl (jk I don't even have a driving license). The game looks good and is well implemented, texting tho is madly hard but it fits with the game.COMMENT_END", 'this was so much fun! \xa0I definitely felt the pressure from trying to balance things out. \xa0 no real issues i ran into. \xa0I have an ultrawide setup and it seemed to work out just fine.COMMENT_END', 'I really enjoyed playing your gameâ\x80\x94itâ\x80\x99s such a smart and creative way to teach an important lesson: donâ\x80\x99t text and drive! The mechanics, like managing the chat and driving simultaneously, are so well done, and the increasing difficulty keeps it engaging.COMMENT_END', 'This game changed my lifeCOMMENT_END', "OMG THIS GAME'S PERFECTIONCOMMENT_END"]

['I was expecting a bit more than just 3 platforms and an enemy, but then again it does say prototype on the name. Not really much to comment on as it is just about as simple as it can be.COMMENT_END', 'I love the art! Its a pretty common game concept but its well executed. It could have done with some twist to differentiate it from other platformers.COMMENT_END', 'Art is lit!\nI think the transition animations are bit janky. when plyer jumps and hit something in air it starts running in air. controls needs bit improvements.\noverall this game has potential.COMMENT_END', 'Great job! Art is really nice and also the animation!COMMENT_END', 'Cool visuals\xa0ð\x9f\x98\x8e I could see this being very atmospheric with more time.COMMENT_END', 'This looks stunning!COMMENT_END', 'The art style is undoubtedly striking. The character looks very interesting and mysterious; it makes me want to learn more about his backstory :)COMMENT_END', "Liked the character art and style. The attacking was a bit boring and seemed to come down to being able to spam click fast enough to kill the enemy before dying. Still, it's a fun platformer.COMMENT_END", 'Very cool art and animations! I wish the platformer controller felt a bit snappier though (right now they feel slow and floaty). But the main thing I\xa0think you should think about about is how you could make the combat feel more strategic, right now the way I did it was to just run into the enemy and spam left click. A little animation that the enemy plays before attacking would make the player able to dodge it!COMMENT_END', 'Very cool artstyle! Did you do it yourself? It fits the world nicely! Maybe you want to guide us what the core and secondary mechanic are?COMMENT_END', 'Great start, the animations are my favorite part and the visuals are captivating. I also like the use of the UI with it only showing the HP when you get near an enemy. Keep it upCOMMENT_END']

['Very addictive and creative. I played it repeatedly several times.COMMENT_END', "Wow, gambling didn't work out for me at all. First game I got minus O2 twice in a row, then got the death. Second and third times were not much better. A cool idea, I think it has potential.COMMENT_END", "I rolled die in like a few tries and that was not a great first experience. Really would've like to see some progression or a difficulty curve as the upgrades felt rather useless as I couldn't ever afford them when I kept rolling the bad ones. The graphical style was interesting but the level design or the lack of it really kept the game's feel muted.COMMENT_END", 'this is very cool the idea is very well put intogreat work man!yeah im bad at gambling dies on the first minuteCOMMENT_END', 'Cool game but is there a way to get oxygen other than the wheel? :)COMMENT_END']

['Very well done and I\xa0know you made your engine. You got two mechanics that compliment each other well and you use both to kill the enemies. Well done!COMMENT_END', "This is a really cool start to a game! The fact that you made your own engine for this is crazy impressive. I like how the enemies deform when you shoot the iron at them, it's cool to fly close to them and see what I've done to them. It'd be nice if there was some indicator of how much iron you have mined and I'd like a crosshair to see where I'm shooting at. Very impressive work I can't imagine how much code it was to do this in 2 weeks.COMMENT_END", 'Impressive!\xa0 :DCOMMENT_END', 'bro made an entire engine during this jam and featured creepers in it.deserve 5 stars for sureCOMMENT_END', 'great gameCOMMENT_END', 'Lets go pirate! Wanna see what more things you have planned!COMMENT_END', 'DONT WORRY CAPTAIN!I took care of those pesky shadow clone cubes for ya ð\x9f\x98¤This game is the golden child for all aspiring planet mining games, we MUST see it to round 5COMMENT_END', 'very neat! id love to see this idea developed on furtherCOMMENT_END', 'Bro made an entire game engine for the jamCOMMENT_END']

['interesting concept but its kind of hard. Would like upgrades and some music effect when interact with plants. swaping place or when it is fully watered.\xa0\xa0\xa0Maybe some icon abowe plant if they need water or sun.COMMENT_END', "Kinda surprised there was no mechanic where if you left the plant in either the sun or the water for too long they would also start taking damage. Maybe there could've been different types of plants that gain or lose their stats at entirely different rates. Currently it is a one and done deal without much to offer beyond the first play.COMMENT_END", 'A fun little game. Everything works together nicely.COMMENT_END', 'Its simple and fun! I like it!COMMENT_END', 'This is a simple but neat game. But I am unsure of what the secondary mechanic is. Drag and drop itself is a single mechanic. But great game!COMMENT_END', 'Cool concept. I agree with the other comment about swapping 2 plants. That would be a great addition for quality of life. I think there are many cool directions you can take this idea. For example, just having the rain come and go in different areas of the room\xa0would add a great challenge to the game. Nice work, hope you keep at it.COMMENT_END', "Lovely art, I love a plant-themed game. A few things I think will make the game feel more intuitive: letting players swap plants' positions without needing to move them to another position first. The detection of plant moving seems to rely on the mouse position, so sometimes, even though the plant sprite is in the placement area, it won't move because the mouse is outside of the area. I think it would feel better if the detection aligned with the plant sprite. Still, very good job!COMMENT_END"]

['And interesting mechanics to add to the classic snake game. Well done.COMMENT_END', 'Very simple but actual fun gameCOMMENT_END', "Special skills are a nice and welcoming\xa0addition to the original snake game. My main problem is the fact that you are able to turn backwards, except you are not and will lose immediately. A few times, I tried to turn around really quickly (let's say, press left and then down) but it didn't register the first input quickly enough and I just ended up losing.COMMENT_END", "Snake, not much else going on, don't know what the secondary mechanic is supposed to be but the core mechanic works. A bit too loud, but otherwise nothing much of note.COMMENT_END"]

["The last level was a bit wonky as I couldn't figure out what the gimmick was so I just jumped the arrow, which didn't seem like the solution as it was having a spasm the entire time in the wall. No real depth, but the idea could easily be expanded upon.COMMENT_END", 'Satisfying second level. And i managed destroy two earth bariers with one red arrow.COMMENT_END', 'Very nice puzzle-platformer!\xa0Good job !COMMENT_END', 'there is a lot of bug with the platforms that make the platforming weird but your concept has potential\xa0there are many things that you can do with your mechanicsCOMMENT_END', 'Still kinda clunky/buggy BUT has a lot of potential! The second puzzle was actually fun to solve and I believe there are so many things you could do with your arrow system. You got all my support now. (the linky player pig is also a peak of art)COMMENT_END', "I liked the concept, the controls were a bit frustrating but it was fun. I think you got the two mechanics down and I think this concept can be taking in lot of different directions and I'd like to see where it goes.COMMENT_END", "Cool concept! I would recommend adding some reset button, I didn't read the tutorial (thats on me) and instantly shot my arrow getting me stuck. Also messed up on the controls a few times pressing space thinking it was jump resulting in me getting stuck. Other then that I like the idea and it could be a fun puzzle game!COMMENT_END", 'The last level was my favorite, very good use of mechanicsCOMMENT_END', "I'm not sure if im doing it wrong, but im unable to shoot an arrow. Seems like a cool concept thoughCOMMENT_END", 'Password?COMMENT_END']

['I like the idea, reminds me of some classic games. This has a lot potential if you keep developing it.COMMENT_END', 'Cool idea! I think these mechanics could be implemented very well into a full project.Well done!COMMENT_END', "This is a fun concept!\xa0I\xa0wish the enemy didn't move so dramatically. I\xa0felt like I\xa0didn't have any time to respond to their movementCOMMENT_END"]

game_title: The Second Temptation of Jeremiah Whitechapel
comments_raw: ['Had to restart a few times but got the hang of it. I think the mechanics are interesting and hope it gets developed more. Great work.COMMENT_END', "Visuals in this game are very good, but as someone mentioned it's laggy. Very interesting and big idea. Hope to see this develop further. Great workCOMMENT_END", '- Tabbing without the "interaction" area close by breaks the mouse as it doesn\'t release and movement stops or keeps going on its own- The menu at the start isVERYdifficult to see, as I had to look at the video to figure out where it was- General bad FPS, but that is to be expected from UE5- Transitioning to the other level completely bricked the controls but the game didn\'t crash- Couldn\'t really figure out what the spells were supposed to be as there were four different direction keys to be used- Development build, that\'s it.Interesting idea that could probably be developed further, but currently it is very bare bones.COMMENT_END', 'Its a very nice looking game! I know you mentioned before that these are premade assets, but it comes together nice. I will say though that I think some more work should be put into the "game loop" as far as how the player can understand it. The game kinda tells you what to do in a little text box for a few seconds, but as a player I didnt really know how that should work. Eventually I sussed it out, but after that I still didnt know what the objective was. Eventually I found the enemies outside I could beat, but that seemed to be it. We arent required to make a full game, but it would be good to give the player a hint of progression a bit moreCOMMENT_END']

['The actual shooting part of the game was probably the most lacking compared to the rest of the game. Ship upgrades and different ships entirely but in the end the gameplay is just hold mouse 1 and spin around to kill enemies. The graphics and audio were simple and served their purpose well.COMMENT_END', 'I really liked the top down shooter mechanics with the upgrades. This is a really good game. Good work!COMMENT_END', 'I like all the different upgrades and being able to zome out or in the camera as I lke. Only thing I could suggest is having a little margin between the UI and The corner of the screenCOMMENT_END', "I went with a missile build and after maxing both missiles and attack speed the game can't keep up with the missile spam lolCOMMENT_END", 'Such a good game! It was very fun!COMMENT_END', 'This is a great entry. It looks fabulous and the â\x80\x9cjuiceâ\x80\x9d feels just right. I think the â\x80\x9cauto aimâ\x80\x9d may be a little overpowered as I felt myself just having the RMB pressed all the time. Maybe limit it somehow? One thing that I would also suggest is to scale the background when zooming out the playing field, otherwise, solid entry.\nI wanted to mention that I actually started with a space shooter very similar to yours and I even had â\x80\x9ctank controlsâ\x80\x9d like yours. I also experimented with mouse aim but also removed it in favor of something much simpler. Iâ\x80\x99d love to hear your thoughts on my control scheme.COMMENT_END', 'I liked this a lot. \xa0Especially loved being able to zoom in and out.\xa0\xa0I hope you get to expand on this and I get to play it again.COMMENT_END', 'very cool idea it really aligns well with the task and well executed i gotta saythe way our camera follows the aiming of our ship is very cool, it really gives you the dynamic feeling of\xa0controlling a ship and aiming a shotoverall this is awesome would like to see this to be developed further!no i didnt play this 10 minutes straight and role play as darth vader while shooting the enemiesa star wars themed ship would be cool thoCOMMENT_END']

["I liked this game a lot. \xa0Good use of two mechanics. \xa0It was also that rare game for me that wasn't too hard.\xa0\xa0It started nice and easy as we learned how the game work. \xa0I hope you get to continue this game and add levels and maybe even a little more graphical flare (even if you stay with squares).COMMENT_END", 'Great job!\xa0 The music actually had me picturing some kind of rhythm version of this game where the movement is automatic and you have to press different buttons to attack or interact at different times, but that\'s beside the point haha.\xa0 Good job!\xa0 I would recommend making spacebar unspammable because saying "please don\'t spam" activates some feral part of gamers that simply must ignore instructions to see what happens.COMMENT_END', 'Of course I spammed the spacebar when you asked me not to.... Good start to a game.COMMENT_END', 'WEll done!COMMENT_END', 'loved it! pretty well excutednice work man!i spammed space sorryCOMMENT_END', 'Really simple, but still enjoyable!COMMENT_END', 'I appreciate different levels with different graphics, gameplay wise could be further developed by adding more doors and other features.\xa0I can\xa0imagine these squares as actual characters, like when you press ATTACK the player character could just aimlessly\xa0slash around for 3 seconds.COMMENT_END', 'This was a fun, chill game :) I like how easy it was to understand. The combat mechanic is unorthodox but pretty fun once you get used to it! Nice job, I hope you go to round 2 and develop it further!COMMENT_END']

['I had fun building the bridge, but I encountered a bug where I could not build any more.COMMENT_END', 'Really fun prototype for a game. \xa0The duck is adorable. \xa0I hope you get a chance to keep working on this - I would love to see what challenges the duck is up against,COMMENT_END', 'The game idea is cool, visuals and specially that sqake sound is spot on. One funny thing i found in the game is: if duck gets too close to shark it will raise above the see level and after it can climb on top of island. I think its minor bug adding gravity or restricting duck movement in only 2 axis will solve this. that being said I very much enjoyed this bug too.\nBehold the almighty duck carpenter descended form the havens:COMMENT_END', 'DUCKS!!COMMENT_END', 'Fun game mechanics, though I wish the night vision was more useful. Good work!COMMENT_END', 'W game, quack!COMMENT_END', 'The messages add a lot of personality to this game, though the font makes it a little hard to read.COMMENT_END', 'Cool duck game.COMMENT_END', 'This was a cozy little game with a charming duck.COMMENT_END', "Duck!Anyways, I love your submission overall. It's a very cute idea! I also loved the various messages you hid around the game. One critique I have is that it was still very easy to find the wood pieces scattered around the sea without the flashlight mechanic, and I didn't really end up using it. But other than that, great game! I would love to see this expanded upon.COMMENT_END"]

["Big fan of the art and the screen shake when you slash.\xa0 I do think some description would have helped.\xa0 It seems like this game it designed for mobile/touch screen so it took me a bit to figure out how to play it keyboard and mouse, and I wasn't sure if I was missing something.\xa0 Overall a really interesting start though!COMMENT_END", "So there are some boxes and one enemy type that turn into boxes on death, and you can sleep permanetly? No clue where the rest of the mechanics are supposed to be, but I couldn't find them.COMMENT_END", 'Fun game with some nice art.COMMENT_END']

["I'd recommend starting the speed slower at first and then speeding up because as others have mentioned it's very hard, but I really like this combo and would love to see more!COMMENT_END", 'Such a cool game idea! I like how you combine the two.COMMENT_END', "I have never tried playing two games at once until now, which is why I probably suck at this, it seems to\xa0require a crazy amount of skill to survive even for a short period, but a very interesting idea and challenge! I'd love to see what else you make. I think it would be awesome if you could choose which two games to combine from a selection.COMMENT_END", "I probably tried 8 times to even get past the first level but physically couldn't, but then again I know I suck at 2d games.COMMENT_END", "Wow, this is hard.\xa0 Are there really people out there who can do these two things at once, especially at this speed? \xa0If there are, I'm not one of them.\xa0\xa0I actually like this idea a lot, but it would have to have and easier mode that moves much slower.COMMENT_END", 'Man, really difficult, especially this late at night. But a decent concept that was a lot of fun.COMMENT_END', 'I love this concept - I only managed to beat a couple of levels, but the concept is very strong. My main issue was that the game plays very quickly right off the bat; if the earlier levels were slower and the later ones got faster, it would be easier to adjust to. I would like to see this idea developed further. Great job!COMMENT_END']

["It is very cool! Tho I didn't really understand what the purpose of the balls was? It seemed like the bounce pad was the way to go. Well done! :DCOMMENT_END", 'awfully impressed that you were able to throw a world like that together and the amazing physics\xa0in such short time.COMMENT_END', 'Interesting set of mechanics for traveling through a level. I liked all the options and had fun messing with them. Fun game.COMMENT_END', "Unfortunately,\xa0I can't get this to run on my Apple laptop. \xa0I tried it with Safari and Chrome and both times I'm just staring at a spinning ham and unable to move in any way. \xa0Sorry, I couldn't play it - it sounds like fun.COMMENT_END", 'The mechanics were difficult to learn at first.. but once I got the hang of it, I\xa0was flying around like Spiderman!Well done!COMMENT_END', "My only real complaint is that there weren't enough levels. All the mechanics work really well with each other. Even if I've seen most of these mechanics else where, I still haven't gotten to use them in a 3D environment, so it still stood out in a great way! Hope to see this game in a future round!COMMENT_END", 'I did it in a pretty slow time but can definitely see the potential in the mechanics. All works nicely and is fun.\xa0Nice job!COMMENT_END', "A fun movement game! I could not finish it due to being terrible at it an nearly developing motion sickness halfway through, but it was a lot of fun to play when I got to! i found I didn't need to use the spawnable items much in order to get through the levels, but the spring was useful for when I fell down! Good Game!COMMENT_END", 'Bam!\xa0 23.5 seconds!COMMENT_END']

["I wanted to tweak the volume but for some reason that button leads to the main game? Maybe the same thing as the previous person said. Simple smooth gameplay, but could've used some sort of a twist or a gimmick.COMMENT_END", 'I kept going back to the menu for some reason, but it was fun while it lasted.COMMENT_END', "Movement was smooth and I was able to survive and explore for a while in this game. \xa0I think you're off to a good start. \xa0I wish you the best with it.COMMENT_END", "This was fun to play.\xa0 Didn't understand what was going on or why but the constant spawning kept me on my toes as I explored the level.COMMENT_END", 'While I\xa0do realize this game is not horror or thriller, as an avid enjoyer of the eerie I\xa0must tell you: this game has hit the right spot.COMMENT_END', 'What does "Who is Mani" stand for\xa0?COMMENT_END']

['Really fun game! Love the jumping mechanic and using the drones to fly around! hahaCOMMENT_END', "The graphics were nice on this one but I couldn't figure out how to get past the second level with the drones. They must've added something that I just couldn't find as all of my jump landed short.COMMENT_END", 'The jumping felt very smooth and polished! The only thing was that it was kinda hard to know where you would end up jumping, so I little visual que would be nice, showing kinda where you would land.COMMENT_END', 'I liked this game. Finding out the right angle was a bit tough and sometimes i was falling down just at the edge :cry:\xa0but good job!COMMENT_END', 'The game was fun and easy to get into. The jumps were a little hard for me to gage but with some trial and error I was able to make progress.COMMENT_END', 'I liked the colors and how quickly I was able to get in, figure it out, and play! Good job, I hope you had fun making itCOMMENT_END']

["567 without getting any fuel or shooting as I thought the game didn't have anything besides moving, whoops. The objects being physics objects was a bit wonky, especially when the rocks would only get pushed, not destroyed. A short and sweet retro game.COMMENT_END", "I really like top down shoot 'em ups, been playing them since the 90's. I think this game has a lot of potential but I think the hit detection was more than a bit too wide. Other than that, I think it's a fun game.COMMENT_END", 'As people have said here, solid start!\xa0 It was a pretty simple game but it met the prompt well.\xa0 My only advice would be if you continue this game for future rounds, find something to give it a little razzle-dazzle to help it feel fresh since there are tons of space shooters out there.COMMENT_END', "Solid start for a space shooter! I like how the asteroids kind of have a physics to them when you hit them. I wish the enemies didn't just disappear when you shoot them, but other than that, everything feels functional and smooth!COMMENT_END", 'Well done, the game works well.COMMENT_END', "At first I\xa0didn't realise the ships gave you fuel.. :PCOMMENT_END", 'i like this style of play. for both visual cues and immersion, i think some sort of background movement that indicated i was moving forward would heavily complement the experience. i made a similar game style for my last game, but w a vast difference thematically, so this was a lot of fun to play :) i had a good time, i hope you had fun making it.COMMENT_END', 'I liked this game)COMMENT_END', 'I enjoyed the game, but I felt like, even though I shot all of the ships I could, my fuel was drecreasingCOMMENT_END', "162m! Don't know it's a good or bad score )COMMENT_END"]

["It was tough for me to do the first things, even though you listed what the order is. Sometimes things didn't work. Other than that you hit the theme of the round. I do love this style of Lynchian story telling so I really want to see you keep working on the game.COMMENT_END", "Like others have said the instructions were quite unclear, for me the instructions actually stopped updating and got stuck after cooking. The art style is at least from 130ish games entirely unique, so congrats on that. The game was quite short, but can't expect much from jam games.COMMENT_END", "This game feels like a fever dream and I'm here for it.COMMENT_END", 'This looks like a great start! Game seems to end after you eat the noodles.COMMENT_END', 'Such a good games, and have a nice jumpscare. But i think the task still not finished yet....COMMENT_END']

['I liked the atmosphere, and the story. I think it has some good potential.COMMENT_END', '3D assets are well put and the black jack game itself is well impelemented -like irl, it feels like you lose\xa0most of the time. I also had to shut it down soon after the black jack game stopped since I got honestly scared that something horrible would happen :D.\xa0So if your goal was to make a horror game, you succeed in that.COMMENT_END', 'This is fun! Good job on the game! I think some of the storytelling was confusing, but once I figured out the dream cards, it made sense.COMMENT_END', 'Hi everyone, I have just fixed the problem, you will just need to download the pck file as well now and it should all work. Thanks everyone for waiting and helping with the problem and I hope that you will all take the time to play my gameCOMMENT_END', 'Iâ\x80\x99ll try to fix the mistake I have made with the game but it wonâ\x80\x99t be until Friday night or early Saturday morning. Sorry for everyone whoâ\x80\x99s trying to play the gameCOMMENT_END', 'Not going to give any rating until the game is running, currently the  program tries to access some path that doesn\'t exist.From the webs:\r\n"Hi, you are forgetting the file ending in pck.COMMENT_END', "Did you make this game for GDKO round 1?\xa0 It looks as though it was made prior which would mean you can't enter it. If you didn't make this specifically for round 1 please can you remove it.COMMENT_END"]

['Large scale battles are fun, this one could use some more polish to make it clear what the mechanics are. Got thoroughly wasted in both battles. Good work so far.COMMENT_END', "Some indication for the currently selected unit would've been nice, but the movement mechanic did work. There really wasn't much more, but it could be expanded upon.COMMENT_END", 'I like these type of large-scale battle games, this is neat. I had some trouble getting the units to move at first but once I figured it out I proceeded to get slaughtered by enemy bullets\xa0ð\x9f\x98COMMENT_END', "Great game! Would love to see a second level, or different unit types. There's a bug where you can sneak behind the enemy and destroy them all from behindCOMMENT_END"]

["I think the mechanics of combat and spawning new fighters from those you kill work well together. There wasn't much feedback in the way of knowing how exactly the battles were working or not, and while that isn't part of the judging, I think it would have helped clarify what the core and secondary mechanics are and how they work. I could see this game has a lot of potential so I would like to see more. Plus, skeletons are awesome.COMMENT_END", 'The combat was extremely finicky with units randomly dying without any indication and no clue where the enemies or skelies are going. You can just walk through all areas without any resistance which equates to the same few enemies per camp just standing around.COMMENT_END', "Not able to run the game ( so I can't rate it), but from the screenshot seems cool.COMMENT_END", 'Its a good start. I think you need to focus on the AI polishing. Make them feel nice, maybe be able to control them with the mouse or something?COMMENT_END', 'Visuals looks awesome. I was a bit lost gameplay wise, my units were not really attacking so i just ran but never reached the end of level.\xa0It feels like this could become a really cool adventure, remind me of some Warcraft 3 scenario. Would love to see more.COMMENT_END', 'Game assets and environment looked good, but it was unclear how to attack. I think the units started attacking on their own, but it was hard to tell as only one unit would attack at a time even though they were all surrounding the enemy.COMMENT_END']

['The mechanics you choose and how you implemented them are excellent. Very well done! The aesthetics, music, and sound were great as well.COMMENT_END', "Major skill issue game for me, can't\xa0even aim to save earth (usually its just a barn). Good graphical style across the board and a good sense of progression with the upgrades as long as you can actually hitting (unlike me).COMMENT_END", 'loved it! both main and second mechanic complements pretty wellwell executedsorry humans i let earth exploded (im bad at aiming)COMMENT_END', 'This is great!\xa0Well done!COMMENT_END']

['Nice mechanic cool idea. But it could have like win lose mechanic or score and the end\xa0beacuse i dont think its a game.COMMENT_END', 'At first glance I was like "what is time movement???"COMMENT_END', 'Nice mechanic. Looking forward to see where you take it next!COMMENT_END', 'Incredible for just 3 hours! Really enjoyable mechanics.COMMENT_END', 'This is quite impressive if done in 3 hours! It does let me roleplay as a gravity wizard which is very niceCOMMENT_END', 'I like these gravity manipulation games. Well done mechanics.COMMENT_END', "Supremely well-done! I do wish there was some sort of coins collected score to go off of but I get the time restrictions and it's fun!COMMENT_END", 'You achieve a lot in just 3 hours !COMMENT_END']

["The game was fun, but I didn't mess with the spells the first time around. Went back in had some fun experimenting. Good job,COMMENT_END", "Mouse sensitivity is quite high. Also, it seems that the spells don't really do anything besides make the main attack worse. I'm kinda confused about that. Although, I do get what you are going for, and I would love to see this game expanded on.COMMENT_END", 'Had a hard time aiming well, and got nauseous after a few minutes with how fast the screen was moving.COMMENT_END', 'Mouse sensitivity is HUGE. Needs to have an options menu to control this. Otherwise, well done!COMMENT_END']

["I had fun playing, but I couldn't get past level 4 because I could not kill the ghosts. Also, it would be nice to have a crosshair to make aiming easier. Otherwise, it was pretty funCOMMENT_END", 'I like the concept, had a few issues in the game with the red and blue blocks going crazy and flying super fast. I would like to see\xa0these mechanics developed more.COMMENT_END', 'Cool game. Only big bug I experienced wwas the red block giong a bit freaky and started spinning randomly so that is great for a first game congrats.COMMENT_END', 'Well done!The only thing missing is the waka-waka sound :DCOMMENT_END', "Good job on finishing your first game in unity!A lot of people don't manage to complete it.Ghost looked funny glitching around!CheersCOMMENT_END"]

['Good choice on the game mechanics, this is a fun game.COMMENT_END', 'Cool game,COMMENT_END', 'Very fun wave game with good art. Everything has a consistent style, from the UI to the zombies. Nice work!COMMENT_END', 'Good job! It would be cool if the weapons did different things. Cause rn the knife is kinda useless once u get the gun. Otherwise good job! ;DCOMMENT_END', "A really solid start! The guns seem objectively better than the any relevant melee options, but that doesn't mean the knives aren't still fun. The game started to really slow down at wave 7-8, so I would like to maybe see more zombies spawn the quicker you kill them. because I was waiting for the next spawn interval more often than I was killing zombies. Solid across the board.COMMENT_END", "Amazing game! Couldn't figure out how to equip the guns after I bought them, though, and they didn't appear in my inventory. But overall, solid entry, the combat is fun and challenging, and I would love to see the game fleshed out. I just wish I could've gotten to experience what the guns are like.COMMENT_END"]

['The boss fight was tough. The combat mechanics were good. Missed the secondary mechanic mentioned on the game page, which is too bad because it sounds interesting. Good work for a start.COMMENT_END', 'Not sure if the second mechanic was supposed to be "pick up gun", but that guy was OP for sure. Fun to play, want to see more!COMMENT_END', "I do like to induldge every now and then in some janky Unreal Engine jam projects, and this one scratched that itch for a while. There really wasn't much besides the first level, which seems to be just a greybox, and the default shooting, which comes with the engine. Bonus points for not having raytraced 10fps jank.COMMENT_END"]

game_title: GridDots with GridBlocks that Block GridDots : GDKO '25
comments_raw: ['Fun concept! Sadly the "game engine"-less approach is holding you back since it didn\'t feel responsive enough, like I clicked but it didn\'t always do anything? Cool that you did it in Java though, good job!COMMENT_END', 'Goat game. (beware of bias from WR holder...)COMMENT_END', "At first I tried to build a base but that was generally speaking a very bad idea, after that\xa0I proceed to run in circles while internally screaming. I'm honestly impressed you managed to do this much with Java, good work!COMMENT_END"]

['Got a few mechanics in to match the theme of the round. I wish there was more to the level.COMMENT_END', 'the concept is good pretty align with the taskbut you might wanna adjust the acceleration movement of the player close to the top speed so it doesnt feel too weirdand you could make the fov value alot more big so us players can see alot better\xa0when we hold the boxcostumizable fov would be great aswellgreat concept tho i think with more time this game would be much better executedCOMMENT_END']

["The attacks being a combo between shooting and slashing, while matches the round criteria, weren't very fun for me. I think you got the theme for the round though. Also, I always appreciate a giant skull in a game.COMMENT_END", "The graphics really carried what little game there was. The shooting mechanic appeared to be completely broken as none of the enemies took any damage. Almost the same could've been said about the melee which seemed to randomly miss even if standing right next to them. The enemy variety was quite lacking as I only got one enemy besides the skulls to spawn. Audio was also quite loud.COMMENT_END", "I'm amazed that this was godot. Great job on character controller.COMMENT_END", 'Nice Game, and have a cool Mechanic. But the zombie still not have a SFX yet....COMMENT_END']

["For being able to do this in a single day??? It's very good and looking forward to seeing what you can do with two weeks.. if school isn't in the way again :PCOMMENT_END", 'Considering you put it together pretty quick I still think the idea has a lot of potential!\xa0 I think maybe a way to move further per shot would be nice but I like it as a start!COMMENT_END', 'It has a lot of potential. I think the difficulty and the movement / shooting needs a bit of tweaking.COMMENT_END', "Clever idea mixing shooting and blowback - I haven't seen that before.\xa0 I had trouble aiming, but that could have just been me. \xa0Really impressed you did all this in a day.COMMENT_END", 'Fun little game with a lot of potential.COMMENT_END', "As a fellow certified idiot I support Joe and his quest! Interesting game tho! It's like an arena shooter except my gun is so spectacularly large that I am blown 40 feet backwards every time I defend myself. Good job, especially for only doing it in a day!COMMENT_END"]

["Really cool idea!\xa0 It took me a second to realize that I could walk through the green area on the left to find the film reels, so I could've used a little more instructions, but this is a solid start!COMMENT_END", 'Love the idea of having to use the camera to take the photo and use that film to place it where you need it to progress to the next level! Would love to see what you do next!COMMENT_END', 'Very nice start! I thought the door on the left was a window at first :PCOMMENT_END', "It was confusing at first, and a little short. I would definitely like to to seem more of this, maybe you could have it\xa0without objects being removed from the scene.\xa0 Like I'm taking a picture, not moving it.\xa0Cool concept though!COMMENT_END", "The concept is interesting and I'd love to see this concept get taken somewhere. Good luck!COMMENT_END", 'I liked the concept of taking pictures of items to use them elsewhere, and it is definitely a mechanic I\'d like to see expanded on! It currently operates more like a standard inventory where you take objects from one place to another. At the same time, having film rolls act as\xa0"single use" inventory slots is an interesting change that could make for cool puzzles!COMMENT_END', 'I like the concept, but I felt that it was a bit confusing, especially the window.COMMENT_END', 'I want to preface this by saying I love the idea you have going here. Capturing objects into pictures and using them later to solve puzzles is a brilliant concept for a game. However, I don\'t think the game encapsulates the mechanics you described. Don\'t get me wrong, the mechanics are certainly there, it just doesn\'t feel like I\'m taking a photo, rather just picking the objects up. What I would have done is made the mouse the camera, putting an outline around it that acts as the "frame" of the photo, then using left click to collect the objects, rather than simply walking up to the objects and pressing a button. Again, I love the idea you have, I just would have implemented the mechanics differently if I were you.COMMENT_END']

["You got two mechanics in there, just wish there was a bit more so that you could demonstrate them better. I think it's a good start to a game and hope you keep working on it.COMMENT_END", 'Well it was a first game jam game, not really much else could be expected. Should top up on some basic Unity / programming things before the next game jam to avoid some common pitfalls.COMMENT_END', 'This is a great proof of concept! I would love to see a full game like thisCOMMENT_END']

game_title: World war 1 but you are a ball
comments_raw: ["I feel like the obstacle course by itself is a really strong entry.\xa0 I think the WWI stuff and balls war made it a little confusing, so I'd recommend making your criteria a little more clear in the future.\xa0 Fun game!COMMENT_END", 'Banger music!COMMENT_END', '!LOUD NOISES WARNING ON LAUNCH!COMMENT_END', 'The obstacle course is surprisingly well made for a game jam gamem\xa0but I must also agree with the previous comments. What a wild experience.COMMENT_END', 'The obstacles were fun to try to avoid. Not sure what is going on in the game though.COMMENT_END', "I didn't quite understand the relevance of WWI or the adding and subtracting mechanic, but I had some fun platforming!COMMENT_END", "I really don't know what this game is :/COMMENT_END"]

['Fun game with 3rd person fun. It was tough to get used to the game with instant death on every mistake, but I think the mechanics are there even if a little rough. Well done.COMMENT_END', "I\xa0can't play .rar files. I've tried 7zip, but I just can't get it to work. I'd love to try it if you know how a simple windows 10 guy like me can make it work.COMMENT_END", "This really doesn't seem like a jam game, more like someone's horizontal slice of a personal project. You probably shouldn't try deleting the player charachter in your killbox, as it crashes the game 100% of the times when you try to progress at all.COMMENT_END"]
['Why is this even here?COMMENT_END', 'AI. 0 stars.COMMENT_END', 'This so clearly aiCOMMENT_END']

["The art looks nice, but I can't make the character move.COMMENT_END", "I'm not exactly sure what I'm supposed to be doing. The character won't move.COMMENT_END", "I think the art style was nice. The text was really slow until I figure out I could press space to make it go faster. But the character wouldn't move, only turn left and right. I would like to try this once it's playable.COMMENT_END", "The intro scene is really slow and I can't move the character at all. I would like to try the game out after the bugs have been fixed.COMMENT_END", 'I would like to see the sequel)COMMENT_END']

['I think the mechanics are unique and interesting and with a bit of work and polish it could be a really awesome game.COMMENT_END', 'I like the idea a lot. I do think that the freezing of the clone kinda defeats the purose of reversing the clones controls, because I found myself going to a safe space, cloning, so i can move the clone on the right side on the button and then freezing it there to move the player onto the left button.That is why I would really like to see this game idea developed further, because there is definetly potential for the game. Cool Concept, god job!COMMENT_END', 'cool concept liked it a lot!a bit buggy but still able to get the main idea of the gamenice work man!COMMENT_END', 'A bit buggy, but a great concept! I could immediately start thinking of other tricky puzzles that would be fun to play in the future!COMMENT_END', 'A bit on the shorter side considering how long it took to get through the tutorials. Also you can skip all of the pressure plates by running over a singular one with both characters.COMMENT_END']

['The mechanics are there and they are fun. I liked the crafting mini game. Well done!COMMENT_END', 'I love the minigame its real fun, the game itself works but could use some polish. The artstyle is cute and the overall gameplay loop is fun only issues I have is that a few things seem unecesary. The energy part for sleep does not do much besides refilling maybe making trees respawn or smth makes this a necesity. Also crafting being inside of the house maybe if you could place the things you create that would make sense but now the house doesnt feel like it contributes a lot.All of these things are of course not that hard to fix and for a round 1 you did a very good job. I see you apologizing that the game is unpolished and I just want to say, be proud of what you made over 1000 people joined and only 200 managed to finish and you are one of them. Gamejam entries have a lot of bugs (even mine ) and thats okay.Gl if i see you in the next round and otherwise gl with the rest of your journey!COMMENT_END', "The crafting mechanic was quite unclear as I kept connecting the lines but for most of the tries it just refused to connect. After crafting whichever wood thing you chose you could still keep drawing even if it probably does nothing. The energy mechanic for some reason resets when you exit the building. In my opinion the cutting part should've stayed on space instead of mouse 1 as it is never explicitly told what to press and space just happened to be the last one.Cute art style in the few areas that had art, but the gameplay was extremely thin.COMMENT_END", "Congrats on managing to make a proper crafting game for a jam. It was cute and enjoyable. There was a bug where bronze axe wasn't doing what it says, it was cutting juniper tree instead, but that doesn't matter. Loved the crafting minigame, inventive.COMMENT_END", 'very interesting overall, the timings of minigames are a bit finicky.COMMENT_END', 'Two minigames complement each other well, many features and potential things to update in the future.\xa0Overall, a good game worth trying out!\xa0The only confusing thing was that when cutting trees it told me to press space when I had to press left mouse button, luckily I figured that out before leaving. Good job.COMMENT_END', "Well done! It's impressive how much you've implemented in such a short time.COMMENT_END", 'Hi there!COMMENT_END']

['A fun platformer. The difficulty options were fun. A good start to a game.COMMENT_END', "This game was cool, very solid platformer. I like the different difficulties, I ended up playing thru on easy I think. I laughed really hard that baby mode makes a crying baby sound play in the background. Impossible mode seems truly impossible lol. I would've liked the camera to be pulled back a bit to help with some of the blind jumps that were far away or far below the character while I was going for them.\xa0Great work on this!COMMENT_END", 'you did a good level designCOMMENT_END', 'I like of every difficulty uses the same base map, but manages to always make it feel unique is small but meaningful way! Although, the camera hiding obstacles off-screen makes this game way harder than it really is.COMMENT_END']

["I GOT ON THE BOX! Now what? The mechanic sounds interesting but you don't provide the player with the tools they need to understand how it works and how to use it best. I don't have any recommendations on how to teach the player how to use the mechanic because honestly I don't understand myself.COMMENT_END", "Had a tough time getting the hang of this game. There's so little there that it's hard to see what effects anything is having. I was able to use the shadow to climb onto the cube but it was very much trial and error since I wasn't sure how or why it was working.COMMENT_END", "Very confusing controls and gameplay. Not sure if a tutorial would've helped either as even the objective was quite unclear. Also not sure if you want to 1000x the gamespeed as the only option for time increase, as it felt extremely horrible to tap move and still fly off into the sunset.COMMENT_END", 'I was a little confused and couldnâ\x80\x99t figure out how to â\x80\x9cclimbâ\x80\x9d the shadows. I would highly recommend adding some more instructions in the game page. Maybe some screenshots or a video may help. You can still do that even after the submission frame closed.COMMENT_END', "I'm not sure I understand the mechanic. I was trying to manipulate time but I just ended up shooting off into the distance each time.The mechanic sounds really interesting so let me know if im doing something wrong and Ill try again :)COMMENT_END"]

["Such a cool concept. I do think the camera should switch between the players. Also some type of indication that tells you which player is currently selected. Another thing is that the platforming was a bit hard, the movement was linear so doing small tweaks wasn't possible. I think lowering the movementspeed and adding\xa0some acceraltion to the movement would be an good idea, so that you can make those small adjustments.COMMENT_END", "Character switching was a really clever idea!\xa0 As others have mentioned there are some things with the mechanic that could have been a little smoother such as switching camera, making it clear which character was selected, etc.., but overall I'm really interested to see where you take it!COMMENT_END", "Really cool mechanics and a fun game. I sometimes got confused with which button to press to change characters and ended up in a pit as a result so I\xa0think if it was one button instead of 2 to switch characters it would make it a little easier. I'm sure my speedrun will be amongst the slowest but I'll share it for anyone that wants to beat my timeCOMMENT_END", 'Interesting idea. I would have liked to see a more complementary use of the 2 characters. The player has to do it at the beginning. But later when it comes to tight platforming its not important anymore. It felt like I had to do a section 2 times instead of 1 time. In addition the hitboxes of mines were a bit to strict for my taste.COMMENT_END', 'I really liked the switching mechanics and the camera only following one of the characters added to the platform puzzles. Had a lot of, well done!COMMENT_END', 'Very interesting idea !COMMENT_END', 'It was hard. and fun! and hard. I liked the switching mechanic!COMMENT_END', 'I know this is a skill issue in thelargestdegree, but it was hard. Graphics were simple, but it worked well with the boxy nature of the levels. Simple fast paced gameplay, the respawning mechanic was a bit buggy with trails appearing after respawning and the characters clipping into each other.COMMENT_END', 'I agree with the previous comment, I just assume that the first mechanic is switch and second is platforming. But a nice little platformer, you should add a masochist mode without any checkpoints.COMMENT_END', 'cool game. itâ\x80\x99s kind of hard to guess the primary and secondary mechanic with no description but I think the box is primary and rectangle is secondary mechanic. overall game is engaging and nice.COMMENT_END']

['The game looked fun but im sorry for the missing/corrupted fileCOMMENT_END', "Seems like the game itself is missing. There's some random files that are related to the project, but not the game.COMMENT_END", "There's no exe file in the folder?COMMENT_END"]

['Reminded me a lot of laser tag. The mechanics are there and the game is fun. I\xa0think the game has a lot of potential.COMMENT_END', "Straight of the bat this did a great job at taking me back to 'Zapzone' and other laser tag places from my childhook. The map, layout, scoreboards etc were all spot on for creating that atmosphere.The enemies and the world gave a interesting fututristic impression that made me interested in the world. There was definitly a forboding atmosphere to it all and it felt very dystopian. I would like to see a little more variety in the enviroment if you carry this on. I think the layout was great but maybe some environmental hints at the story/world building?COMMENT_END", "Dope game, and rather addictive! I remember play-testing it earlier and love the polish and refinements you've put into it. Great effort!COMMENT_END", "A good game! I like the mechanics and the managing of the gun to make sure it doesn't overheat. Though I wish there was something more than just killing enemies. Good job on this though!COMMENT_END", "This game was fun! I really like the art style and it just looks very cool in general. The shooting felt good and it's fun to kill the dudes that come and attack you. I would've really liked an upgrade tree or something to spice things up after progressing thru the waves. Great job on this!COMMENT_END", "This was fun!\xa0For some reason, the mouse capture didn't work great on mine, but fun nonetheless!COMMENT_END", 'jood jame. There are lasers, and there are waves.COMMENT_END']

["I couldn't figure out the secondary mechanic but the core mechanic was well implemented and the style was nice.\xa0 The game could have used a twist of some sort to differentiate it from other runners and a little more gameplay for the player.COMMENT_END", "This is a good starting point, but I'm not sure what the second mechanic was.COMMENT_END", 'Good start to a game. Would like to see you develop it more in future rounds.COMMENT_END', 'Well done making the game!COMMENT_END', "I like the look of this and it feels like you're on the start of something good. \xa0But it also feels a little\xa0rough at this point. \xa0I would love to see it when you get more added in.COMMENT_END", 'not sure i entered a portal and it went to in development screen?\xa0Where is the coin collecting that i saw in a comment?COMMENT_END', "Reminded me of duck life! I played that thing for hours. Great job; I didn't find the player jump highly satisfying-- if you get around to it I'd love to see the ninja have a little more weight and be a little more responsive! Some more acceleration on the fall back down would feel great, I think.COMMENT_END", 'Running animation is nice, Player collecting coins and basic mechanics working so itâ\x80\x99s Good for Round 1.COMMENT_END']

['I\xa0think you got the two mechanics down, could see this being developed further.COMMENT_END', 'Gameplay is very unclear. It has a good vibe, but not sure what to do.COMMENT_END', "The mechanics seemed very odd? Some of the fires counted in the counter but some didn't, there's cube sprites blocking each others causing clipping, traps seem to have a black hole around them and they suck you in, and the map has no borders. There really wasn't much of note.COMMENT_END"]
